story:
Hello world! I'm so excited that you're here!!!✨ If you missed out on Spread Machine Cards + Oracle from Kickstarter a while ago - here's your chance to pick up a copy at the pre-order price! You'll get all the deck upgrades unlocked from the Kickstarter stretch goals (such as matte edges, upgraded box, extra guidebooks for expansion packs etc) at a slightly higher price, but still discounted & cheaper than the eventual retail price! 

 

 

I can't believe it's been more than a year since my first Kickstarter Way of the Panda Tarot - it feels like a blink of an eye and it also feels like forever. And now, as I channel my passion for spread crafting, tarot, personal development and spiritual growth all in one...I now bring to you my second complete deck project - *majestic epic uplifting orchestral music plays* - 

 

The Spread Machine Cards + Oracle is a deck of 86 cards designed to enable + empower your spread crafting process and also serve as the ultimate tool to your tarot, spiritual and personal development journey. 

With this awesome deck of cards in hand, you will be able to create millions and millions (literally) of spread combinations for yourself and anyone you read for. 

Just for funsies - guess how many combinations that are possible with 86 cards? 24227095383672732381765523203441259715284870552429381750838764496720162249742450276789464634901319465571660595200000000000000000000! *faints from math* And that's not even counting the Expansion Packs!

 

Why Create Spreads?

Why create spreads, you may ask? *rolls into scene enthusiastically in panda onesie* 

Well - for starters -  IT'S FUN AND AWESOME! And on top of that, a card spread is more than just a fixed layout telling you where to put your cards during a reading. By creating your own spread, you can make sure to include the important questions that you want to ask in order to get the insights that you seek. In many ways, a spread is like a road-map with pre-selected checkpoints that you have consciously chosen to explore and experience before the journey (or reading!) takes place.

 

How do you make spreads with it? I'm sure you've probably figured it out already: you draw cards, you put them down in a layout, and you make spreads. You may consciously choose cards with spread positions that are relevant to your question or anything you are trying to explore in a reading. You then arrange them in a logical sequence or to your liking, in a shape that appeals to you, and you conduct a reading using the spread you have just created! 

Or you know, you can also just let the Universe choose a spread for you by shuffling and drawing the cards blind - because, well, we've all been there. How many times have we felt like doing a reading but just don't know what to ask? With the Spread Machine, you will never have that problem again!  

(And if you're *internally panicking* because you have never made a spread in your life - don't worry! I've got you covered! This deck comes with a guidebook and will walk you through the steps of spread creation. You'll be a spread making machine in no time!) 

And because the Spread Machine is carefully divided into 5 categories, creating a practical + meaningful spread has never been easier:

The Spread Machine Cards + Oracle is divided into 5 categories: Seeker, Lightwork, Shadow Work, Focus Areas, and Call to Action. Each category includes spread positions that highlight concepts and areas of exploration related to the category. On each individual card, you will also find the spread position, accompanied by questions prompts, brief explanations or relevant key words, as well as which category it belongs to. 

There are infinite ways and infinite combos that you can create with the 86 cards from this deck! Imagine how many 3-card spreads that you will be able to "pull" now. (Get it? "Pull"? Because you pull out the cards from the deck? *goofy evil laugh*)

 

Growth-Based + Person-Centered 

The Spread Machine are designed with a strong emphasis of inner work and inspired action. This is not just a deck full of random prompts for you to make a reading template. This is a themed spreadcrafting deck intended for courageous truth seekers who are looking to heal, to expand, to grow and to level up their connection with tarot and themselves. 

 

And this is why this deck also extends beyond crafting and arranging spreads. The spread positions and prompts in Spread Machine are able to accommodate and complement many aspects of your tarot, spiritual and personal development practice.

 

 

 

Ok, so I'm super excited to be sharing this with you. Because, well. SQUEE. When I was working on this deck, the possibility of just how versatile Spread Machine can be really gave me serious deck-creator high. Not only can you use it for spread crafting, it can offer you SO MUCH MORE!!!! 

 

 

 

These are only some of the ways you can use this deck, and I am honestly THRILLED just thinking about how you guys are going to come up with ingenious and personalized ways of utilizing this deck that are beyond this list once this campaign is funded and the decks go out into the world. DO YOU SEE WHY I AM EXCITED!? CAN YOU FEEL MY CREATIVE CHILLS THAT HAVE CHILLS ON THEIR CHILLS!?!?!? 

The Spread Machine Cards + Oracle comes with 86 cards printed on 7 x 12CM, 350GSM high quality art paper cardstock with smooth matte lamination, all tucked into a lovely silk laminated top-down box. This is subject to change as we unlock stretch goals to upgrade and evolve this deck even more! 

The deck also comes with a 60 to 70-paged booklet within the box, which will walk you through the basics of this deck, how it can be used to benefit you and your tarot + spiritual practice, as well as a easy-to-follow spread crafting 101 guide. You will be the "ultimate spread machine" in no time! 

Note: The guidebook will not have write-ups for individual cards - it will mainly serve as a reference on *how* you can create spreads for yourself and how to best utilize this deck. 

 

 

There are 2 expansion packs available that you can choose to add to your pledge! The expansion packs are printed on the same high quality cardstock as the main Spread Machine deck, held in a 350GSM tuckbox with silk matte coating. 

The "Quest" Expansion Pack features story-infused, RPG-themed spread prompts if you're someone who likes to gamify and talk about life like it's one big adventure, with cards like "Boss Fight", "Compass" & "Enchanted Key". This expansion pack is perfect for upbeat & imaginative planning, with a geeky and fantastical atmosphere. The Quest Expansion Pack has 44 cards. 

The "Change" Expansion Pack focuses on the conscious exploration of your place in the world as well as your chosen role in contributing to social change. Discussions around identity, power structures and progress in our culture can be difficult to navigate sometimes  - which is why I wanted to create an expansion pack with spread prompts that focus on introspection, critical thinking, and meaningful dialogue. The "Change" expansion pack will serve as a practical tool for you to explore your worldview, engage in complex and nuanced ideas, and figure out your authentic voice and how YOU want to contribute to social change, in your own empowered way. The Change Expansion pack has 44 cards.

story:
Overview

Hey. My name is Gabe, and over the past 6 months, I've had the privilege of interviewing amazing people and putting together a weekly podcast on specific topics in board game design.

During those 6 months, an awesome community has come together, and it's been a pleasure to put out content each week to help people in their design journeys.

A couple weeks ago, I made a t-shirt to wear at Origins game fair, and I had a lot of people asking me about it. So, I figured a quick crowdfunding campaign would be a good way to give people an opportunity to get a shirt of their own.

 

What You Get

  • A high quality, ethically made, screen printed shirt.
  • Free shipping to anywhere in the U.S.
  • Cheap shipping to Canada.
  • An opportunity to support the BGDL.

 

Color Options

The shirt has three colors to choose from:

Red

Purple

Turquoise

BGDL Logo

Each shirt will have the BGDL logo on the left sleeve.

 

Fit

Please note that these shirts have a "fashion fit" and fit a little more snugly than cheap, mass produced shirts you find in stores like Wal-Mart. If you prefer a looser fit, consider going up a size. Consult the size chart below for best results.

 

Risks & Challenges

I've already set things up with the t-shirt shop that's going to print the shirts, and everything is sitting on G, waiting on O. There's always a chance for delays, but barring the shop burning down, nothing should cause any holdups. You should have your shirts in time for Gen Con in August.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not a fan of t-shirts, you can still help by getting the word out about the campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to post to your preferred social media channels.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Who am I and what I want to create

My name is Zolden, I'm a programmer (about 15 years experience total), working in AI research area. I started indie gamedev career 6 years ago as Starcraft2 mapmaker. I also spent 2 years working with Unity game engine, and created some games for mobile platforms.

8 months ago I started creating a major mobile game, based on Mines and Magic (my SC2 map), that would accumulate the best features of that game together with all new gameplay ideas I have.

What is Mines and Magic for mobiles

It is a cool new robust tower defence singleplayer game, where the towers you create are actually units, with a set of specialities and abilities. Those towers-units fight the enemy waves using their abils. Each level consists of a number (about 20-30) of enemy waves, and player has to survive. Game world will have about 20 levels.


There's also a deep economics level, player has to build mines on a variety of resources, to build a reliable income to afford different kinds of units. But this requires a neat strategic thinking, because the ways getting stronger, and you need to have a nice defense, but you also need build and upgrade those mines to have the income to build the towers!



Player also can research new towers with a variety of unique abils, purchase artifacts and spells, cast those spells if the times are tough.

If you ever played the original Mines and Magic, you know what I'm talking about, and aware of how fun that game is. If you never played Mines and Magic, but like tower defence or economics games, than you will like the game for sure.
Here you can see some gameplay with my comments:

So, yea, I want to create a fun new generation tower defense game for mobiles. And if you like the idea, you can help me with this this.

What We Need & What You Get

As I mentioned, I'm a coder. And in terms of code, the game is almost ready, I've been coding it for 8 months so far. But I need art, lots of art: 3d models of player towers and enemy mosnters, 2d art of interface and background images, VFX effects, also sounds and music. I'm capable of creating all of this, but it wont look or sound professional, and will take years to complete. For example, there will be more than 200 different units, each one requires a 3d model.

Creating a good model would take 2-3 days, and the only way to complete the game in a reasonable time is to hire people to create the art.

An animated 3d model can cost $20-50, and this is the main case of spendings. The rest of the sum will be used for other kinds of art the game requires.

What I'd like to give in return. Besides the game itself and the fun it will bring, I'll suggest you to have:

have access to the extra builders (which let you go riskier and trickier way to the victory)
  • get some rare artifacts and spells (normally artifacts can be gained for victories or purchased for resources)
  • you can be involved in beta testing of the game, which will happen in about 2 months
  • you can participate in the game creation by suggesting names, look and unique specialities of the towers and enemy monsters
  • you can immortalize your name by putting it in the game's credits as a major donator
If the goal will not be reached, I will still complete the game, but it will just take more time. I already have a couple of people who help me with art for free in their free time, and we will manage to release the game anyway.

Further plans

If this project is successful, I'll create one more game, a multiplayer one this time, that will make one more evolution step of the genre Mines and Magic belongs to.

My previous projects

In my days of SC2 mapmaking I created 6 major maps, they all are available at SC2 battlenet server under Arcade section:

  • "Z remake" - a remake of the good old game named Z.
  • "Heroes of Might and Magic" - a remake of this famous RPG game as real time strategy.
  • "Civilization" - yes, I remade civilization in SC2 with a great respect to the original game mechanics.
  • "Rise of Legends" - another remake of a great RTS game.
  • "Glass Castle" - I created this original game to test my TD genre ideas.
  • "Mines and Magic"
The last one, Mines and Magic, is a game of the genre, that has a history of evolution. There was Legion TD map in Warcraft3 battlenet server. Then there was Squadron TD map in SC2. And finally I decided to make a new step, use all my game design skills to create a funniest TD ever, based on those maps, but combined with many ideas I had. And after a year of every day work Mines and Magic was released.

This map has become popular during one day, and never since left the first page of popular maps in SC2 battlenet.

The whole SC2 mapmaking experience gave me great gamedev skills, and has built my ability to successfully handle big projects alone.

I also created some games for android platform, which gave me the experience I needed to move further.
So, there's no chance I abandon this project, especially considering the fact, that technically the game is almost created, only the content, like art and level design is remaining.

Other Ways You Can Help

I would appreciate if you let other people know about this project, maybe they would like to support it. So, just share this page in your social media, it may be a great help.

story:
'This is a great intuitive system that has an awesome beginning/opening which gets characters right into the action with minimal time spent on character creation. The wake up stranded on an island in a rush to grab anything essential to survive and then desperately charging into some goblin and spider infested caves gets players and DMs/GMs/Referees excited to play. The scrap gathering and item damage mechanics keep players questing. The sandbox do anything go anywhere nature of the island...'

                                                                                                                          Nekkral, Explorer of Cragbarren

What is Delve?

Delve is a fantasy RPG that has become extremely popular, it has been described as the child of D&D and Warhammer Fantasy, if they were ever to meet and have a child that is. Anyway here is a video.

Delve is available on DTRPG for only $4.99 at the moment https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/259575/Del... so go check it out!
 

The City of Gnarling

The City of Gnarling is the largest city on the island, it is a place of guilds, dangers, trade, corrupt nobles, secrets and answers. With this guide you will be able to extend your journey across the island, buy new gear, discover answers to many questions and possibly discover hidden places, important allies and dangerous enemies.

The book will contain, locations, new equipment, weapons and armour, descriptions of important NPCs, adventure hooks and rumours, guilds and factions that you can join or avoid and new threats.

Everyone that backs this project will receive a PDF and at cost code to buy the hardback for the cost of print and postage.

Is that it?

No there is more, I will also be updating and expanding upon the core rules making a Delve 2.5, this will fix any issues, add more content like races, classes, gear, spells and making all those changes that the fans have asked for, for example turning the How to Play chapter into an actual adventure you can play.

This version will also feature new art and maps.

For those that back at the Survivor + level they will receive this as a PDF and receive a at cost voucher for the hardback when it is released.

And there is more!

I will also combine all the material that has been released as PDF, currently and leading up to the release of the 2.5 edition into a hardback book, and those of you that pledge at the Survivor ++ level will receive this as a PDF and as a at cost voucher to buy this also as a hardback book.

 

If we hit £1500 the Guide to Cragbarren will also be updated and expanded with all backers receiving a PDF and Voucher to buy the Hardback at print cost +P&P.

So choose your pledge level and lets get this off the ground and into your hands, and maybe along the way we will hit a few extra bonuses.

All rewards will be sent via DriveThruRPG

Is that it?
No there is more, I will also be updating and expanding upon the core rules making a Delve 2.5, this will fix any issues, add more content like races, classes, gear, spells and making all those changes that the fans have asked for, for example turning the How to Play chapter into an actual adventure you can play.
This version will also feature new art and maps.
For those that back at the Survivor + level they will receive this as a PDF and receive a at cost voucher for the hardback when it is released.
And there is more!
I will also combine all the material that has been released as PDF, currently and leading up to the release of the 2.5 edition into a hardback book, and those of you that pledge at the Survivor ++ level will receive this as a PDF and as a at cost voucher to buy this also as a hardback book.

 
If we hit £1500 the Guide to Cragbarren will also be updated and expanded with all backers receiving a PDF and Voucher to buy the Hardback at print cost +P&P.
So choose your pledge level and lets get this off the ground and into your hands, and maybe along the way we will hit a few extra bonuses.
All rewards will be sent via DriveThruRPG

story:
Build A Cure is a cooperative strategy game in which you and your team avoided a nuclear explosion. However, the bunker that saved you was a storehouse for some of the world's worst diseases. The shockwave of the explosion caused the containment vials to break. It is up to you and your team to work together to build the chemical compounds to cure the diseases before you run out of resources. You may see your team experience symptoms and even contract more diseases that could hurt your chances of survival. Remember, the longer you stay, the more you are exposed. If you can manage to cure all of the diseases before you run out of resources, you win and can live to see another day.

 

SPECIAL EDITION CASE

How can you make an awesome card game even better you may ask? MAKE A SPECIAL EDITION / EPIC / WEATHERPROOF CASE WITH CUSTOM INSERTS!

Each case comes with a custom insert to fit 6 sets of 3 markers, and over 150 standard poker-sized cards (2.5"x3.5"). 

 HOW TO PLAY 

Rulebook download - CLICK HERE

Board Game Spotlight

Two Bats Gaming

 Long PreviewPlaythrough

PLAY

 

Solo Mode - Playthrough

Nerds Of The West

 

TRY IT OUT!

If you would like to see how it plays, check out the Tabletopia link below. You can try out a solo mode, or 3-6 player mode. I am currently working on making it closer to the actual game play, so know that there are a few small details that might be missing. I should have it all completed around 8/12. Send me a message if you find any issues that need to be corrected. Happy gaming!

 

VIDEO REVIEWS (Links)

        

WHAT'S BEING SAID?

 COMPONENTS

Resource Deck (120 Cards)

56 Element Cards

10 EXPOSURE! Cards

14 PARANOIA! Cards

10 Complex Covalent Bond Cards

8 Polar Covalent Bond Cards

5 Simple Covalent Bond Cards

3 Recycle Element Cards

3 Recycle Resource Cards

2 Fission Reduction Cards

2 Mystery Element Cards

1 Immunity Card

1 No More Resources

1 Oranges Card

1 Quarantine Card

1 Ultimate Sacrifice Card

Disease Deck (17 Cards)

10 Symptom/Event Cards

7 Disease Cards

Sabotage Deck (21 Cards)

14 Event Cards

7 Disease Cards

Reference/Tokens (12 Cards & 18 Markers)

18 Markers

6 Element Count/Disease Count Reference Cards

6 Turn Guide/Element Count Reference Cards

SOCIAL MEDIA

Don't forget to follow us on social media to get the inside scoop of what is going on. We will be sure to post updates to all our backers as often as makes sense, but let's be real, you don't want an email every day from Kickstarter just to see what I am working on. That is where social media comes in! I post regularly to Instagram/Facebook/Twitter so you can see what's happening each day, without those pesky emails. 

BGG: CLICK HERE

TIMELINE

 As you will see, the timeline is fairly spread out. Why would I do this? Well, I want to make sure you get the best possible product. I also want to make sure that it arrives at your doorstep in one piece. So I decided to wait until after the crazy busy shipping season to get you your copies. Since you have to wait so long, I wanted to make sure we offered you some options for those who wanted to give these as Holiday gifts. Everyone who backs this project through one of the listed reward tiers will receive the digital print and play version of the game. This way you can print it out at home and give it a go before your physical cards arrive!

#PLAYTESTITFORWARD

Since this was the first card game I created, I wanted to be able to bring something new to the world of gaming. I knew it was going to be hard to get my game out there when there are thousands of them already in circulation. So I came up with the #playtestitforwardcampaign.

I reached out to various accounts on social media to see if they would be interested in playtesting the game early in development. I would ship them a copy of the game in a prototype Special edition case, and they would try it out and give me feedback. I would then send them a shipping label and they would send it on to the next house. 

I was blown away by the response from the campaign. I couldn't believe that after 3 short months of running it, the games had been to over 50 different homes around the world! I have one in Australia, one in the UK, two in Canada and 5 traveling around the US. 

It was a lot to handle, but in the end, it was a blast getting to talk with all of these wonderful gamers around the world. It is great to see how the love for collaboration and friendly (sometimes not so much ;) ) competition can bring us all together. I can't wait to use this campaign again in the future for all of the games that I come out with (yes, I have like 4-5 more already bouncing around). 

 

Demo Sessions

Over the last few weeks, I have gotten to attend some of the best small Cons and Expos on the East coast. Charcon 2018 was so great! For a small con, it sure had some dedicated gamers. Over the three day weekend, I barely got a few minutes to stop and breathe. The demo sessions were non-stop. Although it was crazy, I wouldn't have it any other way. I loved seeing the families or friends work together to survive the game. We also made history with the first two uses(pics below) of the Ultimate Sacrifice card! 

Another great event was the Southern Fried Gaming Expo. It was a blast being a part of this multi-platform gaming group. Whenever the booth slowed down I got to run into the arcade area and challenge my friends to some arctic thunder!

CharCon 2018      

Beginnings/Mechanics/Playtesting 

Now, if you are interested in how I designed the mechanics for the game, or even how the idea of the game came about, keep reading here. There are some cool facts about the evolution of Build A Cure.

So the idea of the game was actually brought about because my Mother-in-law (Anne) wanted to have a game that she would enjoy playing with the rest of the family. We love games like Catan and Carcassonne but hadn't really dealt with anything deeper. We mainly dabbled in gateway games. So for her birthday, I decided I was going to make a game for her. Now my background is in computer science, so the chemistry of it was not a natural thought for me.

When I was brainstorming what the theme would be, I ended up always coming back to the idea that we are always fighting illnesses. It is one thing that we can never beat. It is also the science behind it that so quickly can bring together two completely different people. If they both suffer from the same disease, they will ignore all of their differences in order to come up with a Cure together. So the foundation of the game began to take form.

 

Next, I knew that the mechanics needed to be solid. So I started to do some research and found a few dozen diseases that were known to be weaponized, because who doesn't love a conspiracy theory? Anyway, I found dozens of these diseases and the compounds/treatments/cures that corresponded to each one. I noticed pretty quickly that there were a few elements that were very common between the cures, so I did what any other computer science/engineer would do... I made a spreadsheet! Now, not only did I make a spreadsheet, but I formulated calculations that would help me determine the probability of occurrence and likelihood of duplication in a deck with 7 (of course it is my favorite number) other diseases.

After around 2,000 calculations I finally determined which diseases could be in the deck. I had to limit them to diseases that had 5 or fewer elements because, with any more, the game would be impossible to play. So I stuck with the basics: Carbon, Hydrogen, Nitrogen, Oxygen, and Sulfur.

 

Now the great thing is these spreadsheets not only told me what diseases would be in the game, but how many of each element should be included to make it the minimal amount of cards, while still giving the opportunity to solve each disease once, if you happened to have the worst luck known to man and contract each disease found in the game!

So I printed out the cards and came up with the first deck. It was great, but there were multiple mechanics that I found just didn't work. For example, I included the charge of each atom for the first revision because the types of bonds will actually heavily rely on this aspect in the science of bonding. It was scientifically accurate but did not make for a fun game at all, so it was dropped fairly quickly. Although there were small changes that needed to happen, what we found was that the game was genuinely fun. 

The mechanics worked so well starting off because the math was so solid. Now don't get me wrong, the game has changed so much since then, but the fact remains that each thing you change about a game is a calculation that must be taken into account as a game designer. Even if you think it is a small change, it has the potential to make or break your game.

 

Anyway, since then, it has been playtested hundreds of times. I personally can't tell you how many times I have played the game. Thankfully I have dozens of games that I can sit back and be the GM. Now the unique thing about developing a cooperative game is that when I get to sit back and watch, I have the "watch the world burn" mentality. Since I made the game, every time someone loses, I kind of win. Haha now, this makes for some great banter between the players and myself at times. At times I can see how they are able to win, but I have to let them make the choices, so I just give them the disapproving father look when the just missed their chance to cure a disease.

 

So I am sure if you made it to this point you know way more than you expected to know about the game. I applaud you for making it this far, but I guess I have to challenge you to beat the game *evil genius laugh*...

 The film was edited by: Paul Hinton.

Sky Developed LLC © 2018

PLAY NOW!

Risks and challenges

This will be my 6th Kickstarter to share with you all. I ran one myself, two of them with my wife, and two others for some really awesome artist friends. You can check em out: 
Ink The States - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/kyrahinton... 
Ink The Earth - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/kyrahinton... 
Ink The Planets - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/paulhinton... 
Resurrect the Hymns - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1300871255... 
& 
Colleen Elizabeth Art: Making Prints & Finishing Studio - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/642674840/...

So as you can see, I am well versed in the Kickstarter world. The biggest challenge I see will be coordinating with the manufacturer/shipping integrators. It is going to be a task, but I am excited to get into the spreadsheets! ( Yes, I am a rare breed. I love the spreadsheets and ALL the data!!!)

Anyway, there are bound to be obstacles that I cannot even fathom at this stage of the project, but I will do everything humanly possible to make this one of the best campaigns you have ever backed!

-----------

I COULD NOT HAVE DONE ANY OF THIS WITHOUT MY FAMILY! Thank you so much Kyra, Josh, Brian, Anne, and Selah. You all are so supportive and have some super rad skills. From graphic design to watching my lil one, you all have been incredible.

As for Kyra, she is a trooper. I kept her up past 2 AM many nights working on this project. I can't remember how many times we both fell asleep next to each other working on our various business details. It is a hard life running a small business, but I couldn't imagine anyone better to do it with!

HUGE SHOUTOUT to Jonny Jimison! This man was so helpful in developing the art that you see today. He also contributed some incredible game mechanic analysis that helped shape some of the features in the game. Go check out his Patreon page to stay updated with his fantastic work!

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/jonnyjimison/overview 
Website: http://jonny-jimison.squarespace.com/

Special thanks to GD Photography for helping us get some video shots for the Kickstarter video.

If you are curious about the awesome shirts I am wearing in the Kickstarter video, go check out Geeky Goodies. They have some awesome gamer shirts and so much more.

https://www.geekygoodies.com/

Finally, a special thank you to Dakota and Jason. These guys were the early playtesters that rocked out a game every day during lunch for months. I couldn't have gotten the game anywhere close to what it is now without their help!

Thanks to SoundBible for the sirens and the nuclear explosion sounds! 
http://soundbible.com/tags-explosion.html

story:
About Me 

Hi, I'm Anthony Christou, the creator of the comic and card game Luminous Ages! I have had the pleasure to also work on Path of Exile and many other cool video games. My art work has won international and national awards for digital and traditional painting. This year my work has been a finalist on four awards. Recently I was a finalist and won an award with the incredibly prestigious Art Olympia  in Tokyo Japan.  

Through out all this my gaming mats have been a constant source of pride for me and a fan favourite. But I feel that I have never done them justice, never showcasing the full variety that my art makes possible. And so It is time to release these finalist and award winning artworks to the public with my largest range of gaming mats ever!

 

Welcome to the Gaming Mat Spectacular!

This project is so unique because for the first time I have 21 options right from the launch of my campaign. This is the most designs released all at once plus I will unlock new and never before printed gaming mats as stretch goals for you to purchase.  

Every $750, 5 more options will unlock! 

Merlin and the Dragons

 

Order from the Largest Range of my gaming mats and sizes!

Great news I have found a new gaming mat supplier who I have been working with for the last month and they have created amazing gaming mats of my art. Even better news is they are allowing me no minimum order quantity. This means I can release more variety in my gaming mats, featuring artworks that have never been gaming mats plus past hits, including artworks that have been finalists and award winners.  

 

The Greek Griffin Griffos is free and now available in all sizes and the art work is finished

As a bonus option I have unlocked Cerridwen for fans 
Thank you to Tamika Miligan for modeling for this art

You may say why gaming mats?

Gaming mats are one of my most popular products and I constantly have fans asking for their favourite of my art to be a gaming mat. However previously this was impossible due to limitations set by my past supplier. Fortunately I found the most amazing supplier who has no minimum order quantity on each design. The quality is amazing and will allow me to offer more sizes! I have had so many PC gamers ask for larger sizes for their desktops and I am so glad with this indiegogo I can finally say yes, I can. I want to release as many as possible.  This is your chance to get the exact art work and dimension you need and to grab gaming mats that are exclusive and limited edition.

Many Genres

Previously nearly all my gaming mats have been my more well know fantasy and fairy tale art. But I have a much wider range of art that I have created over the years, including my other favourite themes of Horror, Mythology and Science fiction, which I can now also offer.

 

SIZE OPTIONS

Regular Gaming Mat 35 x 60cm  Featuring edge stitching for added durability.  

Large Gaming Mat 40x70cm Featuring edge stitching for added durability. 

Extra Large- 40x80cm. For the PC Gamer or Tabletop Adventure!
Featuring edge stitching for added durability.  


The New Designs!

Ship Portal (Escaping Climate Change is a fantasy)  
Finalist on the Lethbridge Art Prize June 2019

Griffin - Opening Portals to many dimensions!
(Image is a work in progress and will be updated during the campaign)

Thalassa Godess of the Sea  (40x70cm)

The Prize Winner

 

I was an award winner in the Art Olympia and my work was sold to the Art Olympia Gallery and in permanent collection in the Tokyo Gallery! Only one canvas was ever made but now you can get it as a gaming mat!

Award winning artwork and purchased by the Art Olympia Committee in Tokyo Japan!

On this project you can commission a play mat

$1200 includes 7 play mats of your choice including your design. Here is an example of a past commissioned gaming mat for a fan of the Luminous Ages series, who love it.
Kitsune based on Japanese mythology.

Creatures or environments based on fantasy or mythology are preferred. However I am also willing to discuss some types of horror, science fiction or classic literature, such as Cthulhu or Cheshire Cat. 

The rest of the 21 design options available on launch


Wolfs Howl is also available but only 50 are left. The first 50 backers get the chance to select this limited edtion gaming mat.


 

Stretch Goals

$2500 - 5 More Gaming Mats Unlocked

$3250 - Cheshire Badge for free

$4000 - 5 More Design Options unlocked to choose from.

 

 

Risks and challenges

I have communicated with multiple gaming mat suppliers and have one supplier who has guaranteed three different sizes with a very low minimum order quantity. I have already gotten some samples from them to ensure smooth production and quality. All sizes have stitching and are premium quality. I have ordered all three sizes as samples and they look amazing.
 
I have been making gaming mats since 2014 and I have always delivered them to fans. My team and I have fulfilled many Kickstarters and patreon rewards before, with only some minor delays. Delays are mostly caused my conventions and manufacturers however even then I always do my best to keep everyone up to date and well informed.

But I feel that I have never done them justice, never showcasing the full variety that my art makes possible. And so It is time to release these finalist and award winning artworks to the public with my largest range of gaming mats ever! Welcome to the Gaming Mat Spectacular!This project is so unique because for the first time I have 21 options right from the launch of my campaign. This is the most designs released all at once plus I will unlock new and never before printed gaming mats as stretch goals for you to purchase.  Every $750, 5 more options will unlock! Merlin and the Dragons Order from the Largest Range of my gaming mats and sizes!Great news I have found a new gaming mat supplier who I have been working with for the last month and they have created amazing gaming mats of my art. Even better news is they are allowing me no minimum order quantity. This means I can release more variety in my gaming mats, featuring artworks that have never been gaming mats plus past hits, including artworks that have been finalists and award winners.   The Greek Griffin Griffos is free and now available in all sizes and the art work is finishedAs a bonus option I have unlocked Cerridwen for fans Thank you to Tamika Miligan for modeling for this artYou may say why gaming mats?Gaming mats are one of my most popular products and I constantly have fans asking for their favourite of my art to be a gaming mat. However previously this was impossible due to limitations set by my past supplier. Fortunately I found the most amazing supplier who has no minimum order quantity on each design. The quality is amazing and will allow me to offer more sizes! I have had so many PC gamers ask for larger sizes for their desktops and I am so glad with this indiegogo I can finally say yes, I can. I want to release as many as possible.  This is your chance to get the exact art work and dimension you need and to grab gaming mats that are exclusive and limited edition.Many GenresPreviously nearly all my gaming mats have been my more well know fantasy and fairy tale art. But I have a much wider range of art that I have created over the years, including my other favourite themes of Horror, Mythology and Science fiction, which I can now also offer. SIZE OPTIONSRegular Gaming Mat 35 x 60cm  Featuring edge stitching for added durability.  Large Gaming Mat 40x70cm Featuring edge stitching for added durability. Extra Large- 40x80cm. For the PC Gamer or Tabletop Adventure!Featuring edge stitching for added durability.  The New Designs!Ship Portal (Escaping Climate Change is a fantasy)  Finalist on the Lethbridge Art Prize June 2019Griffin - Opening Portals to many dimensions! (Image is a work in progress and will be updated during the campaign)Thalassa Godess of the Sea  (40x70cm)The Prize Winner I was an award winner in the Art Olympia and my work was sold to the Art Olympia Gallery and in permanent collection in the Tokyo Gallery! Only one canvas was ever made but now you can get it as a gaming mat!Award winning artwork and purchased by the Art Olympia Committee in Tokyo Japan!On this project you can commission a play mat$1200 includes 7 play mats of your choice including your design. Here is an example of a past commissioned gaming mat for a fan of the Luminous Ages series, who love it.Kitsune based on Japanese mythology.Creatures or environments based on fantasy or mythology are preferred. However I am also willing to discuss some types of horror, science fiction or classic literature, such as Cthulhu or Cheshire Cat. The rest of the 21 design options available on launchWolfs Howl is also available but only 50 are left. The first 50 backers get the chance to select this limited edtion gaming mat. Stretch Goals$2500 - 5 More Gaming Mats Unlocked$3250 - Cheshire Badge for free$4000 - 5 More Design Options unlocked to choose from.  Risks and challengesI have communicated with multiple gaming mat suppliers and have one supplier who has guaranteed three different sizes with a very low minimum order quantity. I have already gotten some samples from them to ensure smooth production and quality. All sizes have stitching and are premium quality. I have ordered all three sizes as samples and they look amazing. I have been making gaming mats since 2014 and I have always delivered them to fans. My team and I have fulfilled many Kickstarters and patreon rewards before, with only some minor delays. Delays are mostly caused my conventions and manufacturers however even then I always do my best to keep everyone up to date and well informed.

story:
What's the Deal?

If you're reading this you know me through facebook, instagram, or tumblr as those are the only places I post my art... I mean there is DeviantArt too but we don't talk about DeviantArt... Either that or you randomly go searching for campaigns to fund, which in that case LOOK NO FUTHER!

  • Name: Mark! AKA MarkCT AKA Markctillustration (Fun fact when I was little I didn't know I had a middle name...)
  • Wants: To fund this campaign to get the funds needed to order a physical supply of my game. 
  • Hopes: To take those games to various places (breweries, coffee shops, your local comic shop, invite myself to parties) and market the heck out of them! 
  • Dreams: Super stretch powers like Elastigirl and Elongated Man.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where Indiegogo tells me to "Break it down for folks in more detail:"

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
    • My goal is $500! All $500 goes to buying copies of the game through The Game Crafter. A super neat company that specializes in made to order card games and other accoutrements. (They also specialize in customer service!) 
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
    • Oh man... The Perks!!!! Depending on how much you contribute to this campaign is directly proportional to how excited you will get. Perks could include....
      • Animal pun stickers! Who doesn't love animals and puns?!
      • A special "Campaign only" card in your deck!
      • A card RE-DESIGNED in your (or a suggested) likeness!
        • Did you read that right? RE-DESIGNED! I will literally go back and draw an entire card again just for you!!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.
    • Same place as if I got them all! Buying physical copies!

 

Risks & Challenges

Now we get real... The game is not done...BUT!... It WILL get done... This campaign is my "deadline" of sorts. I can't leave anyone hanging if they contribute. If there aren't any stakes it will take me forever to finish this. So now that you have lit a fire underneath me this thing is going to get done, and it is going to be fun, and it is going to get done! I ran into a problems when the newest Mac OS wouldn't let me open any of my old CS5 Photoshop files. It set me back a bit, but I worked around it and I'm back on track!

 

BUT to keep me honest I'll be posting updates weekly. You'll get fun sneak peaks at the game as we go if you are a contributor! 

Take a look at a sample of the 3 types of cards in the deck. There are disaster cards, protection cards, and character cards. Oh aren't they just the bee's knees?!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share on Facebook!
  • Share on Instagram!
  • Share on Tumblr!
  • Stay off DeviantArt unless you REALLY like Sonic

And that's all I have to say about that!

story:
Fiends & Foes are 5e chibi style monster cards with cool art on the front and the monster's stat block on the back.   There are 6 decks with 44 cards in each!  That's a total of 264 cards!  The cards are tarot size (70mm x 121mm, 2.75" x 4.75") giving them plenty of space for the artwork and stat blocks.

Please keep in mind that the rewards are for digital copies of the decks and codes to order the physical cards for the cost of printing. 

 

 

The Front has chibi style art and the monster's name only.  This makes it easy to show the card to your players without giving away any information!

The Back has a full stat block with the information organized in the most useful way.  At the bottom, space-permitting, there is sometimes a random encounter seed to give the PCs an interesting reason to run across that monster.  

 

 

There are 6 Decks, each with 40 cards (+2 from each stretch goal!) in them.  Every deck will have a different background color scheme that will match the box to make sure you don't mix them up and give some visual variety!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Each deck costs ￥1100 (about $10 USD).  This does not get you the actual, physical deck.  You choose the decks you would like from the 6 decks.  You will receive digital versions of them and a code to order the deck at-cost.  For each deck you order, you will receive the following:   

 

So first, you will receive the digital versions of the decks you chose.  Along with that, you will get a coupon to order the cards for only the cost of printing + shipping from Drivethrucards. The printing cost for 40 cards is around $8.50.  So you can get the PDFs and then decide whether you'd like the cards as well or would rather just print them yourself.  

Drivethrucards ships internationally.  You can find more specifics about the Printing and Shipping costs in the FAQ.

 

 

Collector's Edition tier backers will be able to get this coffee table book (8.5" x 11") filled with every monster pic we draw, which means that it can range from 160 - 400 pages and will be in alphabetical order.  We thought it'd be cool to flip through it and check out the art in more detail, but it's really just a thank you for a lot of support.  Collector's Edition tier backers will also get at cost codes for 5 posters (12" x 18").  They can choose from any monster we've done.

 

 

We're turning to Indiegogo to gather funds so we can devote as much time to this project as possible!  We're just two guys working on this and we want to put our other current projects and commissions on hold and devote our time to this project.  This is a big project and the more we raise, the more time we can spend making this a reality.

By choosing to use Drivethru for fulfillment, we have taken a lot of the burden off of ourselves. They will handle all printing and shipping for us. The only real difficulty on our end is finishing all of the art and making the cards. We can produce the Core Four decks by January 2019 and if we raise enough funds to unlock the 5 stretch goals, we'll have plenty of time to devote to this project to make sure those decks are done by May 2019. We intend to work on the decks in order and release each one as soon as it's finished.

Real world problems could cause delays, but we both have good jobs and pretty stable lives. We don't foresee any problems and, if there are, we have friends who can step in and take over the project for us.

That said, this is our first RPG release, but we're not without experience. Ben has a great deal of design and publishing experience while creating textbooks for his language school, so he's familiar with the publishing industry. And Mikoarc has been a freelance artist for many years. Plus, by using Drivethru, almost all of the headaches associated with publishing go away so I'm pretty confident we can make this happen.

story:
The Seanche’s Lament (shana-khi) is Frog God Games’ offering for St. Patrick’s Day 2021, an adventure based on Irish and Celtic folklore by Ian McGarty. The adventure will be available for three rule-systems: 5th Edition D&D, 1st Edition Pathfinder, and Swords & Wizardry.

The Seanche, a legendary bard, has traveled the lands for hundreds of years. It isn’t known if the name is a title that gets passed on, or whether the Seanche is a supernatural being, but the Seanche’s arrival is always greeted with joy. Recently, though, his tales have taken a dark turn as a result of a deadly wager lost, and his presence is spreading havoc.  Can the characters discover the facts behind the chaos and prevent the rise of the Serpent Priest?

 

This sandbox-style adventure offers a wide variety of challenges and encounters, against a backdrop of legends, tales, rumors, and fey creatures of (at best) ambiguous morality. From the terrifying cave of the Doirche, to the Wizard’s Weal Tavern, to the Giant’s Feast, to fey courts and a deadly confrontation in the Hartwood, The Seanche’s Lament is a picaresque adventure of epic proportion. Fans of Jack Vance’s Lyonesse series and anyone who enjoys Celtic folklore will find themselves right at home in this environment.

The adventure contains:

  • 15+ New Monsters
  • 4 Fully-detailed NPCs
  • 9 New Magic Items

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Seanche's Lament and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

After the project ends a second coupon is provided allowing supporters' digital rewards to their DriveThruRPG.com PDF library.

Softcover Perks

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

D&D is a trademark of Wizards of the Coast, not of Frog God Games, and is not to be considered used under the terms of the Open Game License by any mention herein.

story:
The World Council is a card game for you to experience Global Cooperation, Horrible Leaders, Despicable Plans and World Destruction.

You are one of the country leaders in The World Council. All players strive to be the first to achieve their countries’ objectives, while preventing the ambition of other leaders, as well as the end of the world.

Prepare for the tension and conflict coming from the other players, you will never know when will they be ally or your foe. Each game will be quick and simple, but always a different experience.

The World Council is a secret committee unknown to most. They gather leaders from various countries around the globe to determine the policies of our world.

Its main objectives is maintaining peace, fostering social and economic development, and making sure the world is sustainable for mankind.

However, result always comes with a price, the development for general well being can also foster the coming Doomsday. Can the councilors work together for a better future?

 

What's in the box ?

*Doomsday Card Upgraded to Doomsday Board !

Download Rule Book below Here

 

Perks

Collection Pack will include Hot stamping (silver in color) on the box and Luminous Noctilucent Glow Cards, which is different from Council Foundersand War Councilors edition.

Cold War Expansion will include a new gaming mode. Councilors will split into two teams. While following your leader to fulfill the teams' achievement, your opponents will also try to stop you. Everyone in this game are able to change they faction when they pay the cost, which will make the game more unpredictable!

Disaster Expansion will include some random events. Councilors need to face them together in order to make the world a better place and save their country from destruction!

Stretch Goals

Shipping

 

 

The World Council is made by Creator Studio, a game and product designing studio based in Hong Kong. Creator Studio is a young and energetic studio, we are passionate about creating fun and inspiring product.

 

The team behind The World Council includes artists, illustrators, and graphic designers like Emily Leung, Leanne Lee and Scarlet C. Translators includes Ryanand Yihan. And my dear friends and teammates. A huge thanks to all of them for founding The World Council.

We have been working closely with Recnow, Starpalyers and HKFEEL, Channelsbased in Hong Kong. Thank you for showing the world that the creativity in Hong Kong!

Finally, we would like to thank all of the friends who greatly helped us and encouraged us. Without you, we cannot go this far.
story_txt: The World Council is a card game for you to experience Global Cooperation, Horrible Leaders, Despicable Plans and World Destruction.You are one of the country leaders in The World Council. All players strive to be the first to achieve their countries’ objectives, while preventing the ambition of other leaders, as well as the end of the world.Prepare for the tension and conflict coming from the other players, you will never know when will they be ally or your foe. Each game will be quick and simple, but always a different experience.The World Council is a secret committee unknown to most. They gather leaders from various countries around the globe to determine the policies of our world.Its main objectives is maintaining peace, fostering social and economic development, and making sure the world is sustainable for mankind.However, result always comes with a price, the development for general well being can also foster the coming Doomsday. Can the councilors work together for a better future? What's in the box ?*Doomsday Card Upgraded to Doomsday Board !Download Rule Book below Here PerksCollection Pack will include Hot stamping (silver in color) on the box and Luminous Noctilucent Glow Cards, which is different from Council Foundersand War Councilors edition.Cold War Expansion will include a new gaming mode. Councilors will split into two teams. While following your leader to fulfill the teams' achievement, your opponents will also try to stop you. Everyone in this game are able to change they faction when they pay the cost, which will make the game more unpredictable!Disaster Expansion will include some random events. Councilors need to face them together in order to make the world a better place and save their country from destruction!Stretch GoalsShipping  The World Council is made by Creator Studio, a game and product designing studio based in Hong Kong. Creator Studio is a young and energetic studio, we are passionate about creating fun and inspiring product. The team behind The World Council includes artists, illustrators, and graphic designers like Emily Leung, Leanne Lee and Scarlet C. Translators includes Ryanand Yihan. And my dear friends and teammates. A huge thanks to all of them for founding The World Council.We have been working closely with Recnow, Starpalyers and HKFEEL, Channelsbased in Hong Kong. Thank you for showing the world that the creativity in Hong Kong!Finally, we would like to thank all of the friends who greatly helped us and encouraged us. Without you, we cannot go this far.

story:
What is KARMA?

KARMA is a brand new story roleplaying game from Frenzy Kitty Games. The game is designed for 3-5 players and each session plays in about 2 hours. Additionally, there is no game master required - each player takes turns framing and directing scenes and having agency over the narrative. 

KARMA features a brand new GM-less engine known as the KARMA system. In this system other players will get to add a complication to your scenes (thus keeping everyone engaged in every scene, even when their character is not present) and each player tracks their KARMA throughout the game, which will have an impact on how their finale plays out. It is a  game where good and bad people get what they deserve... usually.

In KARMA, you and your friends will choose from a variety of story modules, each of which comes with its own set of unique characters, relationships and worldbuilding options. These modules are customized every time you play, so no two games will ever be the same.

The game requires zero preparation - all you need is the book, some character sheets and a handful of six-sided dice and you're ready to tell an amazing, engaging and dramatic story.

KARMA features 8 modules (with more potentially unlocked through this campaign):

  • BLACK FRIDAY
  • THE HAUNTING
  • THE COLD WINDS OF CHUQUISACA
  • THE LOOT DILEMMA
  • FROSTMEAD HIGH
  • THE DESCENT
  • GEMINI
  • PARADISE

The game is already written and laid out - this campaign will help us add more artwork and content and make KARMA the best it can be!

Thank you for your interest in KARMA.

Beyond the Trispyre

All backers will also receive a copy of our brand new fantasy RPG, Beyond the Trispyre!

 

Media and Previews

Gameplay Tutorial:

Red Dice Diaries Video Overview:

 
How's Your KARMA Preview:
http://www.risingphoenixgames.com/blog/hows-you...

 

Skirmish Supremacy Podcast

https://www.spreaker.com/user/skirmishsupremacy...

Stretch Goals

The game is already written and ready to go, but that doesn't mean that we wouldn't like to see even more value packed in! Here are some of our planned stretch goals:

  • $800 (funded): "How to Play" Video Tutorial [UNLOCKED!]
  • $1000 "THE JOB" (working title) module by Rodney Sloan (Rising Phoenix Games & Fat Goblin Games)[UNLOCKED!]
  • $2000: "THE PLAGUE" module by jim pinto (Post World Games)
  • $3000: "TRIBUNAL" module by Gareth H. Graham

We will add more stretch goals once these are unlocked! How exciting!

Timeline

If we fund, we will send all the backers the current beta version of the game in PDF format via DriveThruRPG. Once you've got that in your hands, we will spend the next 4 weeks finishing up the book by adding in any extra content, stretch goals and artwork. Once that is done, you will all immediately be sent your updated PDF copies (updated files on DriveThruRPG). While you enjoy your digital copies of KARMA, we will be carefully examining our proof copy of the softcover from the printers before shipping your physical copies off to you!

Referral Rewards

We appreciate it a hell of a lot (more than you know) when you share the campaign on social media. Spreading the word is how we can get this game funded! We appreciate it so much that we want to reward you for doing it, so we are launching Referral Rewards!

Firstly, you need to be a backer of KARMA and signed in to your Indiegogo account (this is so we have your email address to send you your rewards). Then all you need to do is share the campaign using the social media buttons on the campaign page.

If you get 5 people to back the campaign through your links, then you will be gifted the entire DUSK bundle on DriveThruRPG. DUSK is our post apocalyptic roleplaying game which was released last year to a fantastic reception.

So log in, share and earn those delicious rewards! Thank you for helping us to make this campaign a success!

Risks & Challenges

The book has already been written (with the exception of any unlocked extras through this campaign) and laid out. We will be using DriveThruRPG for all our fulfilment as this minimises risk and lowers cost (by allowing us to ship directly from the printer to your door).

We have used DriveThruRPG for all our RPG publishing needs up to this point and have been extremely satisfied with their service. It is because of this that we are confident in their abilities to fulfil this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for supporting us. If you find yourself in a situation where you are unable to back the project on a financial level but still want to help, please consider:

  • Telling your friends and your game group about KARMA.
  • Share the campaign on any social media platforms (there are handy share buttons at the top of the page)

Thanks again for your kind support!

Frenzy Kitty Games

story:
Welcome to 10,000 TOKENS for RPG on Indiegogo. My aim is to create ten thousand NEW fantasy-based furniture, decor, infrastructure, vehicular, nature-themed tokens to suit fantasy-themed RPG's in a top-down photo-realistic art style. My present collection is approximately a few thousand but I would like to attempt a truly massive and comprehensive set that provides virtually everything a fantasy setting needs in one pack. Not only that - but this project was just funded on Kickstarter so it is definitely going ahead.

Making tokens is difficult, pain-staking work that requires making every small detail from scratch such as digitally creating a jug - then a piece of fruit, then a few more pieces of fruit, then a bowl to go underneath it, then making those pieces look like they belong in the bowl using correct shadow and lighting, then adding that arrangement to a table so the bowl looks like it is sitting on the table and so on - just a few simple pieces like that can take a few hours to initially create. Once however, the jug is created, (a single digital element) it can be more easily modified and re-used in other arrangements (cluster) - but even so it requires thousands of such small details to be created so that there is enough variation not to recognize an element frequently. With the creation of each element it becomes easier to make new clusters but this work is not for everyone and requires great attention to detail, digital software skill and artistic finesse to look decent. I usually specialize in maps but over the 4 years I have been working in this industry it became a frequent requirement to create tokens for those maps so now I am finally turning my attention directly to these little creatures to make the worlds biggest single set.

My 10,000 tokens will be provided as individual hi-quality PNG tokens sized and ready to go for Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds Virtual Table Top Programs (Inc Unity) formats both of which backers will be given access to so they can choose the best format for the job.  My current/previous tokens (and maps) are presently available from Roll20, Fantasy Grounds, D20pro, Steam and from my website Game Tile Warehouse. Here are some existing examples of my tokens art style: 

And here is a snapshot of some of the 950 tokens already completed for previous campaigns, token packs or projects to give some indication of just how many I have made: though I also have a set on my website with 1100+ which is different altogether as well and would estimate my collection at around 5000 or more. But I intend to make 10,000 totally new ones. Tokens will be high-res, scaleable, and individually supplied and well categorized and named.

Samples of some of my tokens used on Fantasy Grounds Default Maps:

In the course of making more than 1000 battle-maps in the past four years, I have created a vast range of fantasy tokens - possibly already more than ten thousand, but I have never made a concerted effort to focus on tokens and I want to really expand these and cover thousands of tokens I feel are missing from the range: more of everything and 90% new tokens inc: traps, treasures, relics, doors, obstacles, hazards, statues, furnishings, adornments, campsites and equipment, natural features, and virtually every item an adventurer can expect to encounter with stylings from the very rich to the dirt poor - from finely crafted to make-shift, to broken or side-on. I want to have a versatile, enormous token set range to match the vast dungeon tile and battle map collection I already offer. I want to create more tokens to suit Sewers, Armories, Tombs, Professions Shops, City Trash, Cobwebbed/Burned/Broken Decor for Ruins and Abandoned Places, Underwater, Rusted, and extensive furnishings for popular folk such as Elven, Orcish, Dwarvish.  

My aim is to select an area such as a Battlefield for instance and craft 200 or so tokens dedicated to its thematic requirements: in this case, from below we might expect battering rams, ballistas, siege engines, arrow shields, wall ladders, corpses, armarments, banners, trenches that you can just drop down to create the illusion of dug-out ground, supplies and ammunitions - while from the defending side we might wish for vats of boiling oil, spiked caltrops, huge crossbows, and other defenses to be dropped from the castle walls - while in the middle it might be nice to have an open gate, closed gate, then a version with a heavily defended castle gate, then a version of it smashed, and burning, + a drawbridge raised and lowered offering maximum versatility for story-telling. Meanwhile the Castle would constitute another area requiring 200 or so tokens, the Village would require 200, the farm 200, the treasury 200, the baker, stables etc  - you get the idea - would all get a similar treatment carefully looking at what needs be represented and building enough tokens for virtually every RPG scenario. Vehicles too - LOTS of armored,  travel convoy, wagons, carts, boats, small ships - and much much more. (The 200 is just an estimate, if an area needs more to represent it fully, it will get more).

My goal is to have them all done by September 2020. 

 EARLY ACCESS: Backing this campaign will give you the tokens months (possibly a year) before I package them for sale on the numerous stores I have my products which can take me months alone to organize, package and release due to the many formats required to suit so many different stores including the creation of samples, graphics, promotional materials.

 SAVINGS: It will give you an incredibly massive saving on retail cost as this Kickstarter is in AUD and my products retail in USD at approx 150 tokens per set for between $9.99/$12.99 USD a set and If you break that down it would require around 66 packs at $9.95 USD ea or $656 USD for all 66, which is the equivalent of a minimum of $937 in AUD for all 10,000 tokens.

 Backer Involvement: There is PLENTY of room for backers to get involved and feel free to make suggestions that I will do my best to include in the 10k.

I've made the worlds largest modular battlemap series (MEANDERS @1000+), and the worlds largest modular dungeon tile set (SOLOMAN TEMPLE SQUARES @46,000+) now its time to make the gigantic token set that goes with them.

Map Bonuses - Since I also do maps (LOTS. OF. MAPS.) I am offering some freebies to those backers that pledge in the first week, with diminishing rewards the later the backing - but still cool. I'll provide a series of highly-detailed map templates on which you can put your new tokens.

 Pre-Selection: Letting X amount of people select from 10k tokens would be a logistical nightmare so you have to trust that as a DM, gamer, businessman, thinker and strategist myself I will choose the best selections possible for each reward level to cover the broadest requirements.

 Naming of tokens: I'm intimately familiar with Fantasy Grounds UI and the importance of naming convention when it comes to how to quickly identify items in those little bag icons when you have thousands. Fantasy Grounds has its own search function that allows you to filter out specific items from thousands so I will be carefully labelling each component to make it easy to find. - Roll20 has its own tag system but can also benefit from detailed labelling - so in both cases tokens would be described from major or minor detail ie "Barrel, Top, Burned, 03"  - so you search for barrel, you know this one features a lid, that the lid is burned, and that there are other versions available as this is number 03, there must be more.

 Delivery Organization: Furthermore as per usual tokens will be grouped into folders on my googledrive into individual sets - but I will also create a super zip that allows all of the folders to be downloaded at once - and a zip that includes all tokens with no folders as alternate options for people to best choose what type of file they prefer.  As time has gone by I have come to understand what is required for tokens by customers and will endeavour to provide maximum use with minimum fuss.

 Integration/Instructions: As a teacher on how to use Fantasy Grounds, creator of several advanced modules and dozens of map and tokens ones I will be providing clear instructions on how to best import and store your tokens within Fantasy Grounds - and also Roll20. I cannot sync these tokens with products later formed into products for retail sale but I can organize them in such a way that they are immediately usable and virtually identical to those later products for the user.

 Versatility: While the tokens are sized for optimal use within Fantasy Grounds (100,200,400px) or Roll20 (140px,280px,560px) for instance - these tokens are supplied in a PNG format. What that means is that they have a transparent background - whereas a JPG does not. So if your intended program for using these whether its a map maker, different VTT, or other visual software usually uses PNG files as tokens - you're in business and can use these with it. 

 Mutual Combination: Note that you'll be given the master folder to Both Roll20 and Fantasy Grounds token formats, you don't have to choose: but you would select the Roll20 variants for home-printing or just printing as they will have the better resolution.

 + Back in the first week and you'll also get my Nine Level Empty Wizard Tower Template, Eight Empty College of Magic Templates, and Four Poor Village Map Templates as a free bonus - perfect for adding your new tokens to.  And just for viewing this campaign here is a free sample of my traditional "Meanders: Synchable Terrain" battlemaps so you can see the level of detail and artistic style for yourself. : https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gPVYaBFrG4Mx44...

To date I've created maybe ten thousand individual tokens in my career - but many of these lacked the skill I have now -and have been an aside while I was focusing mainly on maps. I intend to take a reasonable amount of time to work on producing these and am confident of doing so, as stated, and delivered on time. I have completed dozens of these massive types of digital project and have numerous measures in place to ensure the completed tokens are immediately stored in several places so they cannot suffer due to a hardware crash. I have made a move away from providing tokens on sheets, to individual drop-shadowed PNGS sized and ready to go within the two most popular VTT formats with both of which I am very familiar. There are no third parties involved and I have four years of Kickstarter experience and 100% fulfilment across more than a dozen projects - but this is my first time using Indiegogo, so bear with me while I get to grips.

No-one in their right mind offers this amount of tokens let alone tries to create them in one set - but I'm different and I'm known as 'The Maphatter' - and this is nothing compared to the 20 other projects I have successfully crowdfunded all including huge, vast amounts of digital content, including a recent project that saw 46,000 dungeon tiles created, or my Meanders series which now features over 1000 interchangeable battle-maps. - all delivered to promise and before time. I am what they call a sure-bet, I'm not going anywhere and this is not my beginning - but it is my beginning here: more funds means I can supplement myself while I work (fast and furious), hyper-focus on this one and not have to launch new projects in the meantime to pay my bills/rent - and possibly, make enough funding to include 10,000 sci-fi tokens as well. This is happening - I'm presently completing new maps for another project but as my backers know, I work like a storm and you don't have to wait long to get results once I get to it so this is your chance to get on board and get a wickedly comprehensive token set for your digital games this year - and you may never have to buy another one, again.

There are minimal risks and challenges beyond navigating Indiegogo for the first time - I've done this many times for many projects, I back-up everything so it can't be lost on multiple places, I know the formats required for the end-user, I make delivery as simple as visiting a link to download your goodies, I always deliver to promise early or on time, and I never ghost - I approach crowdfunding as a business transaction and pride myself on being a consummate professional before, during and after. My record (on record) reflects that.

Thanks for viewing, please feel free to ask any questions

First Regards,

Kris
