80+ single sleeved + divider + dice & tokens.
 We didn't abandon our community, we made sure that Citadel is designed so that it fits perfectly with all the other Quiver Time products. This will bring an extra touch of convenience to every Quiver community member.
Fits perfectly with Bolt aka Baby Quiver Case                   ​
 Quiver Case can house up to 4 Citadel Deck Blocks.                               Don't take our word for it, read what people are saying about Citadel Deck Block. As always, we listen to our community, so we first asked around to see what people think. Help us bring Citadel to life and support our cause. You will, of course, be rewarded handsomely, with unbeatable discounted product packs.And just when you thought it couldn't get any better, we went the extra mile and included FREE SHIPPING with every pledge!    The project is now completed and all rewards have been fulfilled.You can still back us here and we will continue fulfilling all rewards every month.     The Quiver Time story begins in 2014, when 3 old friends with boring jobs and pretentious job titles (a data scientist, a financial compliance officer and a procurement expert), sitting down for a board-game night were trying to figure out how we could harness our individual skills and work on together on a common project that would make us feel more accomplished. Something that would bring more excitement than building a spreadsheet, reviewing regulatory requirements or getting a better price for our employers.   A project that would add value to society, find solutions for others and empower us to feel more accomplished with results that we could clearly grasp. We looked down to our board game table and to our large boxes of games packed into supermarket bags and realized that we had the answer in front of us. We had a common passion for card games and we decided that we would spend the next years trying to improve the experience of card game players all over the world.  Risks and challengesLike any human enterprise, a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo is not without risks and challenges. The main risk is that the campaign would go unfunded and we would be stuck with the losses incurred for organizing the campaign. But this is mostly our problem. As a backer, you are more interested of how our risks might impact you. The main risk for you as a backer is that your pledge would not be rewarded with the prize promised. We will make sure this would not happen under any circumstances. We’ll explain how. But first, the risks: 1. Manufacturing risks. Production has its own risks that we might not control. Our suppliers might fail to produce on time, or at the quality expected, or they might go out of business.-> Measures to mitigate: We have taken measures to prevent that. We work with established suppliers that have a goods background of success. We will invest some of our own resources before the campaign ends but after the campaign is fully funded, so that we make sure production is completed on time. 2. Product quality risks. With every production, no matter the product or the company manufacturing it, there will be a small amount of damaged goods. This is something that can’t be avoided but just reduced in scale.-> Measures to mitigate: Once production is completed we arrange for quality check inspection. We are one of the fewest companies that arrange for full quality check of all products and not just a batch sample. We think that it’s more important to make sure every product is in the right shape before is delivered, even though that means a higher cost for us. We'll also replace any damaged product whatever the reason.In the end, whatever happens, we will deliver the products, even if it means incurring a loss for us. The only risk you are taking is that your reward might not reach you on time, but we'll do our best to avoid that. We will publish frequent updates on fulfillment status and you’ll always be up to date with the status. If for any reason you are unhappy with the reward you have received, we’ll do what we usually do. We’ll ask you what we can do to make you happy.If it means getting a replacement, a discount or a full refund, we’ll make sure that you get what you want. If you ever bought a Quiver Time product before, then probably you know what I’m talking about.If not, ask around.Happy Quiver Time!

story:
What's in the box?

The Deluxe Edition comes with everything for 1-4 players from the orginal base game known as Helionox: The Last Sunset. It also includes a brand new expansion called Mercury Protocol.

Helionox: Deluxe Edition

This is the original base game and the Expansion.

  • 1 Full set of The Last Sunset (everything for 1-4 players)
  • 1 Full sized box (approximately - 10"x10"x3")  
  • 1 Full sized game board (approximately 18"x18")  
  • 1 Full set of Mercury Protocol Expansion (everything for 1-4 players)  
  • All Unlocked Stretch Goals
  • 1 Full sized box (approximately - 10"x10"x3")  
  • 1 Full sized game board (approximately 18"x18")  
  • 1 Full set of Mercury Protocol Expansion (all Expansion parts needed for 1-4 players)  
  • All Unlocked Stretch Goals

New Content added from Stretch Goals

  • 10x Full Art Card Dividers
  • 4x Full Art Player Mats
  • 10x New Illegal Tech Cards
  • 8x New Market Cards
  • 3x New Architects
  • 10x New Events
  • 10 Card booster pack
  • 2 promo cards (one is an Architect)
  • A Double Sided Game Board
  • A huge pile of Component Upgrades....

Look for over 100 pieces of original art!

"It's Awesome - I absolutely adore it." —Rahdo

 

"If you've never played Helionox before... I'd seriously consider backing the game. If you have, the expansion gently and smartly adds on some new decisions that take what the game does best and drive it in new and unexpected directions." —Jason, Meeple, Myself, and I  

"This game is fantastic."—Tom, Never Bored Gaming

https://youtu.be/MOO4eg3fqys

"I really enjoyed it!" —Tom Heath, Slickerdrips

https://youtu.be/hwKzC32bdnc

"Helionox is a deceptively deep game. It redefines 'light deckbuilder' by not being as light as it seems on first blush. Plus, Luke Green draws the future like no one else can."—Mike Selinker, Lone Shark Games

The Basics of Game Play

Set in the distant future, players compete for “Influence” by obtaining powerful technology and operatives, overcoming devastating events, and establishing embassies on different worlds. But time is limited! Once the last card of the “Event Deck” is played, the game is over. The player with the most "Influence" at the end wins.

Events

Each turn, the current player places the top card of the Event deck at its Location.

Place one event each turn

Movement and Embassies

On your turn, you will draw 5 cards. A basic hand will consist of Credits and Defense. Defense is used to Overcome events while Credits allow you purchase cards, change locations, and place Embassies.

Two Credits to move to any Location. Two Credits to place an Embassy.

Cryo Counters

At the beginning of each turn you will remove a Cryo Counter from your Architect. Any time during your turn, if your Architect has no Cryo Counters, you may place counters on it to activate an ability. These are powerful abilities but cannot be used again until your Architect is no longer in Cryo, (i.e. has no Cryo Counters on it).

If your Architect has no Cryo counters, you may add Cryo Counters to activate an ability.

The Market

Cards may be purchased from the Market for Credits. Cards Obtained this way go on top of your deck, allowing for powerful combos on your next turn (or possibly sooner!).  

Cards Obtained from the Market go on top of your deck.

Slickerdrips Solo Playthrough

Unfiltered Gamer

A full overview of both Mercury Protocol and The Last Sunset from Unfiltered Gamer.

Rahdo Runs Through

Rahdo teaches you Helionox: The Last Sunset and some of the core mechanics of the game.

  

All Stretch Goals have been unlocked! Welcome to Deluxe Edition. 

Linen finish on all cards.

One new Architect and updated versions of the original Last Sunset promo cards.

  

Ten card booster pack from the original Last Sunset campaign.

Ship tokens upgraded to wood.

  

Full art dividers for in-box card seperation.

  

Large wooden Embassy tokens.

 

10 new events with new abilities.

   

New Architect - Jetta, Tech Dealer.

New Cyber Architect.

   

Ten new Illegal Tech cards (2x Five Unique Illegal Tech Cards).

  

Upgraded insert for better card and token organization.

   

Market Tokens Upgraded to Wood.

  

8 New Market Cards (4 Unique cards X2).

Double Side Full Art Game Board.

  

4x Full Art Player Mats.

New Token Set - Upgraded to Wood.

  

1 New Architect and 1 Syndicate Player Card.

  

Cargo Upgraded to Wood.

  

Online Backstory set in the Helionox Universe.

Kicktraq  and BGG Links

https://www.kicktraq.com/projects/1680723118/he...

https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/222988/heli...

Kickstarter Videos Created by

http://newdepthmedia.com/

Music by

https://soundcloud.com/starforce

Shipping

Shipping is included in US costs and, for everywhere else, is added to your pledge via the Kickstarter shipping system. Simply pledge to the proper level and it will prompt you to the proper shipping fee. Countries Excluded: We are no longer able to ship to Brazil, Russia, Mexico, or the Middle East due to high postage prices, and lost parcels. If you live in one of these areas, we recommend you use a USA address and have the game forwarded to you via a relative/friend or postage forwarding company. We continue to work with different fulfillment centers all over the world to ensure better, and more affordable delivery each campaign but none will guarantee delivery to these countries. PLEASE NOTE: Damage may occur during transit by the various shipping carriers used. We wish this was not the case, but it can happen. Shipping Carriers pass their fees along to us, we do not set high postage rates. We subsidize all shipping and handling costs from our profits to help lower these costs for you, our backers, because it is important to us to help spread the word about our project and help our games and our company grow. We are a small business who relies on shipping companies to fill our Kickstarter campaigns. PLEASE email our Customer Service (mrbgames.cs{at symbol}gmail.com) if you have any major issues with delivery/loss/damage that cannot be resolved with the carrier (IE always try your local post office first) and we will help assist you in resolving them. We will need your backer number, address and backer name in the email.  

Customs Friendly? 

We will try to make the best shipping choices (ie EU/UK/CANADA friendly) for your rewards when possible, but reserve the right to ship parcels from the USA or China if quantities ordered outside the USA are not large enough to facilitate pallet shipments. We are now upgraded to EU Friendly shipping for all EU countries as we have enough backers to ship a pallet.

For all other countries - we will let your know via an update if we ship from the USA and offer invoices to help with customs if need be. In our experience customs rarely happens if we have to go this route, but we cannot 100% guarantee it will be Customs Friendly unless we hit a large enough shipment.

Risks and challenges

Zeroic Games is partnering with long time and successful Kickstarter veteran Sean Brown of Mr. B Games.

Mr. B Games will be handling production, fulfillment, and distribution of HELIONOX. Mr. B Games is a proven game publisher with many successfully fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns to show for it. This allows you (and us!) to rest assured. Upon successful funding, your orders will be successfully fulfilled. If you need more proof, just check out Mr. B Games track record of top quality Kickstarter projects with games like Posthuman, Alien Uprising, and Spurs.

story:
Short Summary

I just want to start off by letting you know we will ONLY BE SHIPPING TO U.S. ONLY at this time.   

Sorry for any inconvenience.

OK, here's our mission:

The mission of Welcome to Truth is pretty simple: it's to take the knowledge that's in the minds of great Christian Apologists who tour the country (like Ravi Zacharias, Lee Strobel or Frank Turek) and bring it to the average Christian, through different creative means (videos, card games, board games, songs, etc.).

We started this journey about 2 1/2 years ago (when we knew nothing about Apologetics), and over time have learned how to defend our Christian faith, and want to pass that on to other Christians throughout the country and world.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $10,000 for our campaign.  This will allow us to print up 1,000 card games as well as give us a little bit extra to be able to market the game on Facebook market place, and other targeted marketing strategies.

Here's what YOU get for helping us!

Perks

  • $3 - Thank you note and 1 game card
    • You will receive a personalized thank you note, and 1 game card (from our 48-card collection) to study.
  • $6 - Thank you note and 4 game cards
  • $20 - Digital apologetics notes
    • ​These are my personal notes from 60 apologetics books.
  • $20 - Potato with apologetics quote
    • This is a bit more FUN of a gift.  It is a potato that you can send anyone in the country that says 'Science Points to God'.
  • $25 - 'Welcome to Truth Card' Game
    • ​This is a copy of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Game.
  • $25 - 'Science Points to God' T-shirt
    • ​One of our 'Science Points to God' T-shirts in whatever size is best for you
  • $48 - 2 'Welcome to Truth' Card Games
    • ​2 of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Games
  • $72 - 3 'Welcome to Truth' Card Games
    • ​3 of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Games
  • $96 - 4 'Welcome to Truth' Card Games
    • ​4 of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Games
  • $120 - Christmas Pack (5 'Welcome to Truth' Card Games) 
    • 5 of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Games
  • $220 - School Pack (10 'Welcome to Truth' Card Games)
    • 10 of our NEW Welcome to Truth Card Games

The Impact

The best possible thing that can happen to me in a day is to see someone give their life to the Lord Jesus, walk through that door, and begin following Him.

For some, they may hear a powerful sermon and decide to do this.  However, for many others, they have DEEP and difficult questions that must be addressed for their heart to be open to Jesus. 

This is where apologetics comes in, and becomes the key to unlocking the door of their hearts, that they may then walk through.

I understand the POWER of apologetics (learning to defend your Christian faith) because I have seen, firsthand, how it has affected my life and the life of my wife and friends around us.  

This is why I can say, with total humility, that if we, as Christians, learn the evidence in THIS card game, as well as our other card decks, we can truly change this nation, and eventually this world with the good news of the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially to our campaign, you can still help us big time by sharing this campaign with others who may be able to.

Also, your prayers are always appreciated!

What's Included in Card Game

48-Card Card Deck

Cup to Shoot the Bouncy Balls Into

2 Washers to Place at Bottom of Cup to Hold Cup Down

Jewels that Sit On Top of Washers to Help Soften Blow of Bouncy Balls

Bouncy Balls (5 All of Different Colors)

Last Year's Board Game was a Great Success

Last year's release of our board game was amazing, as we saw the board game go out all across the country.

The questions from the board game were a bit more difficult, as we were trying to reach an Apologetics-related community. 

However, for this new CARD Game's questions, we are trying to reach a broader audience (the average Christian) and so we expect many more people will be impacted by this new offering.

Here are some pictures and reviews from our board game.

Sample Cards

Here Are the Rules

Bouncy Balls (5 All of Different Colors)

Last Year's Board Game was a Great Success
Last year's release of our board game was amazing, as we saw the board game go out all across the country.
The questions from the board game were a bit more difficult, as we were trying to reach an Apologetics-related community. 
However, for this new CARD Game's questions, we are trying to reach a broader audience (the average Christian) and so we expect many more people will be impacted by this new offering.
Here are some pictures and reviews from our board game.




Sample Cards





Here Are the Rules

story:
Drinkagon is a board game for up to 8 players that combines drinking and strategic thinking. You have to carefully plan your moves and find the shortest possible way to conquer your opponent’s base. You need to use tactics and strategy in order to stay sober and try not to step on the green (TRUTH) or red (DARE) fields. You move your figurines with our D6 dice.
 


To spice up the game you can use your moves to move your opponent's’ figurines far from their victory. Make them lose, answer tricky questions and do crazy challenges, or just get them drunk. 

We have developed a free iOS & Android app with hundreds of truth & dare cards which makes the game surprising and endlessly fun.
 



 


 



The game is extremely easy to learn and it will take you only a minute to explain the rules to your friends! The goal is very simple: Conquer your opponent’s base with your figurines, while trying to stay sober! 

Drinkagon's set-up takes a few sips worth of time and, the rules are kept short and sweet, just like your favorite shots. The rest is up to your strategic skills and your ability to stay sharp once you get tipsy. And you will get tipsy. You can always avoid drinking by simply revealing your secrets and getting awkwardly embarrassed in front of the other players. Yes, it really is that simple.





 


To spice up the tactical part of the game and add some chaos to the pot of logic, our free iOS/Android Drinkagon app brings to life the virtual cards that make the opponents either perform a challenge, answer a personal question or drink a specific dosage of their favorite potion.


 
 
Instead of requiring the purchase and use of physical cards, all of the Drinkagon challenges will be collected and available in our Drinkagon app - free to use anytime, globally. This way, continuously open for updates and widely practical, we expect the app to improve the game flow along with delivering a great dose of fun since there is no limit to the diversity of cards players can draw.
 

We’re going to keep on injecting new cards into the app, sorting them into new themes and adding other functionalities to make Drinkagon interesting and fun no matter how many rounds you end up playing.
 


Here are some of the card examples:

  • Truth: How long have you gone without showering?
  • Truth: Have you ever peed in the swimming pool?
  • Dare: Go grab a broom and do your best tango.
  • Dare: Call the pizza place and order 300 sardine pizzas.
  • Theme > NSFW: How many people have you had sex with in one day?
  • Theme > NSFW: With clothes on (for now) top your partner and start riding for 15 sec.
  • Theme > Sports: Do pushups until it’s your turn again

You’ll be free to pick the theme depending on the group preferences of the people you are playing with.


Exciting times ahead, dear backers! Sip by sip, our gathered resources became a little waterfall of opportunity. Now we look forward to enrich our Drinkagon game and to make it even better for you. Everything that we wished to include but looked hardly achievable, lately seems highly possible - all thanks to the crowdfunding community and many other supporters! 

This all brings us to introducing Drinkagon Add-ons with pleasure - one by drunken one

 

Physical deck of 200 cards

Your pledges are potentially perkier for a high quality 200 cards deck. Along with those, the Drinkagon app will remain to be the active source of our new truth & dare challenges.

Add $14 to your existing pledge to get your own physical deck of cards. But why $14? We literally make no money on this one just because we want to deliver the cards in very high quality! :)


Picnic edition of the game 

Add $9 to your existing pledge to get your own Picnic Edition Drinkagon (tote board). Tote board can hold all the figurines with a dice and is perfect for almost any field trip. :).

 


We wanted to make it easier and cheaper for you while equally fair for everybody. That’s why we charge only $5 for worldwide shipping, while the rest of the rate will be covered at our own cost. 

The shipping fee is automatically added to your pledge at checkout. 
Shipping to EU won't incur VAT/import duties. 

This project is customs and VAT friendly because of its pricing. You may incur duties in some countries, but only if there's more than one game in your order.

 

 

 



Once upon a time in a small city of Rijeka (Croatia, EU) there were two guys (an IT geek and a smart marketing guru, both drinking specialists :D) that really wanted to make a different non-IT project. After a long time of brainstorming and thinking (30 minutes, to be precise) and while drinking their own homemade beer they came up with an idea of making a drinking board game. 

Why a drinking game? Well, why not?! There are several drinking games on the market already available but most of them don’t have any mechanics and are too repetitive, and as a result they get boring really quickly. We wanted to change that and create a game which will be fun, different and will make you “happy” wink-wink. :) This is how Drinkagon was born.

The twist happened once we started really enjoying the product and the joy even multiplied when our play-testers started giving their highly positive feedback. It all got us into the phase of actually looking forward to the opportunity to see our game evoke the same effect on many other people around the globe. :)

 



Help us produce it and deliver it to you by sharing our story! 
We are looking forward to expand the world of board games with one of our favorite products. It was designed with a high level of optimism and good fellowship, and hopefully it will bring a ton of good vibes to the future Drinkagon players!
 





 

Risks and challenges

The game comes with specially designed figurines made out of pure wood by local wood manufacturers and are carefully colored by hand. All the game pieces are produced in the EU.

In partnership with a local print factory specialized in producing board games, we are completely ready for serial production.

Our team has everything it takes to ensure you receive your game on schedule, as promised. We organized all the logistics and manufacturing in advance to avoid delays.

The biggest challenge that we could probably face is the unexpected number of backers and therefore some games might not be ready for the scheduled delivery as planned. Our great partners will do their best to scale the production if needed so each of you can receive the game in the shortest possible amount of time. <3
story_txt:
Drinkagon is a board game for up to 8 players that combines drinking and strategic thinking. You have to carefully plan your moves and find the shortest possible way to conquer your opponent’s base. You need to use tactics and strategy in order to stay sober and try not to step on the green (TRUTH) or red (DARE) fields. You move your figurines with our D6 dice. To spice up the game you can use your moves to move your opponent's’ figurines far from their victory. Make them lose, answer tricky questions and do crazy challenges, or just get them drunk. We have developed a free iOS & Android app with hundreds of truth & dare cards which makes the game surprising and endlessly fun.   The game is extremely easy to learn and it will take you only a minute to explain the rules to your friends! The goal is very simple: Conquer your opponent’s base with your figurines, while trying to stay sober! Drinkagon's set-up takes a few sips worth of time and, the rules are kept short and sweet, just like your favorite shots. The rest is up to your strategic skills and your ability to stay sharp once you get tipsy. And you will get tipsy. You can always avoid drinking by simply revealing your secrets and getting awkwardly embarrassed in front of the other players. Yes, it really is that simple.
 To spice up the tactical part of the game and add some chaos to the pot of logic, our free iOS/Android Drinkagon app brings to life the virtual cards that make the opponents either perform a challenge, answer a personal question or drink a specific dosage of their favorite potion.
  Instead of requiring the purchase and use of physical cards, all of the Drinkagon challenges will be collected and available in our Drinkagon app - free to use anytime, globally. This way, continuously open for updates and widely practical, we expect the app to improve the game flow along with delivering a great dose of fun since there is no limit to the diversity of cards players can draw. We’re going to keep on injecting new cards into the app, sorting them into new themes and adding other functionalities to make Drinkagon interesting and fun no matter how many rounds you end up playing. Here are some of the card examples:
Truth: How long have you gone without showering?
Truth: Have you ever peed in the swimming pool?
Dare: Go grab a broom and do your best tango.
Dare: Call the pizza place and order 300 sardine pizzas.
Theme > NSFW: How many people have you had sex with in one day?
Theme > NSFW: With clothes on (for now) top your partner and start riding for 15 sec.
Theme > Sports: Do pushups until it’s your turn again
You’ll be free to pick the theme depending on the group preferences of the people you are playing with.Exciting times ahead, dear backers! Sip by sip, our gathered resources became a little waterfall of opportunity. Now we look forward to enrich our Drinkagon game and to make it even better for you. Everything that we wished to include but looked hardly achievable, lately seems highly possible - all thanks to the crowdfunding community and many other supporters! This all brings us to introducing Drinkagon Add-ons with pleasure - one by drunken one Physical deck of 200 cardsYour pledges are potentially perkier for a high quality 200 cards deck. Along with those, the Drinkagon app will remain to be the active source of our new truth & dare challenges.Add $14 to your existing pledge to get your own physical deck of cards. But why $14? We literally make no money on this one just because we want to deliver the cards in very high quality! :)Picnic edition of the game Add $9 to your existing pledge to get your own Picnic Edition Drinkagon (tote board). Tote board can hold all the figurines with a dice and is perfect for almost any field trip. :). We wanted to make it easier and cheaper for you while equally fair for everybody. That’s why we charge only $5 for worldwide shipping, while the rest of the rate will be covered at our own cost. The shipping fee is automatically added to your pledge at checkout. Shipping to EU won't incur VAT/import duties. This project is customs and VAT friendly because of its pricing. You may incur duties in some countries, but only if there's more than one game in your order.   Once upon a time in a small city of Rijeka (Croatia, EU) there were two guys (an IT geek and a smart marketing guru, both drinking specialists :D) that really wanted to make a different non-IT project. After a long time of brainstorming and thinking (30 minutes, to be precise) and while drinking their own homemade beer they came up with an idea of making a drinking board game. Why a drinking game? Well, why not?! There are several drinking games on the market already available but most of them don’t have any mechanics and are too repetitive, and as a result they get boring really quickly. We wanted to change that and create a game which will be fun, different and will make you “happy” wink-wink. :) This is how Drinkagon was born.The twist happened once we started really enjoying the product and the joy even multiplied when our play-testers started giving their highly positive feedback. It all got us into the phase of actually looking forward to the opportunity to see our game evoke the same effect on many other people around the globe. :) Help us produce it and deliver it to you by sharing our story! We are looking forward to expand the world of board games with one of our favorite products. It was designed with a high level of optimism and good fellowship, and hopefully it will bring a ton of good vibes to the future Drinkagon players!  Risks and challengesThe game comes with specially designed figurines made out of pure wood by local wood manufacturers and are carefully colored by hand. All the game pieces are produced in the EU.In partnership with a local print factory specialized in producing board games, we are completely ready for serial production.Our team has everything it takes to ensure you receive your game on schedule, as promised. We organized all the logistics and manufacturing in advance to avoid delays.The biggest challenge that we could probably face is the unexpected number of backers and therefore some games might not be ready for the scheduled delivery as planned. Our great partners will do their best to scale the production if needed so each of you can receive the game in the shortest possible amount of time. <3

story:
Argle Bargle /ärɡəl ˈbärɡəl/ noun - copious but meaningless talk or writing; nonsense.

Argle Bargle is a riotously funny, deceptively simple card game where players take turns building ridiculous insults out of words and phrases to humiliate and defeat their friends. The core game is appropriate for ages 14 and up. It is easy to learn and play, and appeals to the party gamer and the tactician alike. Games last 15 to 30 minutes each and can be played with up to 8 players.

Now available on Amazon.com!


Each player is dealt 10 cards and 5 lives. The object of the game is to use your cards to create hilarious insults that remove the "lives" from your opponents.

 

Players can choose to use the words on either side of the card, but not both.

 

An insult is four or more words that form a grammatically correct English sentence. Select your opponent and say it like you mean it!

 

But be careful, because there are special cards that can redirect insults.

 

Insults hurt! They take lives away from whomever they land on.

 

Once you lose all your lives, you're out. The last one standing is the winner!

 

 

 


It's @*&%$ funny

It makes people laugh and smile. Often before they’ve even finished their insult! You can check out some of the insults that can be made here on our website: http://www.arglebarglegame.com, or with our Twitter bot at https://twitter.com/ArgleBarglebot - all randomly generated with the words from the game.

It’s Creative

We have loved watching all our friends and playtesters get creative with the game. People come up with the most poetically absurd and hilarious insults we could have never imagined. We’re constantly surprised by the unexpected ways they create insults in Argle Bargle.

 

No Dirty Words

Teens love it! Kids have a great time coming up with absurd and hilarious insults and there are no “bad” words. The game is solidly “PG-13”. Adults can certainly make racy euphemisms with creativity, but sometimes a pickle is just a pickle.

Easy to Learn

Players usually pick it up after a single hand. The words work together perfectly so that making an insult is easy once you’ve done it once or twice. Players soon start to develop their own strategies for taking out their friends with maximum effectiveness and hilarity.


 

Depth

This is not your average party game. Argle Bargle is a casual game, but It takes more than luck to best your opponents. It requires creativity and strategy. The point system and word selection has been finely tuned, so every word choice has benefits and repercussions. Pay attention to what has been played already, as special cards are sparse and their well timed use can be critical!

Replay Value

There are literally quintillions (That’s 18 zeros!) of different insults that can be made with any 10 cards from the deck. Unlike many other party games, this one can be played over and over and it will continue to delight and surprise.




 


 


 

  • Argle Bargle is 200 beautiful full-color cards and 40 glass gems for player lives.
  • 200 full color High Quality playing cards
  • 8 Page Full color Rule booklet
  • 40 glass gems for player “lives”
  • A sweeeet gem bag
  • Sturdy 2-piece full-color box


Game design is complete, and we have been playtesting for almost two years. Graphic design is done, with just a few more tweaks to the box design. We plan on getting design files to the manufacturer in March 2017.


 

 

Simon Erich

A gamer and game designer from the age of 12, Simon brings a lifetime of gaming passion and creativity to the Argle Bargle team.

Simon Erich has been working professionally in User Experience (UX) and Interactive design for Fortune 1000 companies for almost twenty-five years. Simon started his career In New York City working with Marvel, DC, and Valiant comics. He quickly established himself as a design, illustration, and multi-faceted creative consultant for some of the largest entertainment and financial companies in the world. In the 90’s Simon launched several media companies. He now runs a thriving interactive design Agency in Austin, Texas.  

Throughout his career Simon has worked with an impressive list of companies including:

Mastercard International, American Express, Nickelodeon, HBO, Showtime Inc., The United Nations, Miller Brewing Company, Estée Lauder, Sony Online, R/Greenberg Associates, Newsweek, Spin Magazine, Nortel Networks, Dow Jones & Company, Saatchi & Saatchi and many (many) more.

 

Zeke Brill

Zeke is a professional game designer, software developer, and sometimes musician. His career began in the mid-90’s in New York City during the dot-com boom. As Director of Game Development for the legendary Heavy.com, Zeke honed his skills in game design, game development, and interactive advertising. As a slot designer and developer for multi-billion dollar gaming company: International Game Technology (IGT), Zeke co-authored several gaming related patents. During his career he has worked on game licenses from Lucasarts, Sega, Atari, MTV, and WWE. Zeke has developed software for Microsoft, Amazon, and he co-created the very first interactive games for cats (yes, cats) for Purina Friskies. He has a really tiny dog.

 


The idea germinated in the mid-1980’s in the preadolescent brain of Simon as part of a kung fu themed card game called “UNGH!” where you would insult your opponents while battling in a hilarious combination of humor and combat.


Simon and Zeke first met in the mid-90’s, and developed the idea into a multi-player online card game called Bam-Boo, showcasing the art of legendary NYC artist Sean Taggart. While the game never made it into final production, the most enduring feature of the prototype was the “Slur Engine”, a random insult generator featuring the voice talents of actor and comedian Erik Passoja.


 

Fast forward to the mid-2000’s, when Simon and Zeke were both living in Austin, Texas. The idea was revisited. Stripping away everything else, they focused on the part that made them laugh every single time: The Slur Engine. By now Simon had built a successful interactive agency, and Zeke had 20 years of game design and development under his belt. As die-hard tabletop gamers, it just seemed like a perfect fit for a card game.

 

Game Design:

As soon as we had our core idea, we began with paper prototypes, but found the process to be painfully time consuming to effectively iterate. So, we built an online multiplayer prototype where we could test and tweak every aspect of the game in near real-time as we playtested. We also built a visual deck editor for creating word lists and balancing parts of speech and point values, and spent over a year and many many hours play testing our digital prototype online with gamers from all across the country.  


Zeke poured over spreadsheets to find just the right ratios and probabilities of the different parts of speech. We analyzed every word for grammatical flexibility and maximum hilarity. Meanwhile, Simon applied his 20+ years of design, UX, and branding expertise to create the most beautifully functional cards and packaging. By the time we printed our 1st prototype the game exceeded our expectations. Next came another 6 months of live playtesting, tweaking the word lists and design and rules for maximum fun. Every card and point values are designed for adding to the strategic depth of the game while keeping it easy to play, and most of all… funny.

 

 

Flexible Game System

Argle Bargle is more than just a game. It is a Game System that can be used to create and play a variety of different game types. Using the core mechanic of insult building, we’ve developed several exciting game variants. Our playtesters have expanded it even further with co-op versions, solitaire versions, and more!

We will publish all these variants on our website and hope to foster an online community where Argle Bargle players can share and perfect all the different ways to play.

story:
Welcome!


We would like to invite you to support our first crowdfunding campaign dedicated to Sylvan Elves miniatures. All of them are compatible with Fantasy Battles: The 9th Age.

 

We are a small and very new company, but with your support we want to provide a new line of fantasy miniatures. We work in cooperation with very talented sculptors, artists and manufacturers to provide you with the best products possible.

We want to cooperate with you during the development of our products. The miniatures will be created for you, that's why we want you to be a part of this. So feel free to send us any suggestions and ideas. Your dreams may become reality.

With your help we are going to release our first project. Please support us and help us realize our dream!

 

 

As you can see below, the first miniature has already been made, while the rest are in progress or only exist as concepts thus far. We need your help to invest into production molds and materials, so we can create the next miniatures.

We have mentioned before that we would like you to contribute during the development with your ideas. Please send emails (hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com), make comments here or post on Facebook, telling us any suggestions you may have. To show that your ideas can really make a difference, one goal of that project will be to create a miniature which you, as a group, choose. Another goal is a Sylvan Elves miniature, which we will create entirely based on your ideas. One of you will provide us with the concept, and we'll make the miniature!

For those of you that don't particularly enjoy painting miniatures and view it more as a chore that needs to be done, Hidden Dreams will also paint your miniatures with a colour scheme of your choice and send you the finished models.

 

 

At the bottom of the site there is a list showing the current status of the miniatures and that status will be updated over time. But do not be afraid to back something which is still locked at the moment. When the stretch goal is reach you will receive your new miniature. And if we cannot reach the stretch goal in question, then you will be able to choose other miniatures, or we will just give you a refund.

One last thing: the delivery times are an approximation. Everything should be delivered in time, but some things could be delayed, while others could be faster. The delivery times are flexible at this point and will be changed based on the demand for specific miniatures.

 

 

 

So if you like the look of the miniatures below, please support us, so we can create them for you. If you know someone who might be interest, tell him/her about this crowdfunding campaign. Visit and like our Facebook page and please spread the word wherever you can.

And last but not least we would like to thank everyone who supports our company. We would also like to thank the crew of The 9th Age, and everyone who is involved in the development of that great project. See you all on battlefield!

 

1. Shapeshifter Forest Prince

Ready project

 

 Available for 10€

 

1b. Shapeshifter Forest Prince with alternatives

Available for 15€

 

2. Thicket Shepard Hero - Battle Standard Bearer

Ready project

 

 

 

 

 


Available for 20€
 

3. Blade Dancer Hero/Champion

Ready project

 

 

 

 

 

 

  Available for 10€.


 

5. Thicket Beasts unit

Project in progress (1 of 3 finished).
2 more different miniatures will be unlocked at 1850€. Look at Thicket Shepard Battle Standard Bearer to have got idea how they can look like.

 

 


1 miniature 10€, 3 miniatures 25€ - You may mix and match different miniature poses, or receive a random selection.

 

6. Blade Dancers unit

Will be different 4 more

 

1 miniature 5€, 5 miniatures 20€ - You may mix and match different miniature poses, or receive a random selection.
 

6. Blade Dancers music and standard bearer

1 set (2 miniatures) for 12€

 

7. Thicket Shepard Hero

If you like Battle Standard Bearer, you will like also him.

Project will be unlocked at 2200€. Sculpting will be made in quality like Shapeshifter / Thicket Shepard BSB

 

Avaible for 20€

 

8. Wild Huntsmens

 

1 miniature 10€, 5 miniatures 35€ - You may mix and match different miniature poses, or receive a random selection.

 

9. Lord on Great Elk

 

Available for 25€

 

9b. Alternative set

Some new possibilities of assembly below, but there are much, much, more!

45€ whole presented set

55€ whole presented set + additional Elk body (possibility to make 2 miniatures)

 

10 - ... We will update this and next points during crowdfunding project

If you like our project here will be possible to add other miniatures. When we will catch-up that goal we will add something we will see there is most demand. We are very open to do something more.

 

 

 

 

Summary of locked/unlocked mniatures:


UNLOCKED:

Shapeshifter Forest Prince
Thicket Shepard Hero - Battle Standard Bearer
Blade Dancer Hero/Champion 
Kestrel Knights unit 
 3rd type of Kestrel Knight (with bow)
Full Thicket Beasts unit
Full Blade Dancers unit
Thicket Shepard Hero    
Wild Huntsmens    
Lord on Great Elk

 

 

 

Summary of prices:
 

 

 

 

 


Packs:

Shapeshifter Forest Prince with alternative options, Thicket Shepard Hero - Battle Standard Bearer, Thicket Shepard,  Blade Dancer Hero, Lord on Great Elk (standard cost was 90€)


 

Blade Dancer Hero, 15 x Blade Dancers (standard cost was 70€)

 

 

Thicket Shepard Hero - Battle Standard Bearer, Thicket Shepard,  9 x Thicket Beasts (standard cost was 115€)

 

 

Lord on Great Elk, 10 x Wild Huntsmen (standard cost was 95€)
 

Shapeshifter Forest Prince with alternatives + additional body (to make two full Shapeshifters) (standard cost was 25€)



With bigger orders it is possible to negotiate prices. Do not hesitate to mail us. hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com

Payment is through PayPal, but if you prefer some other way, mail us at hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com

Shipment cost is calculated as maximum 9€ and is in approximate. It will be possible to change cost, but it will include less safer sending. It will be up to you.

 

You can visit us also on

https://www.facebook.com/HiddenDreamsMiniatures

story:
Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon

The Forest of Night has always been a strange place. The trees are far too tall and far too thick here. So full in fact that they block out the very sun leaving the entire forest in the perpetual murk of night. Even the bravest and most experienced of hunters shy away the forest’s higher paths. Far too dark they say, and far too easy to become lost on the winding trails of the primeval wood.

Recently the folk who live upon the slopes of the mountain have complained of strange occurrences, especially around the time of the full moon. Weird shrieks have been heard in the trees. Small creatures acting strangely and deer stumbling into the meadows below the mountain with their brains leaking from their ears.

The locals have turned on one another. Some suspect witch-craft. Others believe an ancient curse has returned to the land centered on hidden ruins thought to be located on the high slopes of Midnight Mountain. Is it a plague? Are the rumor of a curse true? Have demented beings from Sybil descended on the denizens of Hurrie Inn? What’s the deal with all the cats?

One thing is certain. It is going to take a brave band of adventurers to unlock the secrets of Midnight Mountain and perhaps save the land from the depredation of the Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon!

What to Expect

Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon by Casey Christofferson- available in Fifth Edition, Pathfinder or Swords & Wizardry versions is an adventure for mid-level characters. We expect this will be the only  time we offer the premium softcover option for sale.

Within its covers (or the digital PDF file) you will find:

  • A stand-alone adventure completed in 2-3 gaming sessions
  • A horror mystery from beyond space and time
  • Exploration of new worlds and dimensions
  • Full Color Maps by Robert Altbaur
  • Richly Illustrated by Michael Syrigos
  • Cats!

 

Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon  uses the same formula introduced with our last Indiegogo, we refer to this method including the focused enhancements (stretch goals) that improve the product as total project funding increases with art, extra content written content and digital play enhancing extras (player handouts etc) as...

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is continuing the use of this indiegogo crowdfunding method for Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon. This method is almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means 100 pound glossy interior pages with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects. These smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

Project Reward 

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

Examples of Enhancements from Higher Funding

During the 15 day primary project period for Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to  Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon-

Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. Example: The previous Indiegogo project, Menace in Ravenreach, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.

Extra written content commissioned from the author. Casey is prolific and would be willing to do this, Frog God Games can speak on his behalf. We would, however have to pay him for this :)

Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.

Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Chrismas! and In Vino Giigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 

Digital extras (player handouts etc) that are focused on quality table-top play.

Help with the digital assets to enhance the module for the Fantasy Grounds marketplace. This has been done for all three previous releases from Indiegogo by Michael Potter.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS by clicking here- 

https://wwwapps.ups.com/ctc/request?loc=en_US.

story:
THIS YEAR IS IMPORTANT, MORE THAN EVER, FOR FAMILIES TO CONNECT AT CHRISTMAS!

WHETHER YOU ARE CELEBRATING IN PERSON OR VIRTUALLY, WE HAVE THE PERFECT TOOL TO USE!

Unique Christmas Placemats that come in packs of 12, each containing a different conversation starter and fun table challenge, a great way to engage the entire family!

So, it’s that time of year again and you’re hosting Christmas and you need to decorate the table perfectly. 

You’re in luck because we have the perfect addition to any Christmas table setting... beautifully designed Christmas Placemats!

You see, these 100% recycled paper placemats are not only decorative; each placemat includes a fun activity for families to enjoy & discuss over their meal. This creates fun and engaging banter between all family members, NEVER HAVE A DULL CHRISTMAS CONVERSATION AGAIN!

 

What's different about them?

Christmas is the time to come together and connect as a family (especially this year, hasn’t 2020 been a treat?). These unique placemats prompt fun family banter whilst complimenting your table setting. Whether the Christmas meal is in person or over zoom, these placemats will prompt the conversation to be fun and happy - which is what Christmas is all about. 

 

The Specifics:

  • We have a Fun Colourful Version (for kids) 
  • We have a Classic Version (for a traditional setting)
  • Come in packs of 12 Placemats
  • Made from 100% Recycled Paper
  • Australian Made & Produced
  • Limited Edition
  • Each Placemat has two of the following activities:
    • Table Talk
    • Fact or Fiction
    • Table Challenge
    • Table Trivia

 

What are the applications?

  •  Complete your Christmas table setting (if you are hosting Christmas)
  •  Unique Christmas gift for friends, neighbour, colleague or family member 
  •  Perfect Kris Kringle gift (under $50)
  •  Add to a Xmas Hamper
  •  Give to employees as a Christmas Gift
  •  Christmas table setting for Restaurants, Pubs & Clubs (who host Christmas)

 

What we need from you? 

In order for us to produce these amazing Placemats, we need your help to raise the dollars needed. Anything helps, if you believe in this product to enhance family dynamics, especially after a very challenging year, then we would be ever so grateful. 

  • If you pledge over $35 we will make sure you receive one pack of 12 placemats (you can choose if you want the colourful or classic version)
  • If you pledge over $70 we will make sure you receive both versions (colourful & classic)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Other ways you can help is share this campaign with your networks, especially if you think people will love the concept and enjoy using them with their family this Christmas
  • You can easily do this by using the Indiegogo share tools

Thanks so much for your interest and support. Lets all better connect with our families

story:
I'm going to follow the guide suggested by Indiegogo here. Ready?

Short Summary

We're selling dice! Special dice that are blank on five sides with a smug elf falling flat on his/her face on the sixth. Can work for any dice roll that has a 5/6 chance of success, a 1/6 chance of failure, or vice versa! Works best when it involves an elf losing a few teeth in the process though. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need: 

  • Some money.

What you get:

  • Some dice.

The Impact

Hopefully the only real impact will be the sweet, sweet impact of that stupid knife-ear eating granite as he trips over his bootlaces.

Risks & Challenges

There's a chance we won't get enough money, so we won't be able to make the dice. Er, that's really the only risk.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can buy more dices. Or tell/force people to buy more dices.

MORE DICES.

----

Update: Due to popular demand, we're also offering a limited run of the as-yet-unavailable Elflympics Tournament model! He's limited, so get him while you can.

story:
I first got involved in the children's maths games arena in 1997 when I was at University studying Computing. I saw an advert at our Student Union from the Sir John Cass Foundation Charity, one of London's oldest and largest Education Charities, to go into schools and help children struggling with Maths to increase their Maths confidence, through games.  

I thought it made sense. It was a great way to give back, I've always believed maths should be fun and that children should be enjoying it. It felt wrong that children had to suffer from low confidence in maths and I thought volunteering would be a noble thing to do, Why not? I jumped in. The schools selected a few kids with low maths confidence and the program started. Within a few weeks, I got some very surprising and rewarding feedback; a report from the teachers said that all the children had started being more engaged in maths classes and had increased in confidence. Wow! It made me want to do more. 

By the end of the year-long program, we got reports that the children’s maths levels had gone up more than they ordinarily would have if they didn't have the extra support. It was such an amazing feeling, that a normal girl like me could even contribute to helping in such a meaningful way; with something that was such a big problem in schools, with both parents and children. This was really changing lives, not only theirs, but my life too. This had sowed a seed in me that was to change my life. 

I had always loved maths and I had purposely chosen more maths-like units at University in my Computing degree which finally resulted in a 1st Class Honours result. Then I started working in Investment Banking while studying for my MSc in Financial Markets, just so I could engage with more maths-like things; but all the while I kept thinking of how I could make a difference in children's lives in the home, with their parents support. This was mainly because in each school, there were only a few children the school could assign to be helped in a year. Because we weren't that many, we couldn't help every single child in the school. I wanted to extend this to the home and support parents to find an easy way to help their children and be empowered to do so.

The problem though, I quickly realised was bigger than that. 

Three key problems were surrounding children learning maths and their maths skills. Many children:

  • Hate Maths, don't see the point in doing it, or find it a boring chore. 
  • Don't believe they can become good at it. (Usually because they've been inadvertently told that by a parent or a teacher).
  • Do not have effective, creative, fun methods of doing maths.

Sadly, many children experience low self-esteem and low self-confidence as a result, which can affect their school experience and future.

The bigger problem is that many parents are afraid of maths themselves and don't know how to help their children. 

The world is changing and is a lot more demanding now. The youths of this current generation are already finding it harder to get good jobs and without maths, this challenge is only increased.

In 2012, UK government statistics first showed that half the adults in the UK have numeracy levels no greater than that of an 11-year old, which is said to be costing our economy £20 billion a year.  The problem is not getting better. There are similar problems in the USA, Canada, Australia and many more countries.

These are the problems I set out to change. I had the idea to create a 4-step solution and methodology that would include a fun maths board game for children aged 6 - 13 years possessing excellent play value (replay-ability), so that children would be wanting to play over and over again, not just once or twice. I wanted to create a game that would keep them coming back and at the same time make them think creatively and develop their critical thinking skills.

A maths game that would also be different by allowing children with stronger and weaker maths abilities to play together and learn in a stress-free, relaxed environment, be it at school or at home. One that parents too would enjoy playing as most parents I spoke to said they didn't enjoy the children maths games they had. They said the games they had were simply "maths" and nothing more. 

When I was pregnant with my first child and on maternity leave, I created my first prototype and started working on my idea. I became busy, being a mum raising my boy and girl in between and kept struggling to be able to come up with ways to get the replay-ability factor in the game for many years.  Eventually I had to start all over again in 2013 when I realised that game just wasn't working. A very lovely mentor I met through Virgin Startup advised me to create a brand new game but use the same mechanics I had used for the first. I did not know how to draw and kept trying different things (some horrible, some hilarious) until I managed to draw something that has now been refined a thousand times. Through over 250 play-tests of the game's prototype review copies, with children, parents, schools, tuition centres and maths game experts, the game is now ready, completed and being produced.

We have had an overwhelming positive response and over a 100 of fantastic testimonials and endorsements.

There are many more on our website and in stacks of testimonials and feedback sheets. 

We need to give children an edge. The key is to catch them young and incorporate the notion of play learning. My game motivates children to do maths in a stress free, creative, fun and stimulating way. Race To Infinity is making a difference to how children, and even parents view maths, making children happier with the subject and allowing parents to worry less. 

Doing well in maths when I was 10 yrs through my dad's encouragement and winning the end-of-year school prizes gave me great belief and confidence, and brought offers my way that I could otherwise only have dreamt of.

And this is WHY I do what I do.

What Makes The Race To Infinity Maths Board Game Different?

  • truly fun
  • engaging
  • children learn and improve their maths skills without realising they are learning
  • develops analytical skills
  • develops decision making skills
  • develops critical thinking skills
  • develops creative thinking skills
  • develops logic
  • develops spacial skills
  • develops social skills and interaction skills 
  • extensible to make the game harder or easier 
  • not so maths-y (maths is cleverly disguised)
  • covers the most fundamental parts of the curriculum, including the multiplication timestable and the other three operations.
  • and more! 

The Indiegogo versions have these special components as extras:

  • has time-telling expansion decks
  • has maths tricks and shortcuts expansion decks that make calculations lightning-fast. 

I’ve been fortunate that though it’s been a long journey I have met so many amazing people along the way, people I would never have met if I hadn’t embarked on this journey and won some amazing awards. I am particularly grateful to have an amazing and supportive team and many other supporters that are second to none.

We have some specific core values behind our mission to help children love maths more, enjoy maths and reduce maths anxiety. There are 10 of them:

  • Hard work - how I worked tirelessly for years and the team now does the same. 
  • Integrity - having high moral standards and doing things the right way. 
  • Helping children become maths confident
  • Resilience - refusing to give up through the long journey it's been.
  • Creating high quality products (doing things properly with excellence)
  • Empathy - care about the kids, made us feel sad. 
  • People skills - enjoying meeting people and relating with people.  We have distributors we are managing that are responding to us. 
  • Offer hope with positive energy - consistently assuring parents they can do this by teaching the easy way to and a step-by-step proven method. 
  • Fun and enjoyment of learning  - maths fun game. 
  • Reliability in giving back – Speaker of Inspiring the Future and Inspiring Women, School Governor, Trustee of a London University’s SU Board, advocate of National Numeracy charity, expanding Number Partners charity.

I want every parent to experience the magic of playing the right maths games with their child. My children have also each played this game with me over 150 times. My daughter has been playing this particular game since the age of 4 years and it has reflected tremendously in her results and particularly timetables. It resulted in zero stress in mastering her multiplication timestables in record time.

Please join our Supporters. Back this maths board game project, and together, let's help children build the important skills they need to thrive in this modern world.

I want to make a difference to the society and impact children globally. I could not go to bed without helping children fall in love with numbers – it’s my addiction.
story_txt:
I first got involved in the children's maths games arena in 1997 when I was at University studying Computing. I saw an advert at our Student Union from the Sir John Cass Foundation Charity, one of London's oldest and largest Education Charities, to go into schools and help children struggling with Maths to increase their Maths confidence, through games.  I thought it made sense. It was a great way to give back, I've always believed maths should be fun and that children should be enjoying it. It felt wrong that children had to suffer from low confidence in maths and I thought volunteering would be a noble thing to do, Why not? I jumped in. The schools selected a few kids with low maths confidence and the program started. Within a few weeks, I got some very surprising and rewarding feedback; a report from the teachers said that all the children had started being more engaged in maths classes and had increased in confidence. Wow! It made me want to do more. By the end of the year-long program, we got reports that the children’s maths levels had gone up more than they ordinarily would have if they didn't have the extra support. It was such an amazing feeling, that a normal girl like me could even contribute to helping in such a meaningful way; with something that was such a big problem in schools, with both parents and children. This was really changing lives, not only theirs, but my life too. This had sowed a seed in me that was to change my life. I had always loved maths and I had purposely chosen more maths-like units at University in my Computing degree which finally resulted in a 1st Class Honours result. Then I started working in Investment Banking while studying for my MSc in Financial Markets, just so I could engage with more maths-like things; but all the while I kept thinking of how I could make a difference in children's lives in the home, with their parents support. This was mainly because in each school, there were only a few children the school could assign to be helped in a year. Because we weren't that many, we couldn't help every single child in the school. I wanted to extend this to the home and support parents to find an easy way to help their children and be empowered to do so.The problem though, I quickly realised was bigger than that. Three key problems were surrounding children learning maths and their maths skills. Many children:
Hate Maths, don't see the point in doing it, or find it a boring chore. 
Don't believe they can become good at it. (Usually because they've been inadvertently told that by a parent or a teacher).
Do not have effective, creative, fun methods of doing maths.
Sadly, many children experience low self-esteem and low self-confidence as a result, which can affect their school experience and future.The bigger problem is that many parents are afraid of maths themselves and don't know how to help their children. The world is changing and is a lot more demanding now. The youths of this current generation are already finding it harder to get good jobs and without maths, this challenge is only increased.In 2012, UK government statistics first showed that half the adults in the UK have numeracy levels no greater than that of an 11-year old, which is said to be costing our economy £20 billion a year.  The problem is not getting better. There are similar problems in the USA, Canada, Australia and many more countries.These are the problems I set out to change. I had the idea to create a 4-step solution and methodology that would include a fun maths board game for children aged 6 - 13 years possessing excellent play value (replay-ability), so that children would be wanting to play over and over again, not just once or twice. I wanted to create a game that would keep them coming back and at the same time make them think creatively and develop their critical thinking skills.A maths game that would also be different by allowing children with stronger and weaker maths abilities to play together and learn in a stress-free, relaxed environment, be it at school or at home. One that parents too would enjoy playing as most parents I spoke to said they didn't enjoy the children maths games they had. They said the games they had were simply "maths" and nothing more. When I was pregnant with my first child and on maternity leave, I created my first prototype and started working on my idea. I became busy, being a mum raising my boy and girl in between and kept struggling to be able to come up with ways to get the replay-ability factor in the game for many years.  Eventually I had to start all over again in 2013 when I realised that game just wasn't working. A very lovely mentor I met through Virgin Startup advised me to create a brand new game but use the same mechanics I had used for the first. I did not know how to draw and kept trying different things (some horrible, some hilarious) until I managed to draw something that has now been refined a thousand times. Through over 250 play-tests of the game's prototype review copies, with children, parents, schools, tuition centres and maths game experts, the game is now ready, completed and being produced.We have had an overwhelming positive response and over a 100 of fantastic testimonials and endorsements.There are many more on our website and in stacks of testimonials and feedback sheets. We need to give children an edge. The key is to catch them young and incorporate the notion of play learning. My game motivates children to do maths in a stress free, creative, fun and stimulating way. Race To Infinity is making a difference to how children, and even parents view maths, making children happier with the subject and allowing parents to worry less. Doing well in maths when I was 10 yrs through my dad's encouragement and winning the end-of-year school prizes gave me great belief and confidence, and brought offers my way that I could otherwise only have dreamt of.And this is WHY I do what I do.What Makes The Race To Infinity Maths Board Game Different?
truly fun
engaging
children learn and improve their maths skills without realising they are learning
develops analytical skills
develops decision making skills
develops critical thinking skills
develops creative thinking skills
develops logic
develops spacial skills
develops social skills and interaction skills 
extensible to make the game harder or easier 
not so maths-y (maths is cleverly disguised)
covers the most fundamental parts of the curriculum, including the multiplication timestable and the other three operations.
and more! 
The Indiegogo versions have these special components as extras:
has time-telling expansion decks
has maths tricks and shortcuts expansion decks that make calculations lightning-fast. 
I’ve been fortunate that though it’s been a long journey I have met so many amazing people along the way, people I would never have met if I hadn’t embarked on this journey and won some amazing awards. I am particularly grateful to have an amazing and supportive team and many other supporters that are second to none.We have some specific core values behind our mission to help children love maths more, enjoy maths and reduce maths anxiety. There are 10 of them:
Hard work - how I worked tirelessly for years and the team now does the same. 
Integrity - having high moral standards and doing things the right way. 
Helping children become maths confident
Resilience - refusing to give up through the long journey it's been.
Creating high quality products (doing things properly with excellence)
Empathy - care about the kids, made us feel sad. 
People skills - enjoying meeting people and relating with people.  We have distributors we are managing that are responding to us. 
Offer hope with positive energy - consistently assuring parents they can do this by teaching the easy way to and a step-by-step proven method. 
Fun and enjoyment of learning  - maths fun game. 
Reliability in giving back – Speaker of Inspiring the Future and Inspiring Women, School Governor, Trustee of a London University’s SU Board, advocate of National Numeracy charity, expanding Number Partners charity.
I want every parent to experience the magic of playing the right maths games with their child. My children have also each played this game with me over 150 times. My daughter has been playing this particular game since the age of 4 years and it has reflected tremendously in her results and particularly timetables. It resulted in zero stress in mastering her multiplication timestables in record time.Please join our Supporters. Back this maths board game project, and together, let's help children build the important skills they need to thrive in this modern world.I want to make a difference to the society and impact children globally. I could not go to bed without helping children fall in love with numbers – it’s my addiction.

story:
‘See You in Whistler’ Ski Resort Jigsaw Puzzle & Community Fundraiser

My name is Lorne Craig. Like many powderhounds, I was wiped out when the 2020 ski season was cancelled due to Covid-19. But then I thought of all the resort workers and locals who would be hit even harder. So I decided to make something to keep me occupied until the runs open again, and raise money for Whistler Community Services at the same time.

 

Our first limited edition run of 300 puzzles for 2020 is sold out! If you want to help fund Whistler Community Services, sign up for our 2021 puzzle run and get the world’s most rad resort puzzle experience!

The puzzle artwork is a hand drawn pen and ink cartoon illustration of Whistler and Blackcomb Mountains and the Village. It's made of 500+ pieces that assemble into a 19”x 28” panorama featuring:

  • Iconic ski runs, lifts & terrain features
  • Quirky situations, visual puns, historical and cultural references
  • Over 200 wacky characters, animals and vehicles!
  • A list of things to find, for more family fun!

Jigsaw puzzles are the hot item for Covid-19 home entertainment, so the soonest we can get another run done is for Q2 2021. Back this project to reserve yours today.

The See You in Whistler puzzle is the perfect ski cabin accessory for the whole family. Send it to your powder buddies around the world as the most unique Whistler gift, ever. And what skier or snowboarder wouldn’t love to find one of these under the tree at Christmas?

Helping Whistler Community Services Society

If it felt bad to have our ski season cancelled, imagine how it feels for the workers, business owners and citizens of Whistler. The Whistler Community Services Society provides invaluable services such as:

  • The Whistler Food Bank
  • Outreach Services
  • Community Programming
  • Recycling
  • BC’s most kick-ass Reuse-it stores!

Profits from each puzzle bought go towards supporting this worthy Whistler institution. Our limited edition run of 300 puzzles will help out a lot. Can we stretch that even further with another run? We're game if you are.

 

CUSTOM PUZZLE SPECIAL! Have a cartoon of YOU drawn right into the original artwork for 2021!

This was a very popular high-level perk for the 2020 puzzle. Send a photo and I will hand-ink a little you (or other person of your choosing) right onto the slopes. Also included in this premium package is the original ink drawing, signed by the artist (suitable for framing with a wee tiny frame). Then you will have all the fun of assembling the puzzle to find yourself in Whistler!

Interested in this perk? Please comment below and let us know if we should offer it again for the 2021 run!

 

About the artist:  Lorne Craig - Skier, cartoonist and successful crowdfunder.

I have been skiing at Whistler since 1985, cartooning my whole life and make my living as an illustrator and designer. During the 1990’s  I was actually the designer of the Whistler Mountain trail map – so you could say I know my way around the place a bit. But I still have not come come close to seeing it all! My cartoons have been featured in ads, posters, t-shirts, greeting cards, social media and more. In 2019, in partnership with Squamish Author JF Plouffe, we successfully funded and launched an eco children’s book called Little Spring on Kickstarter. Now, I’m ready to make this epic puzzle a reality here on IndieGoGo.

Risks & Challenges

Puzzles are well established technology, and I have over 30 years experience illustrating and preparing files for high quality printing, so most risks will not be on the development side. Some challenges may be encountered with shipping times and puzzle supplier production capacity, as jigsaw puzzles are experiencing a resurgence of popularity during these COVID-19 stay-at-home times. But I am confident, if this project gets backed, it will get delivered!
