story:
OVERVIEW

Remember flip books? This over 200-year-old pre-cinema format lets you bring images to life by simply moving your thumb. Our mission is to reinvent the flip book, combining the original format with brand new mechanics, which are not only fun but also educative at the same time.

The Apollo 11 Flip Book Edition is a surprising collection of 2 interactive flip books in celebration of the 50th anniversary of man’s arrival on the moon. An integrated Augmented Reality Feature lets you learn more about the mission by showing you three 3D models of the spacecraft used in the mission.

 

Fifty years ago, on July 20th, 1969, the entire world held its breath. Five decades later, man's most outstanding milestone continues to thrill us as if it had happened yesterday. Apart from loving flip books, we are passionate space enthusiasts, and this enormous achievement has always been an inspiration to us, so we thought it would be amazing to create the ultimate flip book edition on the Apollo 11 journey, to mark the 50th anniversary of this event in history.

 

 

 

 

 

The first volume of the Apollo 11 Flip Book Edition is based on original footage from the NASA archives, shot during the different stages of the mission. It wasn't easy  to decide which sequences should go into the flip book, since there’s really a lot of incredible material available, but after some back and forth, we chose 6 sequences that reflect the most significant maneuvers of the Apollo 11 mission. Some of the sequences are edited  in multicam shots to show the action synchronized from different angles. You’ll find 3 sequences on each side of the book.

 

 

 

 

 

 

After testing the first prototypes, we were fairly satisfied with the result, however we still missed  some of the most important events that took place. What about those crucial moments that helped to make this journey a success, but couldn’t be filmed because they happened out there in space? We wanted to create a flip book that not only tells this story, but also really makes you understand what happened out there. That’s how Volume 2 came up. 

 

 

 

Luckily, as we have our own flip book and animation studio, the solution was not too far away: during our research we learned about the original concept art, created by NASA artists in 1966 to explain the main stages of the mission to the broader public, so we decided to select the illustrations of the stages we were missing and turn them into animations. 

As a result, Vol 2 has 6 more sequences depicting the moon landing from a more technical and informative point of view, whilst maintaining an artistic approach through the handmade paintings. They are some of the most important maneuvers performed by the astronauts, such as the stage separations and docking procedures and the lunar orbit insertion of the CSM-LM module. Here they are in detail:

 

 

 

 

 

Both flip books are intended to complement each other, so if you switch between the real footage and the animated sequences, together they become a powerful educational tool that explains the whole process of the Apollo journey.

 

 

 

Because we like challenges and really want to take flip books to the next level, we decided to add an interactive component to the edition. That’s why we added an exclusive Augmented Reality feature to the flip book edition that gives you more insight into the three main spacecrafts used by the astronauts to accomplish this remarkable mission.

Each of the flip books includes a different 3D model that can be displayed on your mobile device right above the flip book. On Vol. 1 you'll see the powerful Saturn V rocket, on Volume 2 the Command and Service Module docked together with the Lunar Module and when both flip books are packed together in the Anniversary Edition slipcase (Flip Book Set), you can see a real-time 3D animation of the last exciting moments of “The Eagle” before it touches the surface of the moon - well actually before it touches the surface of the flip book. :)  

 

Each of these 3D models will incorporate extra detailed information about the technical specifications of each spacecraft, combining videos and additional text. This way, you can not only engage with your Apollo 11 Flip Book, but most importantly, you can learn more about the mission and the vehicles the astronauts used throughout their journey.  

For the development of the AR content we work hand in hand with our friends from the British studio Seymour & Lehrn, specializing in the creation of AR and VR content for virtual experiences. With their help, we will develop our own Flipboku Apollo 11 AR app, which you can easily download for IOS and Android.  

 

Those of you familiar with our last flip book project Molecularis, may already have an idea about how the magic works. If you observe the flip book in closer detail, you will notice that the edges are cut in a specific way, so that you can swap between the different sequences. This is the key to the optical illusion that gives the Apollo 11 Flip Book its unique feature of showing you six different animations, one after another - you'll have a blast watching people's faces when they see the flip book for the first time and try to understand how it works! :D 

 

 

 

And here's the secret: it all depends on the position of your thumb. You can switch between the sequences by placing your thumb either in the upper corner, the center or the lower corner of the front edge of the book. 

As there are 3 sequences on each side of the book, the images are arranged alternately. This means that you will have sequences 1, 2 and 3 on the A-side and 4, 5 and 6 on the B-side of the book, when you turn it around. This works the same for both flip books, resulting in a total of 12 different sequences. 

 

 

 

With the aim of providing you with maximum enjoyment of the whole epic Apollo experience, we have developed a complementary educational tool for those of you wanting to gain additional insight, not only about the Apollo 11, but about the entire Apollo Program. 

Who were the astronauts, which spacecraft did they use, and which experiments did they perform during the different lunar explorations? To answer these questions, we created a deck of 70 neatly designed Commemorative Cards, representing three different categories: 32 astronauts of all the Apollo missions, 18 of the science experiments set up by the astronauts at the landing site of each of the five Apollo missions to land on the moon, and 20 cards showing the vehicles and hardware that brought them there – and back to earth. 

 

 

Each of the illustrated cards includes basic information of the displayed subject, and also includes a QR code that takes you to the specific page on Wikipedia where you can find out even more about each of the many components of the Apollo Program. 

You can also combine the cards into different groups by joining all the astronauts of a specific mission as well as their scientific experiments and vehicles, or turn it into a question-and-answer game and not only learn from it, but have a lot of fun with your friends and family.

 

 

We couldn't help but include a little flip book feature in the card deck! If you hold all the cards in the correct order, you will be able to see a 360º animation of the Lunar Module while flipping the cards with your thumb. :D 

 

 

 

For all those passionate space lovers out there who want the full experience, we’ve created an exclusive bundle with 150 units available only for our Indiegogo backers. This one of a kind Limited Edition tier includes a real fragment of mission-flown Kapton Foil that protected the Columbia Command Module during its re-entry to Earth. 

This unique piece is preserved in a small commemorative acrylic container that comes individually numbered and with your name on it. A unique collector's item for those who want to hold a real piece of human history in their hands. 

 

 

The Limited Edition Foil Bundle will come in a sleek packaging that we’ve created especially for the occasion, along with the Apollo 11 Flip Book Set (which comes with all three 3D AR models) and the Apollo 11 Commemorative Cards. The limited edition includes a Certificate of Authenticity with additional information on the origin and traceability of the foil.

 

 

 

 

We are passionate about great packaging, which is why all our flip books come in their own sleek slip case which not only looks attractive, but also protects them from wear and tear. 

 

 

Furthermore, the Apollo 11 Anniversary Edition (Flip Book Set) has a double slip case with a stunning  gold embossing we’ve created for this special occasion,  so that you can keep both flip books together.

 

 

We only use environmentally-friendly materials, such as acid-free sustainable forest paper. All materials are from local providers to keep our project as sustainable as possible (this means European materials for us). We have chosen a semi-gloss coated paper with the perfect thickness and elasticity so that the pages slide smoothly when you flip them with your thumb. 

Every single Apollo 11 Flip Book is largely hand-produced and the whole process requires a number of steps that rely on careful supervision, which is why the entire production process will be carried out in our very own printing studio in Mallorca, Spain. Our experienced printing technicians will take care of the complex manufacturing process which requires absolute precision to ensure that the sequences perform perfectly.  Here you can see a small making-of video of the Apollo 11 prototypes:

 

 

 

 

 

Vol. 1 and Vol. 2 are two separate flip books in their own right but they complement each other beautifully. When combined, the real footage and the animated sequences provide extraordinary insight into the entire Apollo 11 mission.

You can choose between the following combinations: 

 

 

 

Flipboku is the brainchild of animator and designer Jossie Malis and music composer Julie Reier. Besides loving animation and flip books, we're also huge space enthusiasts, so we are thrilled at the idea of creating something unique for the 50th anniversary of this memorable achievement. With Flipboku, we want to bring flip books to the next level and create unique editions, that are not only fun, but also useful either in a creative, artistic or educational way.

Since our last project Molecularis, the Flipboku team has grown and now consists of 6 members, all working in our design and printing studio Boku Lab. The team is completed with the invaluable hands of illustrator and graphic designer Noemi Aiolo, and the 3 members of our irreplaceable printing crew Gustavo Berdayes, Tomás Ponsand José Ramón Pineda, who are responsible for the development of the prototypes and for leading the entire production process. 

 

 

We are extremely grateful for your support and would love to welcome you on board!

 

 

We would especially like to thank NASA video librarian Sheva Moore for her support through the incredible film archive and Bert Ulrich from the NASA multimedia and content department, to Andy Bernstein for his support with the video narration and Victoria Amengual for her help with the writing.  Also special thanks to our webmaster Israel and our dearest Angel, Mireia, Anselm, Marcos, Raquel, Angel, Nuria, Naru, Yui, Yuko, Nadal and Alejandro for their participation in our video. 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

During our last project we learnt the hard way that you can never be prepared enough when it comes to producing something that has never been done before. No matter how well prepared you are, you will always have to reckon with unexpected situations as long as you are dependent on third-party providers. For this reason and because we not only want to give ourselves, but all our backers the certainty that everything will run smoothly, we’ve set up our own printing workshop, where 100% of all the production steps are carried out. Our experienced printing technicians will personally take care of the production process to ensure that production is executed to perfection, so that all our backers receive a product of the highest possible quality and as quickly as possible.

story:
Zine Contents

Within the pages of this 20 page zine are many things, including:
• The Sinful Sailor, a class designed around the Seven Deadly Sins and Nautical Naughtiness
• Nautical Weapons, to replace the starting weapon chart when creating a Coastal Character
• Nautical Tattoos that you can pay for with severed limbs or hard earned silver pieces
• Sailing Rules that keep the entire party involved and relevant with plenty of room to customize


• A Nautical Hex Crawl based on Flogging Molly’s Within A Mile of Home album

Within A Mile of Home is an independent production by Michael Mars and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License. MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.

Stretch Goals

We've exceeded my wildest expectations and are able to do more! While I'm not gonna add content to the book I will add content to your package!

$600 - Custom 4 inch by 1 inch Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

ACHIEVED!!!

$750 - Custom 3 inch square Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

ACHIEVED!!!

$1000 - Rules for building your own terrifying ship, using ships in combat on the high seas, and sample ships are added to the zine!

$1500 - Cover commissioned from Ed Bourelle of SkeletonKey Games (That's the guy behind the Masticator Gate and the Endless Demon Deck)

Who Am I?

Hi, I'm Michael "Mars" Russell. You may know me as the Pathfinder 1e guy over at Frog God Games and Necromancer Games. I have been doing the conversion of their IndiGoGo projects, contributed to their Book of Alchemy, as well as working on other books published by them. I've also worked with Koryo Hall of Adventure and Explore Dungeons in the past. With the recent opening of the Lost Lands Open License from Frog Gog Games, I have decided to release some personal projects that I have been thinking about for years. Or you may know me as the guy who wrote An Cailleach, Buster Bone-Gnawer, Börker of Shadows, and Eldritch Elevations for MÖRK BORG.

What We Need & What You Get

The pdf for this is all laid out and ready to go, that means the content is written already and I can send out the pdf as soon as I get the funds from IGG. What this is funding is a limited print run through Mixam at a quality I can be proud to say I produced.

Any future printings of this would be print on demand, so not nearly as nice.

Risks & Challenges

There is not a lot that can go wrong with you getting the product at this point as everything is already written and laid out, but there can be shipping delays between Mixam and myself, as well as from me to you though I will do my best to mitigate these.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to support me otherwise, I have a patreon that gives free pdfs of my releases and grants access to my development channel on my Discord server. My patreon is https://www.patreon.com/michaelmars
story_txt:
Zine Contents
Within the pages of this 20 page zine are many things, including:• The Sinful Sailor, a class designed around the Seven Deadly Sins and Nautical Naughtiness• Nautical Weapons, to replace the starting weapon chart when creating a Coastal Character• Nautical Tattoos that you can pay for with severed limbs or hard earned silver pieces• Sailing Rules that keep the entire party involved and relevant with plenty of room to customize
• A Nautical Hex Crawl based on Flogging Molly’s Within A Mile of Home album

Within A Mile of Home is an independent production by Michael Mars and is not affiliated with Ockult Örtmästare Games or Stockholm Kartell. It is published under the MÖRK BORG Third Party License. MÖRK BORG is copyright Ockult Örtmästare Games and Stockholm Kartell.
Stretch Goals
We've exceeded my wildest expectations and are able to do more! While I'm not gonna add content to the book I will add content to your package!
$600 - Custom 4 inch by 1 inch Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

ACHIEVED!!!
$750 - Custom 3 inch square Michael Mars Sticker added to each physical package

ACHIEVED!!!
$1000 - Rules for building your own terrifying ship, using ships in combat on the high seas, and sample ships are added to the zine!
$1500 - Cover commissioned from Ed Bourelle of SkeletonKey Games (That's the guy behind the Masticator Gate and the Endless Demon Deck)


Who Am I?
Hi, I'm Michael "Mars" Russell. You may know me as the Pathfinder 1e guy over at Frog God Games and Necromancer Games. I have been doing the conversion of their IndiGoGo projects, contributed to their Book of Alchemy, as well as working on other books published by them. I've also worked with Koryo Hall of Adventure and Explore Dungeons in the past. With the recent opening of the Lost Lands Open License from Frog Gog Games, I have decided to release some personal projects that I have been thinking about for years. Or you may know me as the guy who wrote An Cailleach, Buster Bone-Gnawer, Börker of Shadows, and Eldritch Elevations for MÖRK BORG.
What We Need & What You Get
The pdf for this is all laid out and ready to go, that means the content is written already and I can send out the pdf as soon as I get the funds from IGG. What this is funding is a limited print run through Mixam at a quality I can be proud to say I produced.
Any future printings of this would be print on demand, so not nearly as nice.

Risks & Challenges
There is not a lot that can go wrong with you getting the product at this point as everything is already written and laid out, but there can be shipping delays between Mixam and myself, as well as from me to you though I will do my best to mitigate these.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to support me otherwise, I have a patreon that gives free pdfs of my releases and grants access to my development channel on my Discord server. My patreon is https://www.patreon.com/michaelmars

story:
Crumbs is an award winning competitive area control game for 2-4 players. Play as the ducks, pigeons, squirrels, or chipmunks as they fight over breadcrumbs in a city park. Sweet Granny sits alone on the city park randomly distributing crumbs to the local fauna, blissfully unaware of the vicious war raging on. Each animal will use asymmetric powers to gather the most resources. The game involves lots of strategy mixed with the chaos of crumbs and animal meeples actually dropping onto the board every round.

 

CRUMBS is a game for 2 to 4 players taking on the role of park animals competing for the most bread crumbs, with a single game taking between 30-60 minutes.

It’s yet another sunny day in the city. Children play ball just across the pond, tourists stroll along the paved paths admiring the local foliage, and granny has just settled herself on a bench with a plastic baggie full those long-sought-for bits of stale bread.

Players begin by choosing one of four maps to play on!

The game comes with two boards each with two unique maps on it for maximum replayability! In order from left to right and top to bottom are: the standard map, the harder variant map, one based on the Boston Public Garden, and the other based on Central Park.

Players choose which of the four animal armies they'd like to control. Each animal has its own unique abilities and powers that let it dominate the map in their own way. The four animal armies are: 

Players will take their respective animal sheets and critters (our custom animal meeples) and prepare for battle! Play begins with the starting critters dropping onto the board to randomly determine the starting positions. The first player then takes their turn by drawing and resolving a Daily Buzz card, and performing as many actions as they want/can afford to. Their first movement is free, but all other actions require crumbs to perform. Those actions include:

 Movement - Cost: 2 Crumbs

 Spawn a Critter - Cost: 5 Crumbs

 Dog Drop - Cost: 2 Crumbs

 Dog Placement - Cost: 5 Crumbs

After taking all the actions they can they pass their turn to the left, and the next player takes their turn in the same way, and so on. Once all players have taken their turn, whichever animal has Granny's Favor then drops 20 crumbs onto the board!

Play continues like this until one player reaches 5 game points (or 7 for a longer game) at which time the round finishes, and crumbs are dropped and scored for a final time before deciding the winner. The animal with the most crumbs wins the game!

 

 You can find FULL RULES: HERE
 

 

 

 

This will be my first ever published game and I am excited for all of you to join me on this journey. I have spent years designing this game to get it where it is today, and many months preparing for its manufacture and distribution.

Board game publishing is a costly and complex affair involving many different processes and partners in order to achieve the designer's vision, and create a quality game. My primary goal is to provide a fun experience that everyone who plays the game can share with those around them.

I will be available throughout the production process to communicate directly with backers as often and as transparently as possible. Due to the ever-looming possibilities of hiccups and delays, I've included a lot of cushion in the November 2019 fulfillment estimate to insure the game arrives as or before expected, and, of course, in time for the holiday season. Due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Thank you to everyone for all their help!

story:
RPGnet is the top independent web site for tabletop roleplaying games. The heart of our site is one of the most talked-about forums in the industry — with 12,000 active members and almost 19 million posts. We also publish several gaming reviews every week and a few columns. Finally, we maintain a constantly expanding catalog of roleplaying products that currently indexes 19,000 games and supplements, 2,000 magazines, and 36,000 articles.

Note: Despite a typo in the expected shipping day for the Membership perk, our goal is to make sure that everything is allocated no later than January 2018 ... not ten years ago!

All of this costs money, so in 2013 we decided to turn to crowdfunding to encourage readers to become members, to support the site. The drive was successful, so we've turned into a yearly tradition.

In years past, we've thanked our members with proactive work that's helped to make the site a better place. That's included the reinstatement of the search function, the movement of the machines to a cloud platform, the revising of our reviews system, the improvement of review browsing, the enhancement of mobile access, and the improvement of security.

We'll be offering proactive work again this year, with a focus on upgrading the forums and on improving columns. However, we also want to offer another sort of thanks. So for the third year running we'll be offering some free PDFs in January and February to everyone who's a member, as long as we hit the core goal of this crowdfunding. So, join us now, and get some cool stuff for some cool RPGs. 

Following the end of this GoGo, you can sign up for a membership directly from RPGnet. Cool stuff will be available to everyone who signs up before the end of February.

We hope you'll become members to support a site that you use and enjoy. However, as long as we meet our core goal of $2,500$1,500 (see below), we'll also be giving out cool PDFs to all of our members in January and February 2018 thanks to some help from some great RPGs companies!

We have a number of great core rules this time around:

  • Blue Planet v2 Moderator's Guide & Player's Guide gives you everything you need to play a classic science-fiction game.
  • Shadow, Sword & Spell is a pulp fantasy RPG.
  • Sins of the Father is an indie game of dark familial legacies.
  • The Upwind Quickstart Primer is a sneak peak at a new fantasy of castles in the sky.

We also continue to offer more Colonial Gothic releases from Rogue Games:

  • Colonial Gothic: Lovecraft returns every year because it's a great look at the Lovecraftian underpinnings of the setting.
  • Colonial Gothic Settings expands that setting by detailing six towns in Colonial America.

Thanks to our product sponsors!

 

Though ads and affiliations pay some of our costs, we are picky about which ads and ad networks we use, so that we can maintain high-quality ads that are likely to be of interest and that won't distract our readers. We've opted out of high-value ads that include audio, that expand, or that are placed as interstitials between pages. We forbid dating ads, gambling ads, gold-farming ads, political ads, and certain other categories of advertising. 

As a result, we occasionally ask RPGnet readers to become members, in order to help support the community. We've done this on a somewhat ad hoc basis in the past, but now that crowdfunding has matured, we've turned to IndieGoGo for our annual RPGnet Membership Drive.

We hope that you'll join us, and help to support the RPGnet community.

Our goal for this IndieGoGo crowdfunding is simple: we want you to become an RPGnet member. Every single reward other than the $5 support level will grant you a membership at RPGnet. Most of them provide membership for the next year*, but we also offer Lifetime Memberships for Patrons and others who want to offer a higher level of support.

As a member, you'll receive a few benefits as thanks:

  • No Ads. You may choose to turn off some or all ads at RPGnet.
  • Forum Recognition. You'll receive a Member flag on your forum account.
  • Forum PMs. You get a larger 150-item PM Box and you can mail to users with full PM Boxes.
  • Forum Avatar. You can select a larger 60x60 avatar.
  • Early Columns Access. You can read columns before they're posted.
  • Early Review Access. You can read reviews before they're posted.
  • XP. Just for fun, we'll give you Experience Points every month, to reflect your contribution to the site.
  • Cool PDFs. Becoming a member is how you get access to the PDFs our sponsors are providing. From about 1/2/18 to 2/28/18, they'll be available as a free download directly from your membership panel. 

* We'll start all memberships shortly after this crowdfunding closes, once we get your forum account names. If you already have a yearly membership, we'll just add a year to your current end date. If you already have a lifetime membership, then we offer our thanks!

Your support ensures that we can continue to give RPGnet the same attention that we have in the past. However, we'd like to do more than that. If we raise higher levels of funds, we'll also work to make RPGnet more self-sufficient, so that its improvements don't depend upon Skotos staff not being busy with other tasks.

To ensure this, we'll guarantee increased staff time at many of our stretch goals. That will allow us to once more be proactive in 2018 and to put more time toward increasing the coolness of RPGnet. 

We gave our past sponsors the opportunity to renew their sponsorship buttons in advance of the GoGo and will be counting that toward the drive. As a result, we've lowered all our intended stretch goals by $1,000, thanks to the sponsorship renewal by DTRPG.

$1,500. Bag of PDFs. In 2016, we built up an interface to make PDFs available to you. When we hit our core goal of $2,500 we'll schedule our sponsor's 2018 contributions through the system, they're available to all members in January and February.

$4,000. Lenses of Clarion Column Contemplation. We've been expanding and improving our review and columns systems through the last two drives. In 2017, that focus was on our reviews, which are now better linked to our gaming index, allowing for better searches and better browsing. If we hit this new goal, we'll turn to our columns of offer some improved, tagged browsing of our columns system. This will be part of a week of proactive work, and if we finish the core columns work, we may return to index or reviews systems that could also use expansion.

$6,500. Option of vBulletin 5. A dramatic new vBulletin system has been maturing for a few years now. We use it at our Skotos site and we love the further improvements it makes to mobile support. However, we still have some qualms with spam protection, plug-in availability, and some other issues. If we hit this goal we'll consider a vB5 upgrade for RPGnet late in 2018. If we decide vB5 is still not ready, we'll keep it on our schedules to review year by year, and in the meantime we'll substitute with a +1 Staff week of work, where we focus on improving the site in more general ways.

$9,000. +1 Staff. Our chief programmer (Shannon) dedicates a full week of general work to RPGnet, absent any emergencies with our various machines. Our top priorities for this (and all other work time that we stretch in) will be: aggressively fixing bugs and adding cool features (fundamentally focusing on what our Patrons, Talkative Members, and Lifetime Members want to see).

$11,500. Cage of Security. a fourth and final week of proactive work. This one will be focused on securing the site, primarily by finishing on work to improve the security of our MySQL system.

$14,000. Bag of Holding. A new membership benefit? This stretch goal slot is undecided, so feel free to offer suggestions.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Kirich Solid Steel Warcraft Beasts

Here is a conversation I have almost daily at my desk:

Passer-by notices beats: "These is the coolest dragons I've ever seen!" 
Me: "I put them together myself from scrap metal." 
Passer-by tries to pick one up: "What the #$%# they are @#$@ awesome!"

Adjustable and Powerful Solid Steel  Beasts​

I like making metal crafts in my workshop. The handmade crafts have spiced up my life and given me a sense of achievement. However, there is something missing. I noticed that lots of scrap materials are wasted and just thrown away or melted down after I finished. 

Then I thought maybe I could figure out a way to reuse them. I put all the scrap metal pieces together and just looked at them for about half an hour. Suddenly, an idea hit me! I can turn these metal pieces into something awesome. 

In the following weeks, I focused on machining these metal scraps to some cool mythic beasts. I wanted to turn these wasted metal pieces into art piece!

Laser cutting with precision!

Later, I created a series of mythic beats: Fire Dragon, Frost Wyrm, Siberian Wolf, Griffin, Unicorn and Flying Tiger! Every beast is adjustable and moveable! You can make your favorite pose.

FIRE DRAGON

As the most mysterious beast, Fire Dragon is strong and powerful with two big wings. Each part is precisely machined. It looks so cool!

125mm*45mm*95mm. 

FROST WYRM

Frost Wyrms are the skeletal remains of adult blue dragons killed by the Scourge. These reanimated vessels of destruction do not fear death; they dispense it! They have a cold-based breath weapon that can do shattering damage to enemies both on the ground and in the air.  Who will win if the Fire Dragon fights with Frost Wyrm? We will see :)

130mm*45mm*117mm. 

GRIFFIN

I was addicted to Griffin so much when I read Greek mythology. It could fly fast with strong wings and defeat foes on land. Since antiquity, Griffins were known for guarding treasure and priceless possessions. I always asked my mom to buy me one, and now I made a one by myself. 

78mm*15mm*69mm.

FLYING TIGER

Also, I made an enemy Flying Tiger with with sharp teeth and powerful feet. We want to see who the winner will be if Flying Tiger fights with the Griffin.

90mm*15mm*60mm.

UNICORN

In the Middle Ages and Renaissance, it was commonly described as an extremely wild woodland creature, a symbol of purity and grace. its horn was said to have the power to render poisoned water potable and to heal sickness. I made it for those who still keep a innocent and young heart.

60mm*44mm*62mm.

SIBERIAN WOLF

Siberian Wolves live in packs and work together to hunt, raise their young, and protect their territory. We created it with a fierce face for delivering power to people and encourage them.

97mm*16mm*60mm.

My friends were totally amazed by these cool beasts and asked me where to get them. They were so surprised to know that I made them with the metals scraps we left in the workshop.

Get your favorite beast now!

Pledge today to help us make these cool Solid Steel Beasts a reality!

story:
This project is to fund a physical Beasts & Barbarians Game Master Screen and a Tomes of Ancient Lore booklet. 
Constructed from 2mm cardboard, one side of the four-panel Screen will have great art showing the glory of Dominions you love, while the GM's side has essential tables. And one of the stretch goals is new art from Ania Jarmołowska!
With that Screeen, you will receive Tomes of Ancient Lore, a booklet with materials both for GM and Players! From Astrology  to Combat Scenes sourcebook!

About Beasts and Barbarians!

Imagine a land, far away in space and time, dominated in the past by a cruel race of sorcerer-priests, the Keronians. Cursed by the gods, their empire was wiped out by a cataclysm, the fall of the Dread Star, which has thrown the world into barbarism and created the Dread Sea Dominions from the scattered ruins of the past.

It is a world of savage barbarians who venture into ancient ruins to save scantily-clad damsels from a fate worse than death at the claws of pre-human beastmen.

It is a world of chainmail bikini amazons fighting in the sun-scorched arenas of Faberterra to appease the crowds of the decadent cities of the Iron Empire.

It is a world where dark sorcerers invoke the forbidden names of demons in temples old before mankind took its first, hesitant, steps outside the caverns of the north.

This is the world of Beasts & Barbarians, where everything is built to evoke the feel of the pulp fantasy stories of the ’30s!

Hide Your Knowledge!

This project is to fund a physical Beasts & Barbarians Game Master Screen and a Tomes of Ancient Lore booklet.

Constructed from 2mm cardboard, one side of the four-panel Screen will have great art showing the glory of Dominions you love, while the GM's side has essential tables. And one of the stretch goals is new art from Ania Jarmołowska!

 

Tomes of Ancient Lore

This booklet will have something both for the Players and the GM.

For the Players: Star Signs of the Dominions! Heroes and gods are born under a particular star, the Priest Princes of Tricarnia say, and this small sourcebook introduces a new characterization option for your heroes: star signs! Each of them (draw a card during character creation to see which) gives a hero a particular knack, but also a Doom, something which is written in the stars for him (a useful adventure hook).

For the GM: Blades of the Dominions: A Sword & Sorcery Combat Scenes sourcebook. B&B adventures are famous for their detailed and compelling combat scenes. A small sourcebook of ready-to-play combat scenes (with terrains, chosen enemies, tactics and so on), each with Golden and Steel Bennies.

For example: interrupting a dark rite, escape through the snow, chase in the forest, charge into battle, naval combat, sorcerous duel, find the assassin. Plus a table of "ready to use" terrain elements (pillars, barrels, crowds of people etc...)

Shipping:

  • Poland $4
  • European Union, USA and Canada $10
  • Rest of the world $15

But, you if you bought physical copies of Steel Edition and paid for shipping, we can combine it, so you won`t pay for shipping twice! Just take Hidden Scoundrel​ perk! You should get it via email or via indiegogo update. If not, contact me at piotr (at) fajnerpg.pl

Creatures of the Dominions: One detailed monster plus a one sheet 

 

10$ - Hoplite of the Iron Empire:

You will get pdfs of the GM Screen, Tomes of Ancient Lore and all funded rewards.

20$ - Sage of Syranthia:

You will get a physical copy of the GM Screen and Tomes of Ancient Lore, plus all funded rewards in pdf.

70$ - Master of the Black Staff:

You will get a physical copy of the GM Screen and Tomes of Ancient Lore, Beasts & Barbarians Steel Edition Hardcover Player and Game Master Guides (with pdfs), a deck of Beasts & Barbarians cards and 28 B&B bennies - plus all funded rewards in pdf. (If you backed Steel Edition campaign at Tricarian Sorcerer level or higher, then you are already getting the hardcover books, deck of cards, and bennies.)

2000 $ - Funded!

Thank you for your awesome support! The Beasts & Barbarians GM screen is now a reality! The screen will be 34 x 11 inches when unfolded and 8.5 x 11 inches when folded, with the great Ania Jarmołowska art you love.

2750 $ - Creatures of the Dominions 1 – The Tree of Dreaming Death!

One of the most feared creatures of the Lush Jungle, the Tree of Dreaming Death is more than a simple plant: a verdant demon, a green stealer of souls; you will find the bones of all its past victims around its twisted roots…

3500 $ - Creatures of the Dominions 2 – The Mistress of Jackals!

I caught only a brief glimpse of her, among the pack: red of hair, strong of body, a fiery blaze burning in her eyes. She is Majakisa, Mistress of Jackals, the daughter of a Djinn and some devil of the Red Desert. She runs among the jackals, a full pack of giant ravenous beasts, hungry for our flesh!

5000 $ - Ania in the Dominions!

At this level, we will order a complete new set of screen art from Ania Jarmołowska!

Beasts & Barbarians Steel Edition and all the other things will be published/produced in cooperation with GRAmel/Fajne RPG, a Polish company known for Beasts & Barbarians Golden Edition, Adventurers!, Wolsung, Nemezis, and Polish editions of Savage Worlds and Deadlands. We have been in the market for more than 10 years and we have published almost 100 books and pdfs. We have also published a lot of board games and we are behind  Boardgames 4 U. We have access to all sorts of tabletop game accessories, and long experience in the international tabletop games market.

 Fajne RPGs have had 3 successful crowdfunding campaigns in Poland (Beszamel, Szare Szeregi and Beasts & Barbarians + Adventurers!), and have successfully delivered all rewards; their Beasts of the Dominions and Adventurers! crowdfunding has also been delivered successfully. We are workin on Steel Edition - some rewards were sent to clients, PG should be sent this week

We gather money mostly for printing and, above all, for great new art for you. If the campaign is successful, we will order art from our artists and do the final layout, then send first the pdfs, and then the printed books and other items.

story:
Reel Friends Playing Cards is a collaboration between over 40 animators to celebrate graduation, showcase their distinct art styles and create something fun.

Presented by the RMIT BDAIM* graduates of 2016, every card contains an original illustration by one of the participating animators. Traditional hand drawn animation, 3d modelling and rigging, stop motion and more come together in a massive display of diversity - all in one incredible deck of cards!

*BDAIM stands for Bachelor of Design, Animation and Interactive Media

 

Devon Kong - I'm organising the project and running the campaign!

Mike Srimuang - I make the campaign page look good!

Hayden Browne - I'm looking after the treasure.

 

Reel Friends Playing Cards is a classic deck of 54 playing cards. Like any normal deck of playing cards, these cards can be used in countless ways - from blackjack to solitaire to building card castles.

But how are these cards different from a normal deck of playing cards?

They are not! However, every single card in a deck of Reel Friends Playing Cards has an original illustration created by one of over 40 participating artists. With such a diverse cast of artists, each card is unique and interesting to look at. Is someone taking too much time on their turn? Check out the amazing art in your hand! Lost a few cards? You now have a collection of mini art prints!

 

This is a flexible funding campaign which means it will receive all the contributed funds even if the goal is not met at the end of the 40 day campaign. With this campaign we want to raise sufficient funds to cover the printing and delivery costs of the minimum production volume, which is roughly $1,000.

Any additional money the campaign receives will be used to raise the quality of the final product (eg. better quality card stock, better packaging, faster delivery). A portion of this money will also be used to cover expenses incurred by team members throughout the campaign (eg. printing tests, design costs). After taking all possible steps to use the money to create a better product, the remainder will be distributed to the team members.

Below is a list of upgrades we hope to achieve:

  • Cards printed on 270 gsm promotional card stock and shrink-wrapped (achieved)
  • Packaging upgrade - white tuck box (achieved)
  • Card stock upgrade - 300 gsm smooth stock (achieved)
  • Packaging upgrade - protective clear plastic case (achieved)
  • Card stock upgrade - professional quality 330 gsm extra smooth German card stock
  • Packaging upgrade - custom Reel Friends tuck box

 

Update:

The campaign has been successfully funded! Thank you for your support. Your orders will start getting shipped out throughout March, and some of you may have already received yours.

If you or someone you know missed out on getting a deck of cards, you can still order them on the Indiegogo page. Unfortunately, we are no longer able to offer the low prices from before as we no longer have access to the miracle that is bulk printing. However, the cards are as good as before and definitely worth every dollar. See you soon!

 

Aliff Dean | Aonghas Shearer-Boyd | Sapphire 'Arthur' Lobley | Ash Young | Benjamin Jones | Bonita Colles | Brandon Chung | Christopher Marks | Connie Boyce | Danielle Atkinson | Deanca Rensyta | Devon Kong | Dylan Langmaid | Emily Coop | Hayden James Browne | Helen Tsantikos | Jac Gelbart | Jaidon Powell | James Horner | James Lindsay | Jasmine Auchterlonie | Kangsun Royce Cho | Lauren Buttfield | Lilian Hii | Madie Palmieri | Michael Welst | Mike Srimuang | Ned Curwood-Hyde | Laura "OC" B | Lauren Buttfield | Leon Truong | Patricia Garcia | Rose Lo | Sam Lim | Saskia Milledge | Sean Carter | Skye Henwood | Skye Son | Stephanie Tran | Steve Kimber | Thomas Blackman-Bishop | Tim Sta-Ana | Tom Bell | Tom Murray | Veronika Aifeld | Yangong Qi | Yi Fu | Zada Herbert

story:
Do you have what it takes to rule as Fuhrer, Il Duce, Vozhd, Holy Roman Emperor, or Leader of the Only Free World? 

Supreme Leader is a game of political survival that will test your ability to make and hold alliances, build a strong economy, and eliminate other belligerent leaders to the United Nations. You will produce an income, make deals with other players, bribe your way out of tough spots, and purchase cards to bolster your plays and diminish your foes. However, be careful of how and who you send to the United Nations, because they will have to vote for you to become Supreme Leader in the final round of the game. 

 

With the base game, you have all you need to begin on your journey towards becoming Supreme Leader. The box will include 20 player cards (with the leaders pictured below), 60 Strategy Cards, 20 Event Cards, wooden income pieces, and a rulebook.  

With the base game, you will be able to play games of Supreme Leader with 5-10 players with an estimated playtime of 1 hour. Income pieces will be included in the box for players to collect as their income to use as a means to purchase Strategy Cards, make bribes, forge deals, and activate abilities.  

The promo leader pack will include 10 new leaders. 

Check out our rulebook at cardculturegames.com

If you would like to try our Print n Play, email us at cardculturegames@gmail.com

Components 

Player Card - Player cards are the historical leaders players will play as for the duration of the game. A player card will detail the leader's faction, income, influence, and special ability.

Strategy Card - Strategy Cards are cards that players can purchase from the marketplace during gameplay. These can be offensive, defensive, and economic in their nature. Their effects vary from stopping a person from voting, allowing cards to be purchased for a discount, or eliminating a player to the United Nations.

Event Cards - Event Cards are cards that are drawn after every elimination phase. They come in two types. Red and Green. A Red Event Card happens and the effect challenges players for the following round. These Event Cards cause the power dynamics to shift and change what players want to do for the round. A Green Event Card is an Event Card that brings a player out of the United Nations and back in play as an Active Player.

 

 Base Game

Due to the success of Supreme Leader on Kickstarter, we as a team have decided to include 5 additional leaders for the for the first print of Supreme Leader. These Leaders will be Vladaimir Lenin, Getulio Vargas, Queen Elizabeth I, Nelson Mandela, and Winston Churchill. 

Promo Pack

Leaders in the Promo Pack for the first print of Supreme Leader will be...

1. Josip Broz Tito
2. Huey P Newtown
3. Mahatma Ghandi
4. Genghis Khan
5. Charlemagne
6. Blackbeard
7. Maximilien Robespierre
8. Queen Himiko
9. Empress Wu Zetian
10. Cory Aquino

"This game made me an Anarchist" - David Callahan, Fourth-Year Political Science Student at the University of Central Florida 

"So my first time playing Supreme Leader, I was a little intimated because I was playing with experienced players and thought that I had to know all about history to truly understand and enjoy the game but to my surprise it was very straight-forward and it's a lot more about learning how to be strategic, form alliances, trust your gut, and deliberate well. I really enjoy playing Supreme Leader and it's even more fun when you're playing with other people who are fully invested in the game and paying attention. Some of my best memories of last year was playing the copy of the game at the shop and I can't wait until professional copies are available." - Silvia Daniela Mesa, the Boardgame Fanatic 

"Mixing the fun of a tabletop game with the nuance of politics is a difficult task to achieve successfully. This does both extremely well and adds a taste of the ultimate aphrodisiac. Power." 
- Cristobol Hernan Reyes Rios, journalist for the Miami Herald

"Nothing beats beers and battling friends in a game of Supreme Leader. Egos get burned, alliances fall apart, kingdoms crumble, but one leader will always rise to the top." - Molly Ward, singer and poet from Orlando, FL

"I absolutely love this game. You're never truly out of the game and backstabbing only gets you so far. I haven't seen a party game mixed with so much strategy before or one that utilizes charisma for a player's advantage."
- TabletopGameGal 

"I borrowed the prototype to play with some friends and it * was * awesome *. There's nothing quote like attempting to undermine your pals while pretending to be Joseph Stalin. As a big ol' history nerd, I love the concept, the 'characters' (real folks), and the competitiveness. So many twists and turns in this game and so many flexible, fun outcomes, and endless opportunities."
- BoardGameBetty 

https://mikemeeple.blogspot.com/2018/09/get-hyp... 

"Whereas most world domination style games require hours of hardened strategy to win, Supreme Leader relies on hand management and social manipulation...

Only time will tell if Supreme Leader Leader lives up to it's name, but with it's fun quick game play and deep strategy, I think it will leave people chanting "Long live the Supreme Leader!"
- Mike Meeple

https://youtu.be/KL3CMrOOEjA 

"Supreme Leader is a wonderful party game if you're tired of all the other games out that just make fun of stuff or just move around on the board. It's a great game to figure out which of your friends are thieving and conniving *profanities*. To see who is best on world domination, best on using their abilities, managing their resources, to buy the cards and play the cards when its the appropriate time. To be able to coerce everybody else to either not vote for them or to vote for them in the end."
- Logan Chops Reviews

https://youtu.be/-hqrAT9tKts 

Andrew:The thing I think I liked the most was the event cards, so the event cards kind of fluctuate what you want to do per turn, so one of the event cards was whoever had the most money has the potential to go in the United Nations, so we were all trying to throw our money and get rid of it all so whereas sometimes you want to save the money. [Event Cards] can change the strategy for that round.

Patrick: That was a really fun turn. I also agree it keeps the game fresh, it mixes it up every time you play since you're not going to come across every one of those event cards each game.

- Just Got Played

https://youtu.be/T6rJHskWKcw

"This game is similar to Survivor [the show] and similar to games like the Resistance in which you're going to be voting for people, but where it has it unique aspects is of course you can pick up certain items and use those as part of your deliberation. You're able to basically make any deal you want in this game and you're also able to break those deals. Another interesting thing is the UN being utilized throughout the game so when you're out you're not necessarily out like a game like Werewolf. You can still have your vote count.

It's a nice twist to these style of games."

- Unfiltered Gamer

 

Shipping anywhere in the United States - $7 

Shipping to Canada - $10

Shipping to the European Union - $15

Shipping to anywhere else in the world - $40

After the success of Supreme Leader on Kickstarter, we found a manufacturer (Meijia / Brilliant), got our freight company (OTX), and chose our fulfillment company (QuarterMaster Logistics).  We have put in an order for 1000 units of Supreme Leader. Now that we have approved for manufacturing we thought it would be a good time to run an IndieGoGo campaign. For the first print run of Supreme Leader we met a few stretch goals that will be present for IndieGoGo backers as well. 

Upgrades to Supreme Leader for the first print run only.

1. A game board for the Event Cards
2. Five bonus leaders in the Base Game (Vladimir Lenin & Queen Elizabeth I)
3. Upgraded our income pieces from gold plastic pieces to wooden tokens that are gold, silver, and brown to work in denominations of 1's, 5's and 10's.

Crowdfunding is an amazing platform for people to put forward their ideas. We chose IndieGoGo as a way to support an amazing platform as well as get Supreme Leader into the hands of more players. We love our fans and want to grow our community to be as large as possible!

At the University of Central Florida in Orlando, I studied political science. I have always been fascinated by power dynamics and struggles for power in the international or internal realm. I wanted to create a game that explores this topic in the comfort of the home. What makes a leader last? If it was a strong economy, the Kim Family wouldn't still be in power, if it was reforming society Khrushchev wouldn't have been ousted from the party in the USSR, if it was the most powerful army WWII would have ended much differently. So, Supreme Leader is supposed to answer the question of how does someone assume dictatorial powers and remain in that role? For me, I thought of this game when I was in my Russian Politics class and learned about Stalin's rise in the Soviet Union and how he was able to connive and weave his way into power over other higher ranking Bolsheviks and I was inspired even further in my French History class that showed how Napoleon was able to subvert the French Revolution and name himself Emperor for Life. 

The characters in the game are not there for shock value or a cash-grab this is a thought out game to explore power dynamics and the nuance of politics on a table. We understand that some of these characters may make some players uneasy, but we would just like to remind people that we don't condone any of the heinous or despotic decisions made by some of these leaders, but it would be disingenuous to not include leaders in the game that is delving into this issue. And mostly, the game is meant to be fun. It's strategy and a party game where friends are debating on voting for their friends and creating alliances and betraying their friends. If a leader bothers someone at the table, don't play with it! 

- Jackson Herold, the designer

Facebook | https://www.facebook.com/cardculturegames/
Twitter | https://twitter.com/card_culture
Instagram | https://www.instagram.com/cardculturegames/
Youtube I https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxouA2tu-yHmJY...

Website: www.cardculturegames.com
BoardGameGeek: BGG-SupremeLeader

Email: Cardculturegames@gmail.com 

 

Jackson Herold - Game Designer

Jackson Herold is a recent graduate from the University of Central Florida. Tabletop gaming has long been a huge passion for him with the majority of his friends during freshman year being made over the game table. He is the founder of Card Culture and the original designer for Supreme Leader. Jackson Herold graduated with a degree in political science and seeks to design games with a political and historical theme that can be enjoyed by all tabletop gamers whether new or experienced in the hobby. 

Garrett Power - The Numbers Guy

Garrett Power is an Orlando based designer and the "numbers guy" for Card Culture LLC. He helped design mechanics for Supreme Leader and did the quotes and numbers for manufacturing, artwork, and fulfillment companies. He is finishing up a degree at UCF and in his spare time plays tabletop and coaches youth Lacrosse.  

Michael Arcuri - Game Development and Promotion

Michael Arcuri is based out of Atlanta, he's helped design the mechanics of Supreme Leader as well as manages the social media for the company. In his spare time, Michael is pursuing a masters program in non-profit management at the University of Georgia and raps in Atlanta under the moniker "CURM". 


Art and Design :: Derek Perez of Peregon Creative

Derek Perez is an Atlanta based artist, illustrator and graphic designer. Derek has experience in the entertainment industry creating poster art for clients like RedBull Music, Avett Brothers, and Big Gigantic, as well as branding and packaging for a variety of clients.
story_txt: Do you have what it takes to rule as Fuhrer, Il Duce, Vozhd, Holy Roman Emperor, or Leader of the Only Free World? Supreme Leader is a game of political survival that will test your ability to make and hold alliances, build a strong economy, and eliminate other belligerent leaders to the United Nations. You will produce an income, make deals with other players, bribe your way out of tough spots, and purchase cards to bolster your plays and diminish your foes. However, be careful of how and who you send to the United Nations, because they will have to vote for you to become Supreme Leader in the final round of the game.  With the base game, you have all you need to begin on your journey towards becoming Supreme Leader. The box will include 20 player cards (with the leaders pictured below), 60 Strategy Cards, 20 Event Cards, wooden income pieces, and a rulebook.  With the base game, you will be able to play games of Supreme Leader with 5-10 players with an estimated playtime of 1 hour. Income pieces will be included in the box for players to collect as their income to use as a means to purchase Strategy Cards, make bribes, forge deals, and activate abilities.  The promo leader pack will include 10 new leaders. Check out our rulebook at cardculturegames.comIf you would like to try our Print n Play, email us at cardculturegames@gmail.comComponents Player Card - Player cards are the historical leaders players will play as for the duration of the game. A player card will detail the leader's faction, income, influence, and special ability.Strategy Card - Strategy Cards are cards that players can purchase from the marketplace during gameplay. These can be offensive, defensive, and economic in their nature. Their effects vary from stopping a person from voting, allowing cards to be purchased for a discount, or eliminating a player to the United Nations.Event Cards - Event Cards are cards that are drawn after every elimination phase. They come in two types. Red and Green. A Red Event Card happens and the effect challenges players for the following round. These Event Cards cause the power dynamics to shift and change what players want to do for the round. A Green Event Card is an Event Card that brings a player out of the United Nations and back in play as an Active Player.  Base GameDue to the success of Supreme Leader on Kickstarter, we as a team have decided to include 5 additional leaders for the for the first print of Supreme Leader. These Leaders will be Vladaimir Lenin, Getulio Vargas, Queen Elizabeth I, Nelson Mandela, and Winston Churchill. Promo PackLeaders in the Promo Pack for the first print of Supreme Leader will be...1. Josip Broz Tito2. Huey P Newtown3. Mahatma Ghandi4. Genghis Khan5. Charlemagne6. Blackbeard7. Maximilien Robespierre8. Queen Himiko9. Empress Wu Zetian10. Cory Aquino"This game made me an Anarchist" - David Callahan, Fourth-Year Political Science Student at the University of Central Florida "So my first time playing Supreme Leader, I was a little intimated because I was playing with experienced players and thought that I had to know all about history to truly understand and enjoy the game but to my surprise it was very straight-forward and it's a lot more about learning how to be strategic, form alliances, trust your gut, and deliberate well. I really enjoy playing Supreme Leader and it's even more fun when you're playing with other people who are fully invested in the game and paying attention. Some of my best memories of last year was playing the copy of the game at the shop and I can't wait until professional copies are available." - Silvia Daniela Mesa, the Boardgame Fanatic "Mixing the fun of a tabletop game with the nuance of politics is a difficult task to achieve successfully. This does both extremely well and adds a taste of the ultimate aphrodisiac. Power." - Cristobol Hernan Reyes Rios, journalist for the Miami Herald"Nothing beats beers and battling friends in a game of Supreme Leader. Egos get burned, alliances fall apart, kingdoms crumble, but one leader will always rise to the top." - Molly Ward, singer and poet from Orlando, FL"I absolutely love this game. You're never truly out of the game and backstabbing only gets you so far. I haven't seen a party game mixed with so much strategy before or one that utilizes charisma for a player's advantage."- TabletopGameGal "I borrowed the prototype to play with some friends and it * was * awesome *. There's nothing quote like attempting to undermine your pals while pretending to be Joseph Stalin. As a big ol' history nerd, I love the concept, the 'characters' (real folks), and the competitiveness. So many twists and turns in this game and so many flexible, fun outcomes, and endless opportunities."- BoardGameBetty https://mikemeeple.blogspot.com/2018/09/get-hyp... "Whereas most world domination style games require hours of hardened strategy to win, Supreme Leader relies on hand management and social manipulation...Only time will tell if Supreme Leader Leader lives up to it's name, but with it's fun quick game play and deep strategy, I think it will leave people chanting "Long live the Supreme Leader!"- Mike Meeplehttps://youtu.be/KL3CMrOOEjA "Supreme Leader is a wonderful party game if you're tired of all the other games out that just make fun of stuff or just move around on the board. It's a great game to figure out which of your friends are thieving and conniving *profanities*. To see who is best on world domination, best on using their abilities, managing their resources, to buy the cards and play the cards when its the appropriate time. To be able to coerce everybody else to either not vote for them or to vote for them in the end."- Logan Chops Reviewshttps://youtu.be/-hqrAT9tKts Andrew:The thing I think I liked the most was the event cards, so the event cards kind of fluctuate what you want to do per turn, so one of the event cards was whoever had the most money has the potential to go in the United Nations, so we were all trying to throw our money and get rid of it all so whereas sometimes you want to save the money. [Event Cards] can change the strategy for that round.Patrick: That was a really fun turn. I also agree it keeps the game fresh, it mixes it up every time you play since you're not going to come across every one of those event cards each game.- Just Got Playedhttps://youtu.be/T6rJHskWKcw"This game is similar to Survivor [the show] and similar to games like the Resistance in which you're going to be voting for people, but where it has it unique aspects is of course you can pick up certain items and use those as part of your deliberation. You're able to basically make any deal you want in this game and you're also able to break those deals. Another interesting thing is the UN being utilized throughout the game so when you're out you're not necessarily out like a game like Werewolf. You can still have your vote count.It's a nice twist to these style of games."- Unfiltered Gamer Shipping anywhere in the United States - $7 Shipping to Canada - $10Shipping to the European Union - $15Shipping to anywhere else in the world - $40After the success of Supreme Leader on Kickstarter, we found a manufacturer (Meijia / Brilliant), got our freight company (OTX), and chose our fulfillment company (QuarterMaster Logistics).  We have put in an order for 1000 units of Supreme Leader. Now that we have approved for manufacturing we thought it would be a good time to run an IndieGoGo campaign. For the first print run of Supreme Leader we met a few stretch goals that will be present for IndieGoGo backers as well. Upgrades to Supreme Leader for the first print run only.1. A game board for the Event Cards2. Five bonus leaders in the Base Game (Vladimir Lenin & Queen Elizabeth I)3. Upgraded our income pieces from gold plastic pieces to wooden tokens that are gold, silver, and brown to work in denominations of 1's, 5's and 10's.Crowdfunding is an amazing platform for people to put forward their ideas. We chose IndieGoGo as a way to support an amazing platform as well as get Supreme Leader into the hands of more players. We love our fans and want to grow our community to be as large as possible!At the University of Central Florida in Orlando, I studied political science. I have always been fascinated by power dynamics and struggles for power in the international or internal realm. I wanted to create a game that explores this topic in the comfort of the home. What makes a leader last? If it was a strong economy, the Kim Family wouldn't still be in power, if it was reforming society Khrushchev wouldn't have been ousted from the party in the USSR, if it was the most powerful army WWII would have ended much differently. So, Supreme Leader is supposed to answer the question of how does someone assume dictatorial powers and remain in that role? For me, I thought of this game when I was in my Russian Politics class and learned about Stalin's rise in the Soviet Union and how he was able to connive and weave his way into power over other higher ranking Bolsheviks and I was inspired even further in my French History class that showed how Napoleon was able to subvert the French Revolution and name himself Emperor for Life. The characters in the game are not there for shock value or a cash-grab this is a thought out game to explore power dynamics and the nuance of politics on a table. We understand that some of these characters may make some players uneasy, but we would just like to remind people that we don't condone any of the heinous or despotic decisions made by some of these leaders, but it would be disingenuous to not include leaders in the game that is delving into this issue. And mostly, the game is meant to be fun. It's strategy and a party game where friends are debating on voting for their friends and creating alliances and betraying their friends. If a leader bothers someone at the table, don't play with it! - Jackson Herold, the designerFacebook | https://www.facebook.com/cardculturegames/Twitter | https://twitter.com/card_cultureInstagram | https://www.instagram.com/cardculturegames/Youtube I https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxouA2tu-yHmJY...Website: www.cardculturegames.comBoardGameGeek: BGG-SupremeLeaderEmail: Cardculturegames@gmail.com  Jackson Herold - Game DesignerJackson Herold is a recent graduate from the University of Central Florida. Tabletop gaming has long been a huge passion for him with the majority of his friends during freshman year being made over the game table. He is the founder of Card Culture and the original designer for Supreme Leader. Jackson Herold graduated with a degree in political science and seeks to design games with a political and historical theme that can be enjoyed by all tabletop gamers whether new or experienced in the hobby. Garrett Power - The Numbers GuyGarrett Power is an Orlando based designer and the "numbers guy" for Card Culture LLC. He helped design mechanics for Supreme Leader and did the quotes and numbers for manufacturing, artwork, and fulfillment companies. He is finishing up a degree at UCF and in his spare time plays tabletop and coaches youth Lacrosse.  Michael Arcuri - Game Development and PromotionMichael Arcuri is based out of Atlanta, he's helped design the mechanics of Supreme Leader as well as manages the social media for the company. In his spare time, Michael is pursuing a masters program in non-profit management at the University of Georgia and raps in Atlanta under the moniker "CURM". Art and Design :: Derek Perez of Peregon CreativeDerek Perez is an Atlanta based artist, illustrator and graphic designer. Derek has experience in the entertainment industry creating poster art for clients like RedBull Music, Avett Brothers, and Big Gigantic, as well as branding and packaging for a variety of clients.

story:
Surfer Girls

by Apapico

We bring you the pop-anime art of Apapico titled Surfer Girls. Apapico works tirelessly at building his reputation as an anime artist, and we think it shows. His technique of using bold neon colors in an almost surreal but simplistic setting really draws you in. 

In Surfer Girls, it appears that the walls of reality are being torn away, allowing us to look in from another dimension at two young ladies enjoying a late summer afternoon as the sun starts to set, casting shafts of light and shadows about the room.  The girl sipping ramune, or soda, is possibly reminiscing about the day’s activities and what they’ll do tomorrow, while the other girl is deep in the moment of her reading, or studying, while her cat dreams blissfully next to her. There is so much you can get out of this picture, and we think it would make a fantastic puzzle, as with all our puzzles. We hope you agree.

 

What We’re Offering

  • Exact Puzzle Dimensions: 27.52" x 19.57" (69.90 cm x 49.70 cm)
  • Each puzzle comes in a Limited Edition box: 14 5/8" x 10 5/8" x 2 1/8" (37.16 cm x 27 cm x 6.68 cm). 
  • Each puzzle and box has a textured linen finish, featuring pristine imagery with bright, bold, and beautiful colors. 
  • Manufactured in Europe with the highest quality materials. 
  • Certificate of Authenticity and Exclusive Postcard included with each puzzle.

 

This Campaign

In addition to Surfer Girls we are also offering The Gargoyle Keeper by Scott Gustafson, Welcoming all Wonders and Dragon King's Daughter by Fuzichoco, as well as Spring in Sakuragaoka by Aymeric Kevin and A Late Breakfast by Imoman, two puzzles that were produced last year thanks to some amazing Kickstarter and Indiegogo backers! You know who you are =)

 

The Gargoyle Keeper

by Scott Gustafson

 

Welcome All Wonders

by Fuzichoco

Dragon King's Daughter

by Fuzichoco

Spring in Sakuragaoka

by AYMRC

A Late Breakfast

by IMOMAN

 

Shipping: What EVERY Backer Needs To Know

Shipping

All US rewards will be fulfilled by us, Playing Grounded. Rewards shipping to backers in Europe and internationally will be fulfilled by Happyshops. We want to reiterate that single puzzle rewards shipped to countries outside the US are NOT shipped with tracking. I'm sorry, but we would have to charge a much higher shipping rate to provide tracking, and we imagine that most backers would not want to pay the extra cost. If you do, let us know, we could make an exception for those willing to pay, but then you’d be better off pledging for two puzzles. As always, rewards of two or more puzzles are shipped with tracking. 

 

 

VAT, Sales Tax and Customs Fees 

As with any Kickstarter (crowdfund or online sales platform), you probably know that backers are responsible for paying customs fees and VAT when and where applicable. We know for certain that our backers who reside in Germany will need to pay VAT on their pledge, and Pennsylvania residents will be charged sales tax. Those of you living outside Germany and USA might also be responsible for paying customs fees. We haven't had any complaints about that, but I hear rumors that some countries are becoming stricter. Please note: Shipping will be added when you make your pledge. VAT and sales tax, if applicable, will be added after the campaign when you fill out your survey. 

 

Brexit

Honestly, we have no idea what is going to happen when Brexit goes through or not. We're trying to stay up on the latest news, but we just don't know how or if it's going to affect shipping to the UK. If all goes as planned, we should be shipping the puzzles by August/September 2019 at the latest. We should have a better grasp of the situation long before then. Please be sure to read our updates to stay informed.

 

Who Are We?

 

We [Eric & Lara Andersen] are Playing Grounded, a somewhat trendy but thoroughly unique jigsaw puzzle company that offers a small but wonderful collection of artworks by tremendously talented artists geared toward teens, young adults and the youthful minded. We select art that is colorful, energetic and alluring without being overly provocative or offensive in anyway, so they can be enjoyed by practically anyone.

 

 

From the moment you hold a Playing Grounded puzzle box in your hands you’ll feel the difference. From the quality of our boxes, to the perfect fit of our pieces, we want your experience with our puzzles to leave memorable moments.

 

 

Thank you for your support!

 

Risks and challenges


This will be our fourth time placing an order with this manufacturer. We feel confident that they will deliver the same quality within a reasonable time frame, although, as we discovered last year, timing is everything. We ran into delays last year because we got our order in during a very busy time. We’re hoping that running the campaign earlier in the year will give us more leeway.

We want everyone to understand that due to high shipping costs, we cannot offer tracking for single puzzle rewards being shipped outside of the US. We would have to charge much more shipping for those backers, and the rates just increased this month. However, this also means that there is a risk of the packages getting lost and either being returned to Happyshops or never being found (or being stolen, as in the case of one backer). It is a risk and we did face this last year.

We also have to consider things out of our control such as natural disasters in your area or if your country’s postal service is having issues or is on strike, like in the case of the Canada Postal Service strike last year, then packages may not be delivered and will be returned to Happyshops. If we know of such things beforehand, we may opt to delay shipping your rewards in order to avoid such confusion and being charged return shipping fees, which can be pretty steep!

As mentioned above, there might be some risk associate with UK rewards, depending on what happens with the Brexit ruling. We hope shipping rates for rewards will not be affected, and that we’ll be able to safely ship to the UK, but we can’t make any promises right now.

Please know that we will keep you informed every step of the way through updates, comments, and when necessary, private messages. If there are delays or issues, you will all be notified. Please message us with questions at any point during and post-campaign.
