story:
"Potentially interesting game" - Daniel Finkel, Math For Love

"...sounds like a good intro to math, yet capable of manipulation in a way that allows strategic thinking." - Rohan George

" ...intended for Christmas gifts... I think these will also be great for volunteering with youth and for fun times with nieces and nephews...a truly practical and fun game!" - Toni Dickerson

"I really liked the idea." - Michael Flagler

"My granddaughter (8 years old) absolutely loves 3 sticks.  We play it every time my husband and I visit them...Mind Your Numbers seemed to be a similar, but different type of game so it seemed like a good thing to buy." - Sue Jelensnianski

"There’s a kid from church I math tutor…and I figure this will help. :-) "- Alan Fahrner

My youngest daughter loves math... my older daughter, not so much.  This game sounds very fun and like a good way to engage them both in math skills... It's a really cool idea." - Jody Nelson

"...it could be used to spread 'STEAM’"  - Ian Stephenson

"I am a retired elementary principal and primary teacher. I am a big believer in making learning "fun" and I believe it can best be accomplished through play...Thank you for your commitment to our youth and frankly, to ALL ages who continue to grow and develop when they are engaged in activities that encourage them to think, strategize and communicate." - John Devine​

Using just 9 numbers and 12 symbols, players compete for 9 rounds to earn points with higher results. Planning when to use which number and symbol combination holds the key to winning. And the combination changes every time you play due to two randomly chosen mystery numbers that are hidden from opponents and award bonus points in the end. 

Mind Your Numbers is not only a revolutionary way for kids to practice arithmetic, but also eases math anxiety and over time, develops a curiosity to learn. We need your support to bring Mind Your Numbers to life and change the way kids all over the world perceive math.

 
Watch us play a full game to understand a player's thoughts, strategies and learning while playing Mind Your Numbers here:

 

See the full video of how to play including three- and four-player versions here:

Place the two player boards and the mystery board in the center. Each player gets nine numbers and twelve symbols that are arranged such that they remain visible to the opponent at all times. Choose who plays first; to decide randomly, players may pick one mystery number each and the one with higher number plays first. Shuffle the nine mystery numbers with their face down and pick two numbers each. Keep the brown and red cubes handy.

The game is played over nine rounds. In each round, the following five steps are repeated. 

  1. Players place one symbol and one number on their boards in the following order: 
    • Player 1 places any one symbol.
    • Player 2 places any one symbol other than that placed by Player 1.
    • Player 1 places any one number.
    • Player 2 places any one number.
  2. Based on the tiles used, two simple calculations are made. The player with higher result wins the round and earns one brown cube, which denotes one point: 
    • Player 1's Result: Player 1's Number <Player 1's Symbol> Player 2's Number.
    • Player 2's Result: Player 2's Number <Player 2's Symbol> Player 1's Number.
  3. If either or both results are exactly equal to 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9, place one brown cube each in their places on the mystery board.
  4. Discard the used numbers and symbols.
  5. Exchange player boards such that Player 2 in this round plays first the next round.

Repeat these steps for nine rounds i.e., until all numbers are exhausted and only three symbols remain unused. 

At the end of nine rounds, players reveal their mystery numbers and collect the cubes available from the corresponding numbers on the mystery board. Count each brown cube as one point and each red cube as three points. The player with most total points wins the game. 

 

By adding just one more set of the same box, the game can be expanded to include three or four players. Use the other side of the player boards and number & symbol tiles for three or four players. Use only one mystery board and one set of mystery numbers.

There are three main differences between a two-player and a three- or a four-player game: 

  • Comparisons: A two player game involves only one comparison in each round. However, using the same number and symbol combinations, a three-player game involves three comparisons and a four-player game involves four comparisons in each round. 
  • Player Symbols: In a two player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that used by Player 1.
    • In a three-player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that of Player 1 and Player 3's symbol may not match that of both Player 2 AND Player 1.
    • Similarly, in a four-player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that of Player 1, Player 3's symbol may not match that of Player 2 and Player 4's symbol may not match that of both Player 3 AND Player 1.

​​

  • Exchange Of Player Boards: At the end of each round, player boards are rotated in clockwise direction with the following exceptions: 
    • In a three-player game:
      • At the end of round 4, instead of rotating in clockwise direction, exchange player boards 1 and 3. This changes the direction of comparison for the second half of the game. Continue rotating in clockwise direction from round 5. 

 

  • In a four-player game: 
    • At the end of round 4, instead of rotating in clockwise direction, exchange player boards 1 and 3. 
    • At the end of round 8, exchange player boards 1 and 4. This allows the players sitting opposite to each other compete for at least one round.

Mind Your Numbers is an easy game to understand how to play. Anyone who knows how to add, subtract, multiply and divide single digit numbers can play. Yet, one needs to plan the usage of numbers and symbols well enough to outsmart the opponent and win. The following are some important factors to keep in mind to play well: 

  • Multiplication's Nemesis: Number 1

A multiplication symbol usually yields a higher result. However, you may not want to use it when your opponent has the number tile 1. Here's why: 

  •  6 x 1 = 6 while 6 + 1 = 7. Opponent earns a point. 
  •  6 x 1 = 6 and 6 / 1 is also = 6. Both players earn a point.

  • Subtraction vs division

Note: when using subtraction, always subtract the lesser number from the greater number and when using division, always divide the greater number by the lesser number. 

To achieve higher results, the best bets are to use multiplication and addition. But there are only six of those, which means you still need to figure out when to use subtraction or division symbols for at least three rounds.  Here's the logic to keep in mind for such situations: 

  • Subtraction will yield a higher result than division in most cases except when the two numbers used are consecutive. When consecutive numbers are used, subtraction results are always 1, but division results are >=1 and <=2.

  • Mystery Numbers Are The Key

For more serious players who understand math well, mystery numbers hold the key to winning. One must try to maximize points won through mystery numbers, which requires careful planning of number and symbol combinations. A generalized thumb rule would be:

  • For mystery numbers that are >4, addition symbol is most useful.
  • For mystery numbers <=4, subtraction symbol is most useful.

Make the best use of these symbols by using them as a second player and making the right number combinations to match the results with your mystery numbers

  • Perfect Combinations: By using the right symbol and number combinations, you may be able to match both results with your two mystery numbers in the same round. 

  • Observe Opponent's Moves: While trying to earn points through mystery numbers, players leave hints about their mystery numbers. Try to guess quickly and make sure you limit potential opportunities for the opponent to make points using his/her mystery numbers. On the other hand, your opponent also tries to guess your mystery numbers. Try bluffing to give wrong hints. 
  • Push Results Beyond Mystery Board: Mystery board only awards points for results that exactly match whole numbers between 1 and 9. By yielding results that are >9 (using multiplication and addition) or have decimal values (using division), you can make sure that the opponent doesn't get points from mystery board. 

  • Nine Numbers (1 to 9): Two sets, one for each player. Turn backside for three- and four-player colors.
  • Twelve Symbols (addition, subtraction, multiplication & division): Two sets, three of each type. Turn backside for three- and four-player colors.
  • Two Player Boards: One board for each player. Turn backside for three or four players. Note that the placeholders for numbers and symbols and the rules associated with symbol placement are clearly marked on each board.
  • Nine Mystery Numbers (1 to 9): One set to make sure each player gets a different mystery number. Use only one set for three or four players as well.
  • One Mystery Board: With the numbers 1 to 9 marked, the mystery board allows players to keep track of the player results in each round.
  • Brown & Red Cubes: Wooden cubes for players to keep track of their points. Each brown cube denotes one point and each red cube denotes three points. Every time a player has three brown cubes, replace with one red cube. The same may be done on the mystery board as well.
  • Game Rules: Fully illustrated rules sheet with clear steps and order to follow to play the game. Includes detailed instructions for three and four players as well. See a pdf version here.

The game idea for Mind Your Numbers was conceptualized in October 2016 when we were looking for a way to make arithmetic interesting. We immediately knew we had a game with great potential. Since then, Mind Your Numbers went through several iterations of game mechanics, graphic design, and play-testing. Today, we are confident, proud of our creation and have no doubt that it will help in changing the perception of learning arithmetic.

A compelling, creative and challenging family entertainer that will leave kids (and even adults) fascinated about the beauty of geometry.

The game includes sticks of three different lengths - 3 units, 4 units and 5 units long. Each player places two sticks in their turn on a central board, adjoining any existing sticks in an attempt to create geometric shapes. Based on the size of the shape (perimeter) and its complexity (number of sides), players earn points. The first player to reach a total score of 500 points wins!

Four scientists from across the world were invited by the Earth Vision Industrial Labs (E.V.I.L), to create a chemical potion that would eradicate malnutrition from our planet.

However, after reaching the laboratory, the scientists realize that the E.V.I.L Chairman had other plans in mind and wants to rule the world with a potent mind control potion. On refusing to cooperate, they were locked-up within the laboratory. The only way out is through a warden's office, whose only weakness is magic. Can you help them escape E.V.I.L by using the chemicals within the lab to perform magic?

Samrat is a board game that takes you back to 12th - 13th century medieval India. This is the time when Muhammad Ghori unravels his plans to take over India, which was ruled by Prithviraj Chauhan from Delhi and Raja Jaichand from Kannauj in the current state of Uttar Pradesh. To the west, Gujarat was under the rule of Raja Bhimdev II.

While history notes the success story of how Muhammad Ghori defeats these kings, Samrat gives the players another chance to rewrite history. Rule like a king - generate resources, raise an army, attack other players.

Know more about our games and their ratings on Amazon: USA, India.

 

Kitki is a game-based learning startup that started in 2013 to help kids realize how fascinating learning really is. During the first two years, we worked with schools to organize experiential learning workshops and life exposure programs to stimulate curiosity among kids. It was then that we realized how effective games can be at creating an active learning environment for kids and changing their perception of learning. In the last two years, we created three exciting board games based on geometry (Three Sticks), chemistry (Escape EVIL) and Indian history (Samrat). Mind Your Numbers will be our fourth game, while a fifth game called Space Pirates will arrive in early 2018.

 

Pramod Ponnaluri: Founder of Kitki and the brain behind the games.

Rohini Deepthi Natti: Co-Founder of Kitki and the lady with the digital brush.

Packing Team: Bhagya, Arjun, Balamani, Nagamani

Aditya: Our 2-month old cheerleader and the excuse for any delays :)

Kavikrut: Mentor and the Harvard MBA with the entrepreneurial wisdom.

3D Printing Partner:  

Manufacturing Partners:  

Logistics Partner: 

  1. As the game design, playtesting and artwork are mostly completed, the next major stage is manufacturing the game. While the size specifications of game material and print quality may vary to optimize the cost, we have mitigated these risks to a large extent. Our previous expense of manufacturing games and our dependable manufacturing partners gives us the confidence to deliver our promise.
  2. Since the past two years, we have been shipping our games with UPS. We faced little trouble with their professionalism and delivery timelines. We are confident in their ability to successfully manage our international shipping requirements.
  3. Timelines have been planned keeping in mind the discussions with our potential partners. We are already at the proofing stage of the designs and will start manufacturing soon. At this stage, we do not expect any delays in manufacturing and shipping processes. Once again, our previous experience in manufacturing games and shipping them gives us the confidence that the risk is minimal.

    Contributing money is only one of the several ways you can be a part of this revolution. For Mind Your Numbers and our Playing Is Learning project to truly succeed, we need to raise awareness about how learning is a fascinating experience and that forced learning may do more harm than good. Let's learn for the right reason. Let's learn because learning is so exciting!

    Be our ambassador, let your friends know about us. Connect us with parents, teachers and schools. Introduce us to board game lovers, reviewers and media. Together, we can change the way learning is perceived.

    Thank you for helping us!
story_txt:
"Potentially interesting game" - Daniel Finkel, Math For Love"...sounds like a good intro to math, yet capable of manipulation in a way that allows strategic thinking." - Rohan George" ...intended for Christmas gifts... I think these will also be great for volunteering with youth and for fun times with nieces and nephews...a truly practical and fun game!" - Toni Dickerson "I really liked the idea." - Michael Flagler "My granddaughter (8 years old) absolutely loves 3 sticks.  We play it every time my husband and I visit them...Mind Your Numbers seemed to be a similar, but different type of game so it seemed like a good thing to buy." - Sue Jelensnianski"There’s a kid from church I math tutor…and I figure this will help. :-) "- Alan FahrnerMy youngest daughter loves math... my older daughter, not so much.  This game sounds very fun and like a good way to engage them both in math skills... It's a really cool idea." - Jody Nelson"...it could be used to spread 'STEAM’"  - Ian Stephenson"I am a retired elementary principal and primary teacher. I am a big believer in making learning "fun" and I believe it can best be accomplished through play...Thank you for your commitment to our youth and frankly, to ALL ages who continue to grow and develop when they are engaged in activities that encourage them to think, strategize and communicate." - John Devine​Using just 9 numbers and 12 symbols, players compete for 9 rounds to earn points with higher results. Planning when to use which number and symbol combination holds the key to winning. And the combination changes every time you play due to two randomly chosen mystery numbers that are hidden from opponents and award bonus points in the end. Mind Your Numbers is not only a revolutionary way for kids to practice arithmetic, but also eases math anxiety and over time, develops a curiosity to learn. We need your support to bring Mind Your Numbers to life and change the way kids all over the world perceive math. Watch us play a full game to understand a player's thoughts, strategies and learning while playing Mind Your Numbers here:

 
See the full video of how to play including three- and four-player versions here:Place the two player boards and the mystery board in the center. Each player gets nine numbers and twelve symbols that are arranged such that they remain visible to the opponent at all times. Choose who plays first; to decide randomly, players may pick one mystery number each and the one with higher number plays first. Shuffle the nine mystery numbers with their face down and pick two numbers each. Keep the brown and red cubes handy.The game is played over nine rounds. In each round, the following five steps are repeated. 
Players place one symbol and one number on their boards in the following order: 
Player 1 places any one symbol.
Player 2 places any one symbol other than that placed by Player 1.
Player 1 places any one number.
Player 2 places any one number.



Based on the tiles used, two simple calculations are made. The player with higher result wins the round and earns one brown cube, which denotes one point: 
Player 1's Result: Player 1's Number <Player 1's Symbol> Player 2's Number.
Player 2's Result: Player 2's Number <Player 2's Symbol> Player 1's Number.



If either or both results are exactly equal to 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, or 9, place one brown cube each in their places on the mystery board.

Discard the used numbers and symbols.

Exchange player boards such that Player 2 in this round plays first the next round.

Repeat these steps for nine rounds i.e., until all numbers are exhausted and only three symbols remain unused. At the end of nine rounds, players reveal their mystery numbers and collect the cubes available from the corresponding numbers on the mystery board. Count each brown cube as one point and each red cube as three points. The player with most total points wins the game.  By adding just one more set of the same box, the game can be expanded to include three or four players. Use the other side of the player boards and number & symbol tiles for three or four players. Use only one mystery board and one set of mystery numbers.There are three main differences between a two-player and a three- or a four-player game: 
Comparisons: A two player game involves only one comparison in each round. However, using the same number and symbol combinations, a three-player game involves three comparisons and a four-player game involves four comparisons in each round. 

Player Symbols: In a two player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that used by Player 1.
In a three-player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that of Player 1 and Player 3's symbol may not match that of both Player 2 AND Player 1.
Similarly, in a four-player game, Player 2's symbol may not match that of Player 1, Player 3's symbol may not match that of Player 2 and Player 4's symbol may not match that of both Player 3 AND Player 1.


​​Exchange Of Player Boards: At the end of each round, player boards are rotated in clockwise direction with the following exceptions: In a three-player game:At the end of round 4, instead of rotating in clockwise direction, exchange player boards 1 and 3. This changes the direction of comparison for the second half of the game. Continue rotating in clockwise direction from round 5. 


 In a four-player game: 
At the end of round 4, instead of rotating in clockwise direction, exchange player boards 1 and 3. 
At the end of round 8, exchange player boards 1 and 4. This allows the players sitting opposite to each other compete for at least one round.


Mind Your Numbers is an easy game to understand how to play. Anyone who knows how to add, subtract, multiply and divide single digit numbers can play. Yet, one needs to plan the usage of numbers and symbols well enough to outsmart the opponent and win. The following are some important factors to keep in mind to play well: Multiplication's Nemesis: Number 1A multiplication symbol usually yields a higher result. However, you may not want to use it when your opponent has the number tile 1. Here's why: 
 6 x 1 = 6 while 6 + 1 = 7. Opponent earns a point. 
 6 x 1 = 6 and 6 / 1 is also = 6. Both players earn a point.
Subtraction vs divisionNote: when using subtraction, always subtract the lesser number from the greater number and when using division, always divide the greater number by the lesser number. To achieve higher results, the best bets are to use multiplication and addition. But there are only six of those, which means you still need to figure out when to use subtraction or division symbols for at least three rounds.  Here's the logic to keep in mind for such situations: Subtraction will yield a higher result than division in most cases except when the two numbers used are consecutive. When consecutive numbers are used, subtraction results are always 1, but division results are >=1 and <=2.Mystery Numbers Are The KeyFor more serious players who understand math well, mystery numbers hold the key to winning. One must try to maximize points won through mystery numbers, which requires careful planning of number and symbol combinations. A generalized thumb rule would be:
For mystery numbers that are >4, addition symbol is most useful.
For mystery numbers <=4, subtraction symbol is most useful.
Make the best use of these symbols by using them as a second player and making the right number combinations to match the results with your mystery numbersPerfect Combinations: By using the right symbol and number combinations, you may be able to match both results with your two mystery numbers in the same round. 
Observe Opponent's Moves: While trying to earn points through mystery numbers, players leave hints about their mystery numbers. Try to guess quickly and make sure you limit potential opportunities for the opponent to make points using his/her mystery numbers. On the other hand, your opponent also tries to guess your mystery numbers. Try bluffing to give wrong hints. 

Push Results Beyond Mystery Board: Mystery board only awards points for results that exactly match whole numbers between 1 and 9. By yielding results that are >9 (using multiplication and addition) or have decimal values (using division), you can make sure that the opponent doesn't get points from mystery board. 

Nine Numbers (1 to 9): Two sets, one for each player. Turn backside for three- and four-player colors.

Twelve Symbols (addition, subtraction, multiplication & division): Two sets, three of each type. Turn backside for three- and four-player colors.

Two Player Boards: One board for each player. Turn backside for three or four players. Note that the placeholders for numbers and symbols and the rules associated with symbol placement are clearly marked on each board.

Nine Mystery Numbers (1 to 9): One set to make sure each player gets a different mystery number. Use only one set for three or four players as well.

One Mystery Board: With the numbers 1 to 9 marked, the mystery board allows players to keep track of the player results in each round.

Brown & Red Cubes: Wooden cubes for players to keep track of their points. Each brown cube denotes one point and each red cube denotes three points. Every time a player has three brown cubes, replace with one red cube. The same may be done on the mystery board as well.

Game Rules: Fully illustrated rules sheet with clear steps and order to follow to play the game. Includes detailed instructions for three and four players as well. See a pdf version here.

story:
I used a previous campaign (in the dark ages of 2014) to produce my first range (Evil men miniatures). You can always have a look here : Laran miniatures.

I since connected with a bunch of 10mm enthusiasts playing Fantasy games in 10mm. I produced more minis thanks to the financial participation of the members of the Minihammer group on FB. Thank you very much Martin Dahl for pestering me about your need of 10mm characters. Thanks to everyone else for trusting me.

I feel it is now time to introduce a full new range : The Unseen.

 

 

 

From their underground lairs, the Unseen pour on the world to finally reclaim their legitimate possession : survival of the fittest. Nobody has ever meet one of these abhumans and survived to tell his story. Hearsays state that you can have a glimpse at some disgusting grouts and tails if you have the misfortune to cross path with one of them ; they never lurk alone though. 

I propose to bring to life these evil lurkers with core units, characters, monsters, warmachines and more...With your help I'll pay for all the moulds (preproduction and production) and get the machine going.

 

The range - description and pricing

I intend to produce 10 different packs to begin with :

  • 5 Credits - Warriors : 20 assorted one hand weapons with shields. Banner and musician included.
  • 5 Credits - Slaves : 20 blades. 2 slavers with whip included.
  • 5 Credits - Lep-priests : 20 flails bearer. Banner included.
  • 5 Credits - Nin-rats : 20 assorted one hand weapons. (Even seen some throwing stars in there). Banner and musician included.
  • 5 Credits - Techno-elite : 20 elite warriors with two handed great weapons. Banner and musician included.
  • 5 Credits - Ra-trolls : 4 giant unholy creatures. (eye-level : 20mm)
  • 10 Credits - Characters : 5 human sized heroes and 1 Ra-troll leader.
  • 7 Credits - Great Avatar : Incarnation of the god of the Unseen (eye-level 28mm)
  • 8 Credits - Wheel of misfortune : one giant machinery to roll onto your enemies. (30mm diameter)
  • 10 Credits - Multipurpose Frame : one giant machinery pushed around by 2 Ra-trolls. Included 3 options to build a catapulte trébuchet, an energy cannon or a giant wrecking ball.

    Stretch Goals :
  • 5 Credits - Special weapons team : 20 infantry with long rifles, chemical weapons...exact proportions remain to be decided.
  • 5 Credits - Mischief of rats : A swarm of rats to infest your dungeons, caves or streets. (Exact content of the pack to be determined)
  • 5 credits - Evil men Raiders : 12 Light cavalry for the Evil men. Banner and Musician included.
  • 7 credits - Evil men Giant : 40 mm top of the head.
  • 7 Credits - Good men Griffon : one Hero on Griffon.
  • 7 Credits - Giant Rat : pretty self explanatory.
  • 3 credits - Slavery Bell : Option of weapon for the MPF. The slaves and their masters gather when the metallic sound echoes in the canyons, as they know it means only one thing : War.

 

Here are some early concepts :

 

 

Miniatures

Warriors :

Slaves :

Lep-priests :

Nin-rats :

Techno-elite : (the pack will contain 20 miniatures)

Ra-trolls :

Characters :

Great avatar :

Wheel of misfortune :

Multipurpose Frame :

 

Some painted miniatures :

My friend Martin made me the honour of painting some pre-production models :

 

Perks and stretch goals

Since I intend to produce a full range, I'll propose a variety of perks to choose from, depending on the investment you want to put in the campaign. Obviously, the more you spend, the greater the discount ! You'll then receive a Credit Code to use on the store. Note that you can spend your credit on any item available. That way, you can choose your own mix to create or fluff up your armies.

Stretch goals are unlikely to be free. If the campaign works as intended, I already have sculpts to extend The Unseen range. I even have some more references for the Evil Men and the Good men. Stretch goals will unlock these new references to purchase from. Speaking of :

 

Available -Special weapons team - Available

1250 € reached

(20 special weapons, long rifles, flame-thrower, shield bearers, maybe some meat-grinders...)

Concepts : 

Sculptures (work in progress) :


 

Available - Mischief of Rats - Available

1500 € 

Some number [to be determined] of rats on different shapes of bases to compose your own colonies of pests. I am open to ideas on the shapes, thinking about adding a L shape too.

Concepts : 

Available - Evil Men light cavalry - Available

1750 € 

12 Evil raiders  to complete the existing range of Evil Men. (banner and musician included)

 

 

Available - Evil Men Giant and Good men Griffon - Available

2000 € 

2 monsters for the Evil men and Good men.

 

Available - New weapon option for the MPF AND a BIG rat - Available

2250 €

You absolutely mad lads, I've been made aware that some players may need this, so be it.
And I'll add to the table a huge blind Rat. 

 

Locked - Best proposition in the comments - Locked

2500 € 

You won. I surrender. I'll sculpt and produce the best proposition in the comments. (I'll be the judge of what is the best, obviously)

 

Postage

Postage will be from France.
Price will be calculated on the site and likely be a flat rate : 6€ for EU and 10€ for the rest of the world at the moment, subject to changes.

If your country is not listed in the store when ordering, pop me an email and I'll quote your postage.

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risks are : 

  • delayed delivery for various reasons : masters breaking during the casting process is one. I have gained confidence in working with this caster and know how to build my masters to make them " cast proof " ; however, accidents happen and some repairs could be needed. Which brings me to the second point :
     
  • Minis not being 100% as advertised here in photographs : some minor tweaks can be necessary for casting purpose.
     

I trust these difficulties can be overcome if need be.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you're not willing or capable to contribute financially to this campaign but still feel you'd want to see these miniatures in production, feel free to share the campaign around ! Digitally is great, but word of mouth is even better.


A final word :

Je parle français.
Parlo italiano.

story:
Like roleplaying games? Like board games? Like computer games? Support the top independent tabletop roleplaying site on the internet with a membership! Not only will you help the site, but you'll also receive membership privileges and several great roleplaying PDFs!

RPGnet is the top independent web site for tabletop roleplaying games. The heart of our site is one of the most talked-about forums in the industry — with 12,000 active members and 19 million posts. We also publish several gaming reviews every week and a few columns. Finally, we maintain a constantly expanding catalog of roleplaying products that currently indexes 20,000 games and supplements, 2,000 magazines, and 36,000 articles.

All of this costs money, so in 2013 we decided to turn to crowdfunding to encourage readers to become members, to support the site. The drive was successful, so we've turned into a yearly tradition.

In years past, the membership drive has enabled us to restore the search function, move the machines to a cloud platform, revising our reviews system, improve review browsing, enhance mobile access, improve of security, upgrade column tagging, and to move our forums to a cloud platform.

This year we've got a variety of awesome PDFs thanks to our generous product sponsors:

  • BLAZON from Fantasy Heartbreaker
  • Scion: Origin and the Scarred Lands Player's Guide from Onyx Path
  • Colonial Gothic from Rogue Games
  • Fairyland from Rogue Games
  • The Fall of Delta Green from Pelgrane Press
  • Suzerain Legends from Savage Mojo

Though ads and affiliations pay some of our costs, we are picky about which ads and ad networks we use, so that we can maintain high-quality ads that are likely to be of interest and that won't distract (or annoy!) our readers. We've opted out of high-value ads that include audio, that expand, or that are placed as interstitials between pages. We forbid dating ads, gambling ads, gold-farming ads, political ads, and certain other categories of advertising. 

As a result, we occasionally ask RPGnet readers to become members, in order to help support the community. We hope that you'll join us and help to support the RPGnet community!

Our goal for this IndieGoGo crowdfunding is simple: we want you to become an RPGnet member. Every single reward other than the $5 support level will grant you a membership at RPGnet. Most of them provide membership for the next year, but we also offer Lifetime Memberships for Patrons and others who want to offer a higher level of support.

As a member, you'll receive a few benefits as thanks.

The following membership bennies are locked in:

  • Cool PDFs. Becoming a member is how you get access to the PDFs our sponsors are providing.
  • Early Columns Access. You can read columns before they're posted.
  • Early Review Access. You can read reviews before they're posted.

Hi, I'm Rose, editor-in-chief at RPGnet!

RPGnet's close to my heart. I've been a reader and forum member for 20 years, from looking for game reviews for my college group to cutting my professional teeth on forum design challenges. RPGnet is a friendly, inclusive, and above all creative community that's simply irreplaceable.

Curating the reviews, moderating the forums, and performing maintenance are labors of love. Your memberships give us the resources to continue with that good work -- to provide an independent voice on games, to provide a space for thought-provoking discussion, and to keep the lights on in the internet's best virtual gaming cafe.

I love this site. Join me in keeping it an amazing place for the next 20 years!

--Rose

story:
We recently finished Funding to 2500% on Kickstarter and are excited to continue to offer our product to the Indiegogo community as an in-demand campaign! The digital product is complete and available for immediate download!  Resin Cast forts are now available in white and color resin!

Short Summary

Stronghold on the Borderlands is an effort to create a fort that would exist as a garrison or trading station in a borderland fantasy setting for 25-32mm Miniatures. The idea pursues the notion of a timber fort being constructed on part/on top of an older ruined stone fortification. I used this mixed aesthetic so that the fort might also be applicable as a tribal center for barbarian and goblinoid cultures.

This set utilizes both OpenLOCK and Non-Openlock approaches. 

Imgur Parts Album

Imgur Sample Build Album

Imgur Part List & Diagrams

What You Get

I am offering 4 perks

1. 4 OpenLOCK digital wall and floor parts. This includes 100+ Parts plus a bonus Infinite shanty longhouse and parts to convert OPENLock walls to exterior fortification walls with walkways.

2. ALL Digital Content including OpenLOCK. 300+ Parts

3. White Resin Cast Fort and Download ALL Digital Content

3. 2 Color Resin Cast Fort and Download  ALL Digital Content

NEW PERK #3  White resin, 25x18.75 inches. Delivered in 14-30 Days    

NEW PERK #4  Grey and Brown resin, 25x18.75 inches. Delivered in 14-30 Days

  

 

About Us

I started this as a RPG resale company in late 2012 and shipped out around 100k in gross product sales between 2012-2015. During this same time I transitioned and retrained myself from traditional art to a 3D designer. Some of my resale profits were used to finance my digital fabrication interest. In late 2015 I suspended resale operations to move my family and begin development as a part time freelance designer and manufacturer. I’ve designed and redesigned this structure off and on over the last year between other 3D work and my regular job as a Studio Art Technician at Murray State University.

I’ve designed several other castle structures that I put out as open source releases. Some of these designs hi-light my interest in mashing a number of methods and materials together, others are simple structures based on abandoned designs ideas. More info can be seen on the web sites listed.

http://www.timeportalgames.com

A bunch of time lapse sample build videos here

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTpVjrZAwGJE7S...

https://www.facebook.com/TimePortalGames

https://twitter.com/GameScape3D

http://www.thingiverse.com/GameScape3D

https://www.instagram.com/gamescape3d/

Presently I am in the middle of rebranding from Time Portal Games (which has had many faces) to a new name, GameScape 3D. Once complete I'm going to transition TPG to a rpg printable news blog. Point being, both names refer to this project right now.
 

Risks & Challenges

Risk for this project are essentially non-existent aside from a catastrophic life event.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is post campaign funding and very much a WYSIWYG product at this point. Anything anyone is willing to do to spread the word is great but there are no hidden products that I intend to add. I have already spent money advertising and have extensively worked most free methods of advertising.  I will do one last round of advertising to redirect potential customers here.

story:
Feast of the Gobbler

What evils lurk in the deep woods? Only the Gobbler Knows!

The Ennie nominated adventure originally released over 16 years ago returns with a fury of bad puns and just desserts!

This adventure designed for 3-5th level characters takes you deep into the eternal autumn of the Greenhill Woods. Here the characters find themselves caught in the midst of a conflict between settlers and native folk at odds over a recent rash of deaths and disappearances. Their exploration of the region takes a surreal turn as they investigate Councilors’ Bluff, uncovering its dark secrets.

The adventure requires equal parts detective work, puzzle and trap solving, and action adventure to discover the truth behind the missing ones and the horrible fate that awaits those who fail to stop the rise of the cult of the Gobbler!

Available for the first time in print, this adventure classic is revised and re-edited to include brand new content for use with 5thEdition, Swords & Wizardry, or Original Pathfinder!


Includes several new monsters and variant monsters for use in your game!

Get ready to pass the Gravy! It’s time for the Feast to begin again!

NOTE: PDF Version WILL be available before THIS Thanksgiving, 2019.

Second in Frog God Games Holiday lineup, Feast was first released in 2002. This revised and expanded new edition fills up on the goodness with full color artwork and slick professional maps. It is certain to bring smiles to your holiday adventuring for years to come.

Features included in this product include:

  • Written by Casey W. Christofferson, Author of Bard’s Gate, City of Brass, Encephalon Gorgers on the Moon, and dozens of other fantastic titles.
  • Cover by acclaimed illustrator Michael Syrigos!
  • Masterwork Cartography by Robert Altbaur
  • Full Color Interior Art
  • New Monsters and Monster Variants

 

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is continuing the use of this indiegogo crowdfunding method for Feast of the Gobbler.  This method is almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

 

*Premium means 100 pound glossy interior pages with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold.

 

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects. These smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

Project Reward

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

Examples of Enhancements from Higher Funding:

  • During the 14 day primary project period for Feast of the Gobbler and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to Feast of the Gobbler:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project, Mystery at Ravenrock, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

 

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

 

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
The 6ix and who makes it?

 

  • I'm Dakota Jernigan. I love making things, and growing things.
  • I want to get The 6ix : Battle-Boards in to the hands of people that like to play Dungeons and Dragons, Strategy games, Chess, Role-playing-games, and board-games in general, this campaign will share with you my project, some of the games mechanics, and why my friends and I think it's so fun to play.
  • With your contribution I can make more Original Boards and Pieces which take a lot of time, I will also be able to make Expansion Boards, Bosses and Boss Boards, and come up with further variations of The 6ix.

Fund me and receive a game

 

  • 90% of the funding goes to paying me a small hourly income, because this is a Craft Board Game it takes several hours to create even one complete game, only 10% goes to the materials such as canvas, paint, clay, packaging.
  • If you contribute to this campaign you will receive one of the very first Hand-Crafted 'The 6ix : Battle-Boards' board-games, or a Hand-Sculpted Character Pawn for 'The 6ix', a Hand-Painted Tiny-Painting, and a Hand-Crafted Magnet.
  • If the campaign goal is not reached, the game will still get made, and played, so no worries. I'm starting here to get some pre-orders before the game is released on another platform such as Etsy.

What is The 6ix?

 

  • 'The 6ix' is a resource crafting, turned-based combat game, where you and friends can: Battle each other in One vs One combat, Free-for-all, Team-Deathmatch, create new rules and items, make your own bosses, or even make your own characters and boards. Make a bow and arrow to range your rivals from afar. Smith a sword to slash through enemies. Or imbue a magical staff to send tricky projectiles toward unsuspecting opponents. And much more! 
  • I know that people love playing this game, my friends and I have played it nearly one hundred times, testing out new rules and Items. I suggest you make the changes you see fit and don't be afraid to think outside the box.
  • The way the game works is you roll two six sided dice, and you take one action for each dice, be it : movement, collecting, crafting, cooking, using items, fishing, trading, attacking, or defending. Ones are low, Sixes are high. Doubles let you go again, but don't roll three doubles in a row, or pass the dice. There are 5 resources to collect from: Herbs, Logs, Ore, Fish, and Water. Turn them into powerful weapons, armor, and potions, and use strategy to out-smart your friends.
  • 'The 6ix' is COMPLETELY Hand-made, every Character Pawn is unique, every board is unique. The boards are also tessellated, meaning, if you and friends have boards, you can connect them side by side and have a bigger board! Or connect even more. The boards are painted on cotton-canvas, using acrylic paint, and colored pencils. The Character Pawns are sculpted with Sculpey 3, oven baked, then Hand-painted. 

Risks & Challenges

 

  • It is only me creating this board game and as of now I am a full time farmer. The biggest challenge for me would be if lots of people want 'The 6ix' I would either have to hire a helping hand, or put the production of the game into a manufacture's hands, losing it's hand-crafted appeal.
  • If I do have to hire a helper or  find other avenues for production it may delay the production of the game to get it to the players .

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Tell your friends about it, if your having finacial hardships right now as a lot of us are, maybe you can get a roommate or family member of yours to get the game so you can play too!
  • Please tell your friends about this game and share it on social media!

The way the game works is you roll two six sided dice, and you take one action for each dice, be it : movement, collecting, crafting, cooking, using items, fishing, trading, attacking, or defending. Ones are low, Sixes are high. Doubles let you go again, but don't roll three doubles in a row, or pass the dice. There are 5 resources to collect from: Herbs, Logs, Ore, Fish, and Water. Turn them into powerful weapons, armor, and potions, and use strategy to out-smart your friends.
'The 6ix' is COMPLETELY Hand-made, every Character Pawn is unique, every board is unique. The boards are also tessellated, meaning, if you and friends have boards, you can connect them side by side and have a bigger board! Or connect even more. The boards are painted on cotton-canvas, using acrylic paint, and colored pencils. The Character Pawns are sculpted with Sculpey 3, oven baked, then Hand-painted. 


Risks & Challenges
 

It is only me creating this board game and as of now I am a full time farmer. The biggest challenge for me would be if lots of people want 'The 6ix' I would either have to hire a helping hand, or put the production of the game into a manufacture's hands, losing it's hand-crafted appeal.
If I do have to hire a helper or  find other avenues for production it may delay the production of the game to get it to the players .


Other Ways You Can Help
 

Tell your friends about it, if your having finacial hardships right now as a lot of us are, maybe you can get a roommate or family member of yours to get the game so you can play too!
Please tell your friends about this game and share it on social media!

story:
WELCOME TO TORTUGA!

The year is 1667 and you are a pirate sailing the waters of the Caribbean. A Spanish Galleon floats nearby, and you’ve talked your crewmates into working together to steal all of its treasure. What you haven’t told your fellow pirates is that you have no intentions on sharing the treasure once you have it. Your crewmates have told you that they share your loyalty and that they’ll help you maroon the greedy pirates on your ship to the rocky island of Tortuga. But you’ve seen your friends’ loaded pistols and heard their whisperings of a mutiny. You know that nobody can be trusted.

For 2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 12+.

 

GAME CONTENTS

  • 1 Faux book container
  • 1 Rulebook (includes character biographies)
  • 75 Cards (9 Brethren of the Coast, 24 Event, 32 Vote, 9 Loyalty, 1 Quick-Start)
  • 1 Rubber playing mat
  • 1 Burlap pouch
  • 9 Wooden pawns
  • 8 Wooden treasure chests
  • 1 Wooden explosion token

THE GAME

 

 

 

 

    

 

 

REWARDS

We're not big into confusing reward levels or expensive add-ons. We want each of our backers to get the best reward we can offer: this beautiful game! We splurged on a few items that we felt really added to the game quality (the rubber playmat, faux book, burlap bag, wooden treasures), while still keeping the overall costs low and eliminating unnecessary pieces. 

$1-$9 Thank you for your support!

$10 An emailed PDF of the cards & board, ready for printing

$24 Tortuga 1667 

$45 Tortuga 1667 x2 

$64 Tortuga 1667 x3 

$81 Tortuga 1667 x4 

$180 Tortuga 1667 x10

$260 Retailer Discount: 20 Copies of the Game. You must message us with proof that you're an established retailer of some kind for this reward.

Shipping: We are using fulfillment companies around the world to make shipping costs as cheap as possible for our backers. For our European and UK backers we will be shipping from within the EU so that you do not have to pay any customs charges. 

TESTIMONIALS

I don’t trust my friends anymore. But I love this game. -Tessa

Tortuga is a game full of surprises! Each round brings with it new and intriguing events that ultimately make you the master of the sea or scum of Tortuga. It all depends on how proficient you are at finding your team and making that knowledge count. -Alex R.

I have played this game basically every week for the last couple of months. I have loved it every single time and never been bored. It’s a great game to play with friends and really makes you think. -Abigail S

I love this game!!! No game is ever the same, and it's always exciting. You never know who is going to do what or if you are trusting the right person. Everyone I have introduced to this game has loved it too. -Alex W.

Tortuga is a great social deduction game and it looks great on your game shelf too! Love the game even though sometimes it makes me question my friends and family. -Brett A.

A game where I can deceive and be called Captain is a very good game indeed." -Derek H.

Tortuga is unique in the fact that it allows the perfect amount of deception for those that enjoy tricking and deceiving others, but it also provides the opportunity to work off of pure logic and reason for the other players that do not particularly excel in manipulation. I have had the opportunity of playing this game numerous times with many different crowds, and every game is completely different because of the different strategies and techniques that people can utilize. -Levi H.

PRESS

Dice Tower News: http://www.dicetowernews.com/facade-games-welcomes-you-to-tortuga-1667-on-kickstarter/35996

Geek & Sundry: http://geekandsundry.com/tortuga-1667-kickstarter-brings-treacherous-pirates-to-tabletop-gaming/

Cwowd.com (French): http://www.cwowd.com/tortuga-cap-sur-bonne-esperance/

Beasts of War: http://www.beastsofwar.com/tortuga-1667/command-ship-secure-treasure-tortuga-1667-ks/ 

Viva Veltoro: http://www.vivaveltoro.com/2017/02/tortuga-1667-pirate-game.html

Tabletop Gaming: https://www.tabletopgaming.co.uk/board-games/news/tortuga-1667-is-a-gorgeous-social-deception-game-with-pirates 

DDO Players: http://ddoplayers.com/2017/01/22/tortuga-1667-a-pirate-game-on-kickstarter/

Club Fantasci: http://www.clubfantasci.com/kickstarter-week-tortuga-1667/

Board Game Stories: http://boardgamestories.com/news/party/no-pirate-trusted-tortuga-1667/

If you have an article about Tortuga 1667 or this project, please message us so we can have it featured here. We're also happy to answer any questions you have for the articles. Thanks!

RULES OVERVIEW

Note: The video above gives a brief overview of the gameplay and rules. Complete rules, including tips & tricks, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, event card descriptions, and character biographies are not shown in the video, but are all included in the game rulebook. If you'd like to look at the complete rules now please visit the links below: 
  • English 
  • French
  • German
  • Spanish 
  • Dutch
  • Italian
  • Portuguese
  • Hungarian
  • Turkish

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

TORTUGA CREATION PROCESS

A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.

1. Mechanics

Tortuga is all about the interactions you have with the other players. In some cases, such as when you and your shipmates are attacking the Spanish Galleon, you need to rely on your enemies in order to succeed. In the very next turn, however, your shipmates might stab you in the back with a mutiny in order to keep all the treasure for themselves.

Since nobody holds a "hand" of cards, this game is also about knowledge and communication regarding the community Event cards. Unless you are in desperation mode, it is not wise to reveal Event cards at random. Almost half of the Event cards can hurt your team drastically. It's often in your best interest to use an action to view the cards first, or to rely on the knowledge of a trusted ally. Knowing where harmful Event cards are located allows you to force an enemy to reveal those cards and suffer the consequences. The most successful players are the ones who are able to discern who is on their team and then share vital information with them at opportune moments.

Vote cards also play a key role in the game. Each Vote card has three sections - one each for Attacks, Mutinies, and Brawls. Players must put themselves in the best position to use their Vote cards, since their hand of Vote cards may not always be ideal based on their pawn location. For example, sometimes it may be worth putting in Water, causing an attack to fail, in order to save a Crossbones card for when you want to Mutiny against your captain.

 

2. Theme

Tortuga, a small island off of Haiti, was an important pirate settlement and hideout during the golden age of piracy. British, French, and Dutch pirates lived together on the island in a loose alliance and formed a pirate government known as “The Brethren of the Coast.” Rich from its support of piracy and protected by the Brethren, Tortuga was full of taverns, gambling houses, and prostitutes.

The French and British governments, in an attempt to weaken the mighty Spanish, would often legalize piracy by giving pirates letters of marque. These gave pirates permission to unofficially plunder Spanish ships and towns. Many of the pirates on Tortuga chose the privateering life over full-blown piracy, which was illegal. Loyalty to country was fleeting, though, and pirates often walked the line between patriotism and rebellion.

Tortuga 1667 aims to capture the atmosphere of these loose alliances and shifting political loyalties.

3. Design

The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players deep into the world of privateers and pirate life. We used textures consistent to what pirates would see on an everyday basis: wooden planks and tables, canvas sails, and weather-torn maps.

All pieces of the game were carefully chosen for their color and aesthetic contributions to the theme. The burlap bag conjures images of a pirate's bag of possessions. Many of the cards use a canvas background like the sails on a ship. The playmat rolls out and looks just like an old treasure map. The faux book is worn and colored a piratey brown, dark maroon, and black.

 

STRETCH GOALS

Because we reached the following milestones on Kickstarter, we will be adding 8 "game-changer" cards to every copy of the game! When setting up, players will add 3 of these game-changers into the Event deck. These cards have the potential to turn the tide in your team's favor! Cards will now also all be given a high-quality linen finish, 2 and 3-player setup rules will be added to the rulebook, a "Captain's Helm" illustration will be added to the blank Mutiny sections on the Vote cards, 2 "double-vote" Vote cards will be added to each copy of the game, a wooden explosion token will be added to each copy of the game, Brethren of the Coast cards will have player action lists on the back of them, the Treasure map will include a compass rose and map legend, and we're adding a Quick-Start/Certified First Edition card to every copy of the game!

 

THE DARK CITIES SERIES

Tortuga 1667 is Volume 1 in Facade Games' Dark Cities Series! Each game in the series will:

  • Be packaged in a faux book. 
  • Focus on a particular city and year. 
  • Include a dark, mysterious, or deceptive element in its gameplay. 
  • Accommodate at least 4-9 players. 

We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with Dark Cities Volume 1: Tortuga 1667!

PAST PROJECTS

In April 2015 we raised $103,000 on Kickstarter with our first game, Salem. This game takes players into the dark world of the Salem Witch Trials. Players must hunt down the witches before becoming one! The game has now sold over 10,000 copies and is played around the world. 
 
We are extremely proud to have delivered Salem on time to our backers! Here's what one of our backers had to say: 
 
I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier. -Snuffles00
 
Salem's Kickstarter Page
Salem's Store Page
Salem's Amazon Page (check out the reviews!)
 
We've made Salem available as an "Add-on" reward for this Kickstarter campaign. If you add $25 to your pledge, we'll send you Salem when we ship you Tortuga 1667 in August. You will not be charged extra shipping if you add this on. 
 

THE CREATORS

Game creation and graphic design is by Facade Games, owned and operated by Travis and Holly Hancock. Learn more at www.facadegames.com, or follow us on facebook, instagram, or twitter.

Illustrations were drawn by Sarah Keele. Follow her beautiful artwork on instagram.

A huge thank you to the hundreds of hours put in by our many play-testers!

THE GAME
The game is packaged in a faux book box. The box has 3 magnets to keep it closed when you're moving it to and from game night.
 
The game fits nicely inside the faux book box. The box is big enough for cards to be sleeved, if desired.
 
The game board is a rubber playmat. The board rolls up like a map.
 
The 8 wooden treasure pieces come in a burlap bag.
 
Each of the 9 wooden pawns matches with 1 of the 9 pirates you can be in the game. Each pirate is based on a real pirate who roamed Tortuga and the Caribbean seas in the year 1667.
    
Each player has a secret loyalty: British, Dutch, or French. But be careful who you trust; someone claiming to share your loyalty may stab you in the back and steal your hard-earned treasure.
 
Use Event cards during the game to help your team get treasure, or to maroon members of the opposite team to the island of Tortuga.
 
Use Vote cards during the game to secretly impact Attacks against the Spanish, Mutinies against your Captain, and Brawls against your fellow pirates.

RULES OVERVIEW


Note: The video above gives a brief overview of the gameplay and rules. Complete rules, including tips & tricks, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, event card descriptions, and character biographies are not shown in the video, but are all included in the game rulebook. Play the game as 1 of these 9 actual pirates from history. Biographies of each pirate are in the back of the rulebook.
 
Each player has a secret loyalty card. This is your team. Part of the game is deciphering who is your teammate and who is your enemy.
 
The Tortuga playing board. Teams win if they have the most treasure in their team's treasure holds when the Spanish Armada card is revealed.
 
Players choose to perform one action on their turn. One potential action is to reveal one of five available Event cards.
 
Be careful about which Event cards you reveal! Some may maroon you or your teammates to Tortuga.
 
If you reveal one of the three treasure maps, you must give it to someone you trust. If you reveal the Spanish Armada, the game is over.
 
During the game, Captains can call for Attacks, First Mates can call for Mutinies, and the Governor of Tortuga can call for Brawls. When one of these votes is called for, use your Vote cards to secretly cast your vote!
 
Depending on the player count, you'll need to rely more heavily on certain skills to win the game. We love the flexibility and variability of Tortuga 1667 based on the player count!
 
TORTUGA CREATION PROCESS
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
1. Mechanics

For example, sometimes it may be worth putting in Water, causing an attack to fail, in order to save a Crossbones card for when you want to Mutiny against your captain.
A game in progress.
 
2. Theme
Tortuga, a small island off of Haiti, was an important pirate settlement and hideout during the golden age of piracy. British, French, and Dutch pirates lived together on the island in a loose alliance and formed a pirate government known as “The Brethren of the Coast.” Rich from its support of piracy and protected by the Brethren, Tortuga was full of taverns, gambling houses, and prostitutes.
The French and British governments, in an attempt to weaken the mighty Spanish, would often legalize piracy by giving pirates letters of marque. Some of Sarah's initial sketches and process for creating the beautiful illustrations in the game.

story:
These durable, TAROT-SIZE card decks contain almost every monster from Necromancer Games' Tome of Horrors 2020, with the monster's picture on one side of the card and the stats on the other. Whether you use monster cards as a flashcard to show the monster's picture without covering part of a page, or as a tool for organizing your information to avoid page-flipping, these attractive cards are designed to make the job easier.

The cards are 2.75" x 4.75" (Tarot sized) with complete 5th edition stats on the back, as shown below:

Here is what you get in the three decks.

DECK ONE:

Abrikandilu, Alu Demon, Cacodemon, Charonademon, Daraka, Fox Demon, Gallu, Huangshe’yao, Hundred-eyed demon, Hydrodemon, Mezzalorn Demon, Nabasu (Death Stealer Demon), Nerizo Demon (Bloodhound Demon), Nysrock (Cobra Demon), Piscodemon, Shrroth, Skitterdark, Stirge Demon, Beluiri (The Temptress), Teratashia (Demon Princess of Dimensions), Vepar, Denizen of Ong, Amaimon, Flayer, Ghaddar, Hellstoker Devil, Nupperibo Devil, Tormentor Devil, Blood Mane, Ice Mane, Stygian Mane, Styx Mane, Alastor the Executioner, Ammon (Duke of Malbolge, Keeper of the Kennels, Lord of the Ditches), Baalzebal (Prince of Stygia, Lord of Flies), Baaphel (Grand Duke of Covetous Regent of Belial), Belial (Prince of Covetous, Lord of Lusts), Caasimolar (Former President of Hell, Arch Devil), Gorson (Blood Duke of Aplistia, Arch Devil), The Lightbringer (Prince of Darkness, Prince of Infernus, Arch Devil), Lilith (Former Queen of Hell, Arch Devil), Mammon (The Miser, Prince of Aplistia, Arch Devil), Moloch (Arch Devil), Titivilus (Duke of Dis, Xaphan, The Burning Duke, Duke of Infernus, Arch Devil), Aagash the Broken, Asagin the Assassin, Grexias the Destroyer, Modar the Huntress, Rauuka the Ravager, Veenes the Blademistress, Veruard the Creator (the Razor of Abaddon), N’gathau Warrior, Soul Hammer, Dokkaebi, Feng Xianji (Wind Fey), Filth Fairy, Fyr, Gray Nisp, Grimstalker, Nixie, Bog Nixie, Quickling, Spriggan, Stroke Lad, Fey Giant Toad, Woodwose, Basalt Warhound, Smoke Elemental, Sequana Genie, Stone Maiden, Blood Weird, Celestial Paragon, Niutomi, Singa, Green Brain, Mandragora, Mi-Go

DECK TWO:

Afanc, Arcanoplasm, Bake Kujira, Greater Abyssal Basilisk, Caterwaul, Cave Fisher, Churr, Corpsespinner, Death Worm, Deepmind, Dire Corby, Drider-Goblin, Fen Witch, Gillmonkey, Gribbon, Gronk, Kaiju (Daguros), Kaiju (Galazon), Kaiju (Xarakhan), Giant Sea Leech, Leechfolk, Monster of Set, Pyrolisk, Tyrannosaurus Rattus, Soul Vampire, Sporc, Surf Lurker, Thunder Terrier, Tusk Lord, Ant Lion, Dire Ape, Baboonwere, Cave Bear, Greater Bone Needle, Monstrous Crayfish, Fei Shei, Fluttercat, Forest Stalker, Musk Ox, Platybelodon, Rhacos, Cave Scorpion, Sea Cow, Spiny Horror, Stank Hog, Stank Piglet, Stegocentipede, Swarm of Carnivorous Fish , Swarm of Flying Scorpions, Swarm of Hostile Birds, Swarm of Stirges, Troll Pony, Wakandagi, Berberoka, Aberrant Giant, Sea Giant, Volcano Giant, Half-Ogre Enforcer, Jokao, Nazalor, Black Troll, Sea Troll, Allosaurus (Dinosaur), Ankylosaurus (Dinosaur), Diplodocus (Dinosaur), Hadrosaur, Iguanodon (Dinosaur), Pteranodon, Pterodactyl (Dinosaur), Raptor (Dinosaur), Raptors, Mutant, Triceratops King, Tyrannosaurs King, Blood Kaktos, Bramble, Cobra Flower, Flowershroud, Gnarlwood

DECK THREE:

Binguai, Bloody Bones, Bog Corpse, Bone Reaper, Undead Feral Cat, Corpsespun, Crawling Hand, Greater Demi-Lich, Draug, Draug Captain, Duppy, Egui, Ekimmu, Fear Guard, Gholle, Ghoul of Khemit, Ghul, Groaning Spirit, Guardian Shade, Hoar Spirit, Undead Hyaenodon, Lacedon, Mian’shen (Masked Spirit), Don’gui (Ice Wraith), Lightning-Quick Mummy, Murder Born, Murder Crow, Red Jester, Greater Shadow, Swarm of Undead Bats, Swarm of Undead Hummingbirds, Swarm of Undead Rats, Shadow Wolf, Aqueous Zombie, Bramble Zombie, Carcharodon Zombie, Goblin Zombie, Gug Zombie, Juju Zombie, Mummy Zombie, Otyugh Zombie, Poisonous Snake Zombie, Sphinx Zombie, Buxiu Immortal Guard, Mithral Golem, Shedu Golem, Lesser Flesh Golem, Pewter Knight, Sepulchral Guardian, Swarm of Adamantine Wasps, Swarm of Bladecoins, Swarm of Eye Spiders, Blood Orchid, Bone Cobbler, Bonesucker, Cerebral Stalker, Crawling Offspring, Ha-Naga, Horror from Below, Shining Child, Silaal, Algoid, Fungus Bat, Fungal Creeper, Jupiter Bloodsucker, Shroom, Fungus Weird, Witch Tree, Carapace Symbiont, Stunjelly, Whip Jelly, Livestone, Living Lake, Crystal Ooze, Ara, Mus, Immortal Master, Skelzi

The Project 

Necromancer Games  projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the item).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

 

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Tome of Horrors Monster Cards and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing the PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using our Constant Contact service, our web store, and Drive-thruRpg.com. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer Games website to access your PDF reward; You will need a One Book Shelf account (Drive-Thru Rpg, Drive-thru Cards etc.) to add the digital card files to your online library on their site.

These methods allows us to keep track of everything. It also grants you unlimited access to your digital rewards on more than one platform's file library. 

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. The Drive-Thru RPG fulfillment occurs after the webstore fulfillment. Both options are available to everyone.

Please contact us with any questions/requests regarding the perk items and how you will get them after the project ends.

Physical Perks

Physical perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

All physical rewards are included the matching digital version at no additional charge. 

International Customers:

  • On shipments to Europe, you may incur VAT fees in addition to the shipping charges below. 
  • On shipments to Canada, premium shipping for books also includes duty and taxes fees so there will be no additional charges. However card orders may incur customs fees in addition to the shipping charges.
story_txt:
These durable, TAROT-SIZE card decks contain almost every monster from Necromancer Games' Tome of Horrors 2020, with the monster's picture on one side of the card and the stats on the other. story:
【11/20更新（ゲーム紹介はページ下部へ）】ストレッチゴール発表

みなさま、ご支援ありがとうございます。
クラウドファンディング募集期間も残すところわずかとなりましたが、おかげさまで当初の目標金額の達成もいよいよ目前となってまいりました！
そこで、新たなストレッチゴールを設定いたしました！

期間内に当初の目標金額を超えて$3,600に到達した場合、感謝の気持ちを込めて、ゲーム本体をご支援いただいた方々（PERK「VANILLA」「CHOCOLATE」が対象）全員に、『Smuggling THE CESSPOOL』オリジナル・ビッグ・アートポスターをプレゼントいたします！
ゲーム本体に含まれる「ドラッグトークン」をモデルに撮影された新規のアートワークは、お部屋やオフィスをクールに彩ります。

ぜひSNSなどで本プロジェクトの拡散にご協力いただき、アートポスターをゲットしていただければ幸いです！

 

【ゲーム紹介】

 

本ゲームはプレイヤーがドラッグシンジケートの末端を担う密売人となり、他のプレイヤーたちと売上の金額を競って〝密売王〟をめざす犯罪シミュレーションゲームです。

もっとも効率のよい販売ルートを考えて他のプレイヤーと協力したり、自分の稼ぎを増やすためにボスへの上納金をチョロまかしたり、裏切り者を始末するために街の中を追い回したり。
この街には普通ではおよそ経験できないような、たくさんの破天荒な出来事があなたを待ち構えています！

自由な交渉がゆるされている本作では、プレイヤー同士の共闘と裏切りがゲームの鍵です。
プレイするたびに新たな気づきや見たことのないドラマに出会うことでしょう。
あなただけの新しい犯罪ドラマを、心ゆくまでお楽しみください。

 

マイバンに乗って街へ繰り出す《 販売システム 》

プレイヤーはそれぞれ自分専用の「バン」に乗り、カルテルから支給されるドラッグを積載して街へと繰り出します。街の指定されたエリアでドラッグを販売すると、そのエリアのドラッグに対する需要が高まり、ゆくゆくはヤク漬けのエリア「ホットスポット」が誕生！

ホットスポットではドラッグが大量に、しかも高値で販売できるチャンスです！ホットスポットをうまく利用して、多くのアガリを生み出しましょう。

 

街にはあなたのバンのカスタマイズを請け負う「ガレージ」も存在します。

決して安くはない改造費用を支払えば、あっという間にあなたのバンはより快適なラグジュアリーカーに早変わり！バンの最大積載量を増やしたり、販売効率を高めたり、警察の目をごまかす偽装をすることだって可能です。

最強のカスタマイズを見つけて、他のプレイヤーたちに差をつけましょう。

販売プランは週（ラウンド）の始めに「ワークプランシート」に記入します。
戦術的な立ち回りをするために、他のプレイヤーと販売ルートを共有したり、あるいはそれを裏切ったり。より多くのマネーを稼ぐために、できる限りの手を尽くしましょう。

 

 

仕事のアガリをボスに納める《 上納システム 》

売ったお金がすべてあなたのものになるわけがありませんよ！
そのお金はあなたのボス、麻薬王ヘイデン・バーンズのものなのです！

プレイヤーは販売を終えたら、全員その週（ラウンド）の上納金を封筒に納めます。

代表となるプレイヤーはそれを回収して総額を数えるわけですが……
上納金が指定の額よりずっと少ないのはなぜですか？！
つまりそれは、あなたがボスを裏切って、上納金をチョロまかすことさえ、このゲームでは可能だからです！

 

裏切り者は誰だ？！《 埋め合わせシステム 》

裏切り者がタダで許されるわけがありません。

かわいい部下に裏切られ、怒り心頭のヘイデン・バーンズから届くのは一丁の銃です。

もしもあなたが麻薬王に信頼され銃を預けられたなら、あなたは自分の命に代えても裏切り者を探し出し、賠償金を支払わせた上で、2度とそんなマネをしないように病院送りにしてやる必要があります。

もしそうしなければ、その身代わりとなるのは裏切り者を始末する役目を任された、〝有能な〟あなたなのですから！

さぁ、銃を持つプレイヤーと持たないプレイヤーの、命をかけた鬼ごっこの開始です！

本作は単独でプレイが可能ですが、前作『CESSPOOL the crime manage simulation boardgame』の拡張パックとして使える機能も2018年春頃にアップデート予定です（拡張ルール専用のルールブックの頒布）。 2018年再販予定の前作と併せて、さらに広がるCESSPOOLシリーズの世界をお楽しみください。

story:
"Rüdiger Dorn (Istanbul, Karuba) makes incredibly smart and solid games and Montana is one of them" - Richard Ham (Rahdo Runs Through)

Halfway through the 19th century, the first permanent settlements appeared in Montana. After this, many fortune seekers traveled to this region with their caravans in search of work in order to build a better future for themselves. And there is an abundance of work. In the mountains, precious metals are to be found and in the fields a lot of manpower is required. Meanwhile, the number of settlements is growing and the demand for goods is rising. Recruit the right workers, deliver goods on time, and choose your settlements tactically. Only then you will have a chance of winning Montana.

The first player to build all of their settlements wins!

 

 

 

(physical components of Montana)

 

Make it deluxe!

We have added some awesome upgrades to Montana that will enhance your experience with the game while making this Heritage Edition super deluxe!
*remaining stock of exclusives is expected to be sold at conventions.

 

 

...you'll do one of three actions:

  A. Recruit

Spin the Recruitment Wheel.
(that's right... A SPINNER!)

After you receive your workers, you can pay grain to mitigate the wheel for more! For each grain paid, advance the spinner one space and hire the extra two workers. This gives you four workers total for that action.
 

  B. Work

Send your workers to the bank, the mine, the quarry, the fields, or the farmland and pay the space's required money to receive the goods. You can choose to place an additional worker (or two workers of any color) to receive an extra good.

The workers will occupy their spaces until all spaces in that region are filled. Once there are no spaces available, the workers will be dismissed to the main supply.

Or you can send your contractor to the city to auction for extra goods or to upgrade your stone and copper.
 

  C. Build

Pay the goods indicated on the location you want to build and place one of your settlements there. You can build up to three settlements during this action.

If you place a settlement that completes a line of four, you get to place an additional settlement on top of the settlement just placed.

Additionally, if you build onto a location with a cow, you take the cow and place it on your player board. Cows can be used for cattle trade actions. If you are the first to build adjacent to a body of water, you take the canteen and place it on your player board. Canteens can be used to take an extra action, but only once.

If you don't build three settlements on your turn, take a silver for each settlement not built, for a maximum of two silver.

Building settlements is ultimately how you win the game. The first player to build all of their settlements is the winner of Montana!
 

...in addition to one of these actions, you can perform a cattle trade.

This action allows you to trade in a cow (if you have one) for one good of your choice, three silver, or one worker of your choice. This can be done ANYTIME during your turn and AS MANY times as you want. Go cows!

 

(physical components of Montana)

 

 

(for a more in depth look at The City, see rulebook below)

 

Your player board is where everything is kept and also references game setup and player actions.

(red player board)

 

(physical components of Montana)

 

 
Engish rules in revision - link here
 
 
Rahdo's Final Thoughts:


Rahdo's Gameplay Video:

Zee with The Dice Tower gives a 'Seal of Approval' to Montana.

 
Dan King shares about his enjoyable plays of Montana.
 
 Jeremy and David of Man vs. Meeple dive into the game.

 

The Game Boy Geek's Allegro Review
(under 3 minutes)

 

Customs, Duty, and VAT free shipping!

US - Free shipping
Canada - $7
Australia/New Zealand - $9

We have partnered with three great fulfillment companies to bring Montana Heritage Edition to you in a safe, timely, and courteous manner. Fulfillment to our US backers will be handled by Quartermaster Logistics here in the states. Backers in Canada will have their games fulfilled and shipped by the infamous Snakes & Lattes in Toronto. And Let's Play Games will handle the fulfillment and shipping for Australia and New Zealand from Sydney. We are thrilled to partner with these experienced companies to bring this game to you in the best ways possible!

With these location-friendly providers, you won't pay and customs, duty, or VAT fees!
